Going up with drizzle and down with slippery trail was quite challenging but it was worthwhile to see Annapurna and Machhapuchhre. Fortunately, I was able to see the beautiful scenery at MBC and ABC as the weather was getting clearer.in addition, I was fortunate to meet the best trekking guide, Santosh during my trip. He was knowledgeable, reliable, and responsible. Without his support and help, I had not been able to complete the trekking. I would give my big thank-you from my bottom heart to our porters, Amish and Punam. Good memory with them enriched my trip to ABC.I would love to come again, if possible, with my best guide Santosh and porters.
ABC Treking. One of my greatest travel of my life. Hard but worth it. Our guide Santosh was great. Managed the treking very well.

Annapurna circuit biking. Very good tour with excellent guide, Santosh.Enjoyed my time riding the Annapurna circuit, which has many challenges for bikers.From mudslides, steep climbs, up to overcoming the limited available oxygen at high altitudes, and even some snow biking.Well organized by Ace and Santosh, who, with his experience, made the trip look easy.

unforgettable. Ace provided us with everything we needed for an unforgettable experience trekking the Himalayas. Immediate turnaround time to every question we had before our trek, personalised support and maximum involvement throughout and after the trek, a guide, Rajan, whose competence, experience, flexibility and ability to cater for every whim of ours were unmatched and porters – Sujan, Poshan and Krishna - whose unwavering smiles cheered us at the end of each day. We are going back and we are choosing the same team for our next trek!

The roof of the world where my soul found a home.. I was fortunate to have an Ace the Himalaya guide by the name of Bharat on my Everest Base Camp trek and I could not be more fortunate for how amazing and life changing an experience this was. Bharat was patient, knowledgeable an absolutely wonderful and gentle soul. The experience, professionalism and top-notch hospitality of Ace the Himalaya is something I would highly recommend anyone trekking anywhere they offer their services. I came back from my trek with many memories that I will not only cherish and treasure but also help me when I need a reality check. I visited and saw the highest peak in the world, played soccer with monks, ate delicious Dhal-Bat and fell in love with the Sherpa people and their great culture. The trek was not easy but an experience this life-altering never is and never will be. I can say that my experience was enhanced because I booked with Ace the Himalaya.

Volunteer Program And Poon Hill Trek. The trip allowed a large group to successfully experience in 3 weeks what it was like to live in Nepal and how the locals spent there time there. Exploring the Annapurna conservation area was an unreal adventure. To top it all off the guides were very hospitable and informative. Highly recommended.

Arupokhari Volunteer Program. Definitely one of the best trips I have been on. We were guided by Santosh and Dipesh for the entire duration of the 3 week stay, where we began by volunteering in Ratmate village and ended with a beautiful trek up to Poon Hill. They have been extremely accommodating and friendly, ensuring that all our needs were met. I would definitely recommend Ace the Himalaya for anyone considering a guide when exploring Nepal.

GV trip 2016. Ace the himalayas surpassed all expectations we had for the trip. Would definitely recommend for anyone going to Nepal. From day one, we were greeted with a warm welcome by our friendly tour guides Santosh and Dipesh. We were then driven to our hotel, where all our rooms had already been sorted out, and everything went really smoothly. During the times that there were hiccups, our tour guide santosh was always there to help us out, and we were really grateful for having him around. During our stay at Ratamate Village, the cooks were excellent, tending to our smallest requests, and they served us juice and snacks daily. Not to mention, the food exceeded all expectations my team had for it, and Santosh would never fail to ask us if we had sufficient food and if he could help us in anyway. During the trek, Santosh and Dipesh never failed to entertain us with their humour, but more importantly they never stopped encouraging us to push harder until we reached our destinations. It was so amazing having such funny, sociable and knowledgeable guides, as they were able to answer many of the queries which we had. Although we didnt communicate much with our porters, they were always smiling, and never failed to help us out. Thank you santosh for making our trip to Nepal truly amazing, and always going the extra mile to help us in anyway possible. You were always attentive to the smallest details, and our trip wouldnt have been the same if not for you. You make us want to come back to Nepal to explore, and trek more. Thanks also for organising the mountain biking for the few of us even though this was not part of the trip. Definitely recommend Ace the Himalayas for anyone wanting to explore Nepal. Thanks for the memories

So well organised and fun!!. An amasing trip through Nepal starting with some volunteer trip and ending in a hike. Let my group really experience village life and see the beautiful sights of Nepal whilst also doing our bit. Our guide also really made the trip incredibly enjoyable.

UNSW GV Arupokhari Volunteer Program. We had an excellent time in Nepal during last three weeks. We had Santosh and Dipesh as our guides for the whole trip. This trip could not be so smooth and that fun without them. They picked us up at the airport when we arrived, arranged a day tour for us to show a few famous tourist attractions in Kathmandu, took a splendid care of us during the days in village & trekking. They even became our mountain bike tour guides to guide us exploring the countryside of kathmandu.The food and accommodation in both village and during trekking are unexpectedly good. The boys in the village cook good food, attentive to our every enquiry regardless it is a big or small problem and accommodate our needs and preferences to the best.The hosts of the guesthouses are super helpful as well, cook good food and very friendly. One of the hosts even invited us to watch and join his dance during our stay at his place. The atmosphere at that night was awesome; it is undoubtedly one of my highlights of this trip.Thanks to Santosh and Dipesh for accompanying us throughout the whole journey, could not have had better guides. I would choose Ace again for sure if I am going back to Nepal next time.

Arupokhari (Ratmate) volunteering trip - UNSW GV 2016. Our team of 17 University students, guided by Santosh and Dipesh, spent 3 amazing weeks in Nepal! On arrival, Ace picked us up from the airport and drove us to our hotel in the touristy Thamel district. The following day, Ace organised a city tour for us. This included a visit to Pashrupathi ( a world heritage site), Dhurba Square and the Monkey Temple. Our two week stay at Ratmate went all too fast! Saying goodbye to the beautiful village and locals was extremely hard. At all times, the cooks ensured we had enough to eat (and the food was delicious), accommodation was comfortable and we were given the opportunity of both re-contstruction, as well as teaching at a local secondary school. The locals were so friendly and accommodating. We were always met with big smiles and ‘namaste’s’ all round ( a common trait amongst Nepalese people). During our last week, we trekked from Nayapul to Poon Hill in Gorephani. Fortunately, we had 9 porters to carry our bags. Although we didn’t converse much with the porters, it was truly amazing to witness their strength and kindness towards us as well. Santosh and Dipesh were amazing guides during the trek! They encouraged us to keep on walking when the trail got difficult, and entertained us with stories of their lives and families. Ace organised comfortable and cosy accommodation at 3 guess houses, that truly exceeded my expectations. Our trip to Nepal would not have been the same without Ace, Santosh and Dipesh! It was truly a life-changing experience, and the best three weeks of my life. - Shakti S

EBC Trek: Could never do it without the dedication of Ace the Himalaya's Guide and Porter. Ace the Himalaya has proved to the most reliable tour company in Nepal. From the start of the enquiry, I was asking alof of questions to Prem, the MD. He religiously answered each and every one of them with much patience. It was a first hand experience of dedication that I experienced. My guide for the trek was Nimesh Nepal and porter, Dipak Thamang. Nimesh is an excellent guide, and a better friend, who made us feel safe in his care all the time. We were 2 ladies, so trust and comfort were important to us when assessing a guide, whom we have to be with for the next 12 days. Nimesh is very mature for his age, and very interestingly, he is able to switch from a professional, serious guide, to a friend who could make us laugh with his silly jokes. The strenuous, long, trek over 12 days were spent playing catching and throwing snowballs, discussing life values, drawing portraits, dancing in the snow, and so much laughing. We enjoyed every moment. During the times when the whether wasn't too good, Nimesh switched to a seemingly serious, professional guide whom we can depend on for safety and navigation. He was also taking care of his porter, Dipak very well, ensuring his safety. Just like how a leader should be.Dipak is a young 20 year old porter, who has such strength. He speaks minimal English, so we don't converse much. However, for many times, he went beyond his duties as a porter, and took care of us ladies by catching us when we fall, and staying back to walk slowly with us, rather than just walking at his usual fast speed and porting the bags from point A to point B. The entire experience was life-changing, amazing, and I give 10 stars..heck even 100 stars, for such excellent service. Thank you Ace the Himalaya!!

Great support on this trip!. I had incredible support on the EBC trek. First over e-mail from Prem to whom I asked many questions; then from Sajiyah in the office when I started to get cold feet about the trip and she explained all of my options and the flexibility of the guides; and finally, and most importantly, from Krish, the main guide who stuck with me the entire trip, even though I was way behind everyone else, and gave me constant encouragement. It is really because of him that I made it. He made me feel welcome and belonging even though I worried all the time about my slowness. He was smart and funny as well.

Amazing Trek into the Himalayan Wilderness!. I went solo and joined a group trek to Everest Base Camp and Kalapatthar. Ace the Himalaya did an amazing job making sure that we were well prepared for the trip and our lead guide, Raj, was hilarious as well as incredibly knowledgeable about the mountains, villages, and more importantly, the best ways to get us up/down from altitude safely. We were incredibly blessed with great weather during the off season, and had an absolutely beautiful trekking experience.

Adventure Multi-Sport..All the adventure you can ask for... We booked the multi-sport adventure tour because we wanted to see more of Nepal than just base camp. We went white water rafting, bungee jumping, mountain biking, hiking.. basically anything that ended in "ing". They took excellent care of coordinating all the events. Nepal is not a super easy place to travel with traffic that is extremely unpredictable, but they were able to accommodate for all of us. Chris was our tour guide and he was very knowledgeable and took our requests for travel changes and suggestions. Only thing I would recommend is to bring a little mask to combat the pollution/dust.

Unforgettable Rebuild Nepal & Annapurna Trek Tour!!!. I could not have made a better decision than to book the Rebuild Nepal and Annapurna Trek tour for my first trip to Nepal. Their customer service was great - my questions were always answered in a timely manner - and the pre-departure meeting made me feel like I was in great hands. Throughout the entire trip the guides and cooks were extremely professional, yet so much fun to be around. Santosh did a WONDERFUL job as a guide - everyone absolutely loved him - and the others on the trip were so much fun. Ace the Himalaya put together an itinerary that enabled me to get culture, physical activity, beautiful scenery, and a lot of fun into one trip - well done!! I highly recommend using Ace on your next trip to Nepal.

An incredible experience. Everest base camp is an beautiful place - but the people you're surrounded by make it great. Madan and Rabi were the best base camp guides you could ever wish for and treated me like one of the family. Ace the Himalaya did an excellent job providing information on preparation, travel, insurance etc and were always very responsive when i had questions. An incredible experience with incredible people.

Ace the Himalayas - Everest Base Camp Trek Review. Our EBC guide, Ram Hari, did a great job throughout the trek. He was extremely friendly, knowledgeable, and personable. The porters and assistant guide were also great. Always felt safe and comfortable with everything Ace the Himalayas did. Would recommend Ace to other people.

Adventure multi-sport. Ace the Himalaya provided me with one of the best experiences of my life. I had tons of fun and recommend the hotel upgrade options in Pokhara and Chitwan. Manoj, the main guide, was excellent and communicated the itinerary very well. I'm hoping to use them again for future treks in the Himalayas.

Trip of a lifetime!. Amazing! Incredible! Life changing! Beautiful! Challenging! I can go on and on!!! The company does a great job of communicating with you prior to the trip, during and even after the trip. They made me feel at ease even though this was my first over seas trip. The guides were by your side every inch of the way and made sure you got whatever you needed. Although the altitude made things a challenge, they made sure you had enough time to get acclimated. Prem runs a very professional business and I highly recommend him.

Easy to plan and top notch guides. I used Ace The Himalaya several different days and their guides Robbie, Krishna and Kumar were great! Ready to answer questions, and helpful!!
The communication via email before I got to Kathmandu made planning my days easy and everything was clear, no hidden costs, this is a fabulous service to use in Nepal!!!!

Trek to Everest Base Camp. My husband and I recently completed the EBC trek in May, and it was 100% the trip of a lifetime. We were paired with another couple that we absolutely loved and have become life-long friends with, and we cannot say enough amazing things about our guide, Suman. He went above and beyond every day to make sure we were comfortable, that all our many questions about the culture and areas we were in were answered, and that we were having the best time possible. And it worked! We plan to stay in touch with Suman as he is just a wonderful person in general, and hope we can come back to Nepal soon and try the Anna Purna Circuit with Ace and Suman! I also wanted to say that we met multiple like-minded trekkers along the way that we became friends with and compared our guides and companies, and without a doubt, Ace the Himalaya was the easiest to work with, offered the best prices, and they were so helpful getting everything set up for us both before and after the trek. Their whole team combined made what could have been a very complicated trip considering foreign travel, multiple groups, etc so organized and well managed.If you're looking for an adventurous trip with some of the most spectacular views in the world, a place to meet fantastic people, and a company that will help you do it- Ace is the place to go and Suman is the man to request!! You will not be disappointed with your trip- it's impossible, believe me!Crystal & NatMaine USA

13 day Rebuild Nepal and Annapurna Trek...just brilliant !. This was my first trip to Nepal and I am very happy that I did it with Ace . The whole experience was made easy because of them and their very caring staff. Our lead guide Santosh was amazing and took care of everything...I didn't have to worry about a thing. We started our trip with the rebuild program in Arupokhari where we helped with the early stages of the foundations. The work was hard but we all came together as a team and I found it to be one of the most rewarding things I have ever done. The cooks looked after us very well and ensured we were well fed...i celebrated my birthday on the rebuild and the cooks made me a birthday cake...a chocolate one at that! We left this amazing little village and went off to our next adventure which was our trek to Poon Hill...and all I can say is ...wow....words cannot express how fantastic it was. The scenery....the village life...even the numerous tea and guest houses we passed on our way up...and up we went! Santosh eased us all up there and when we finally got to Poon Hill we all sat in wonder....just magnificent. My whole experience in Nepal is hard to put into words but the mix of humanitarian work with a trek is a winner. I encourage anyone to do the 13 day rebuild and Annapurna trek with Ace. They just made everything so easy. I trust them which is why I have just booked the Everest Base Camp trek with them...I wouldnt do it with anyone else.

Rebuild and Poon Hill Trek - Amazing Experience!. My partner and I just got back from our first trip to Nepal with Ace the Himalaya, and it was amazing. I would say it was a once in a life time trip, but we were so impressed with Nepal and our experience with Ace (our guide, Santosh, was the best!) we have decided we are going back in a few years. We chose the Rebuild-Poon Hill Trek program through Ace, since it felt like one of the best ways to give back to a community that was devastated by the 2015 earthquake. Arrival and departure at the airport were taken care of by Ace, making travel days less stressful. Our drivers to get to the village of Arupokhari were very skilled, both navigating Kathmandu traffic and on the 4 wheel drive roads to the village. In the village we were housed in a tented camp, with comfortable sleeping pads provided. All the meals cooked for us were excellent, and there was always plenty of food. The green beans, while one of the more simple dishes, was one of the most memorable (probably due to all the butter and garlic!). Everything was always very tasty. Our volunteering work was helping to clear and level the foundation of the house, followed by helping with the early stages of foundation building. It was hard work, but very rewarding. Life in the village was also a rewarding experience. I did get sick while in the village (rookie mistake, don't drink the "safe drinking water" in the 5 gallon jugs at the airport), and Santosh was an excellent caregiver. He took me to the medical center in Aarughat and the Dr there knew exactly what to do. I was out of commission for one day of volunteering, but thanks to Santosh's quick actions to getting me to the medical center it was only one day. The trekking to Poon Hill was an equally amazing experience. We lucked out with the first break in clouds in a few days, resulting in a sunset hike as opposed to sunrise.All in all, we had an wonderful time with Ace the Himalaya. Santosh, our assistant guide Dipesh(spelling), the porters, cooks, and drivers were all fantastic. 10/10 would recommend, and we will be booking with Ace again when we come back in a few years! Technical recommendations: bring 3 passport pictures with you... Ace needs 2 and the travel visa needs 1. Water purification tablets were needed on the trek, either bring from home (what we did) or be prepared to buy in Pokhara. Trekking poles are recommended, you can cheap but reliable ones in Kathmandu or Pokhara for 800 rupees.

Rebuild Nepal and Annapurna Trek. Me and my brother had an amazing experience with Ace. We participated in the rebuild program where we were stationed in Arupokhari and helped the locals set up the foundation for one of the new homes Ace was building. We met lovely people from the village ranging from elders who would give us nepali tea to the children who would visit us during their breaks. Several days later we were hiking and looking amongst some of the best mountain ranges I've ever seen on top of Poon Hill. Definitely recommend it and Definitely ask for Santosh as a guide if you can. Trust me ;).

Everest Base Camp Trek with lead guide Kumar Thapa. My husband and I have only the best things to say about Ace the Himalaya and our experience trekking through beautiful Nepal. Our lead guide, Kumar Thapa, was incredibly helpful, supportive, friendly, informative and fun! We were always well taken care of by our guide and the assistant guide. It's tough work trekking at high altitude in unfamiliar places but our guide did a great job at helping to make our experience enjoyable and unforgettable. We will always be grateful to Kumar and the Ace the Himalaya team for being apart of our memories of the adventure of a lifetime!

Incredible Trip!. Amazing! My guides Dil, Hem and Ram all took excellent care of me. All very knowledgeable in all things Nepal. My driver Ganesh, well, you couldn't ask for a better one. Everyone was extremely helpful, generous and kind. Nepal itself was beyond my expectations. Ace the Himalaya went above and beyond to make my visit worthwhile. I will definitely be back and will sign on with them again

Nepal - Scenery, Challenge plus Culture. Our recent trip to Nepal April / May 2016 was enriched by our excellent local guide Nemish from Ace the Himalaya His willingness to answer our probing questions on not just Nepal but his own life enabled us to learn plenty. Culture is an experience in itself and the stark contrast with ours in the land of Oz added so much to what was a fantastic trip. Nimesh used his experience to ensure not a wasted minute. Look forward to meeting him again when next we visit Nepal.

Amazing trekking experience. From my initial inquiry to the departure from Kathmandu we received only but the best service from this company. All my inquiries were answered very specific and promptly. Sajiya was my contact person and she dealt with our booking, customized trekking package and special requests in a very professional way. It just gives one the reassurance that you are dealing with a company that knows their stuff. Manoj was assigned as our trekking guide and we had 3 porters, Kalika, Sandip and Krishna. We could not have asked for better- supportive, friendly and very willing to help when the road got tough (and it did!!). We could not have asked for a better support system! Thank you guys!!! Accommodation overall were good, some places probably the best what one can expect. Thorough research is essential, especially when you are a first time trekker in the Himalayas. We trekked from Lukla to Tendboche( had time constraint) and looking back it was the most amazing experience ever. I highly recommend this company and thanks to all for making this such a memorable experience.

14- day Annapurna Base Camp Trek. Amazing! I was a solo-woman traveller and very nervous to do this trip on my own. However, as soon as I landed in Kathmandu I was greeted by my amazing guide, Rajkumar! He was very kind, and super enthusiastic! Right away I was brought to the beautiful hotel, and people treated me like family! Kathmandu is overwhelming, especially to a solo-traveller, but they answered all of my questions and made sure I was comfortable. The actual trek was incredible. The views and the people you meet will change your life. The accommodations were perfect, and my guide always made sure I had the best room available! This company is truly a step above anyone else! My only regret is that I didn't stay longer! Be brave, and sign up for this trip with Ace, you won't regret it!
Everest Base Camp Trek. Great experience! Our guide - Madan - was a pleasure to trek with! Funny and informative. Can't wait to get back out there and use Ace the Himalaya again!

Annapurna trek and Pokhara. Resham our guide was fantastic, he showed us round Pokara. We visited The Davis Falls, the bat caves, the Tibetan refugee camp,and the Gurkha Museum . It was great to be shown these places by such an enthusiastic and knowledgable guide who also had a wonderful sense oh humour. A really memorable day.

amazing company. Ace the himalaya did a great job on the organisation of this wonderful journey! We all had a great time, it was such a pleasure to meet all the friendly and humorous people of nepal. Our experienced and committed guide Bharat, never lost his kindness or ran out of patience. Also I want to mention the absolutely polite and friendly and so helpful porters. From the time I arrived, until the time I left, I was in very good hands and all the time feeling very welcome!!It was definitely one of the best trips I´ve ever made and the team of ace the himalaya played an important part!
fabulous tour guide. Kumar was a fabulous guide for various attractions around Kathmandu and beyond. Personable and excellent customer service. He is extremely organized whilst being flexible. +++

A genuine company, highly recommended. Myself and husband booked on the rebuild and Poon Hill Trek for 13 days with Ace the Himalaya. From the time of enquiring till we arrived home we have had first class service Prem and his team have both their people and visitors close to their hearts. Due to postponement from others we were the only 2 on this trip. Our guide Ramhari was the best, so knowledgeable and really looked after us from day 1 to departure. Thumbs up for Furi our cook who made fantastic meals though too much, Sukra who was a great off roader who got us safely to and from the village and not forgetting Sushanta who carried our bags. A huge thankyou to you guys.The village was an rewarding experience and trek hard but great, though more days with scenery would have been good but unfortunately out of ACE's control.Hotels in Kathmandu and Pokhara were of good standard and tea houses on trek comfortable/If you are looking for adventure in Nepal I highly recommend Ace, and look forward to using them again in future

Great company. These guys are amazing! I heard from others on the trail ACE is one of the few honorable companies who wont do you wrong for kickbacks. I totally agree. Our guide was incredible an genuinely cared for our welfare. Made us feel it was about the experience and not the money...great hearts looking our for you. Will ONLY recommend ACE to friends and family.

Trek to Everest Base Camp. All of my thanks to Prem Khatry and the professional team members of Ace the Himalaya! My journey began with a flight from SFO to IST to KTM. When I touched down at KTM I was picked up by Ace the Himalaya and taken to the Gaju Hotel. Then after a days rest we went back to KTM to fly to Lulka to begin our journey to Everest base Camp with lead guide Kumar Thapa and his team. Awesome rugged experence. Well planned, safe trekking practices and very educational guide. I plan on returning to do this trek in two years with my daughters. Many thanks again!

Adrenaline and culture- so much fun!. This trip was excellent- Ace the Himalaya is a top-notch tour operator, and our guide and driver were incredibly knowledgeable and fun. We learned so much about Nepal, and in particular, the wonderful city of Pokara. From there, we whitewater rafted, bungee jumped, paraglided, hiked to Sarankot for a view of the Annapurna, and did some spectacular sightseeing. If you're looking for adventure but prefer a hotel to tent travel, I would absolutely recommend Ace.

Challenging trip of a lifetime!!. The trip across the Himalayas was awesome with great and varied sceneries across the Himalayan wilderness and travelling over many suspensions bridges over raging rivers. The trek was challenging in some parts but was well worth the effort to reach base camp. Ace the Himalayas were very professional in their handling of the various needs of the trekkers in our group, especially catering to the needs of those who were not as fit as other trekkers. Special mention and thanks go to Man-Singh who guided us through the whole journey and provided great commentary on the culture and various interesting sites. A very special thanks also to Sandeep who volunteered to carry my backpack when I experienced altitude sickness on a couple of days (excellent touch!). Accommodation was basic but generally comfortable and the food served was nourishing. I would certainly recommend Ace the Himalayas to those thinking of experiencing a Himalayan mountain trekking adventure.

Sightseeing, History, Culture. This trip was fantastic. I learned so much about Nepal and all of its beauty. Without this tour, I would have missed out on so much. From art schools to temples, every subject was covered! I wish I could have stayed longer. Ace puts together a fabulous and thorough program with the utmost professional staff.

Great time in the Himalayas. We had the best time trekking in the Himalayas in March 2016. The accomodations are rustic but the atmosphere and environment can't be beaten! We had Mansingh and Kamal as our guides and they were awesome, they worked very hard to ensure all needs were met. Shout out to Dev and Sandip for being excellent porters. The trip was very well organized in general. I would recommend Ace The Himalayas to anyone thinking about a Himalayan adventure.

Everest base camp trek- best time ever!. My friend and I went on the Everest base camp trek with Ace the Himalayas. We had the most amazing time. It was by far the hardest thing we have ever done, but it was well worth it. We both got quite sick from food poisoning and a chest infection but felt so well looked after by our guides Mansingh and Kamal. Mansingh was full of knowledge and was always so helpful with any questions or queries we might have. He's was a load of fun and I'm glad we had him as a guide, he definitely made the trip that much more enjoyable. The trip was very well organised and was very impressed considering we had 17 Trekkers (who were all amazing). Thanks ace!

11 Day Adventure Tour. Ace the Himalaya was incredibly supportive from reopening the booking to accommodate more friends traveling to coordinating a wonderful trip. All activities and time spent in various locations was well planned so it didn't feel like you had to pack everything up every night and move to a new location; there was time to relax, settle, and explore on your own. The guides were very well spoken, considerate of well being, and I don't think the trips would be possible without the excellent drivers shuttling the group to each location safely. This was truly a wonderful experience with additional excursions and adventures available. (Cliff diving while rafting, flights to view Mount Everest, and extended hikes around Chitwan National Park)Ace the Himalaya was a wonderful way to experience Nepal offering a variety of experiences to every skill set of adventurer!

Once in a Lifetime!. Going into my Everest experience, I had done my research to know Ace was incredibly well-reviewed and they certainly lived up to that expectation. Our guide, Mansingh, and his excellent staff were amazing shepherds for our group as we made it to Everest Base Camp. Not only were we in safe hands, we learned culture and history, and Ace was incredibly responsive and accommodating throughout a challenging, incredible experience. Couldn't recommend more!

Taking Care of Details!. The trip was well planned, organized, and they took care of all the extra behind the scenes details to get from point A to B. The tour guide in Pokhara was excellent - he knew the history, local perspective, and share current Nepali views and issues, making the tour not only about history but the present. It was a well rounded tour I would do again.

14 day Mt. Everest Base Camp Trek & Kathmandu City Tour. My friend and I used Ace The Himalaya for our trek to Mt. Everest Base Camp in February of 2016. We had the best service, and the absolute best guide in the world (Ramhari). If / when people ask about my trip, I highly recommend Ace The Himalaya.

Well organised!. I chose Ace the Himalaya for my first solo trek to Poon Hill because they could tailor my trek to fit into a 7-day itinerary as I have a busy work schedule. I was picked up at the airport in Kathmandu from a staff of the company and was taken straight to the hotel without fuss and then to the office to be briefed about my trek which started the next day from Pokhara. Everything was well organized and my itinerary was well planned out and my flight to Pohkara was also arranged by the company. My guide and porter picked me up upon my arrival into Pokhara and everything went smoothly from there! The guide Nimesh and porter Dipak were the most amazing people- caring, helpful and constantly watchful over me. They were incredible in the knowledge of the mountains, the trails and culture and could answer all my questions with conviction. They stayed by my side while I kept a slow and steady pace as the terrain was rather challenging. The guesthouses chosen for me were clean and the rooms and food were of great quality. The uphill climb was quite demanding but my guide always made sure I was okay and checked on me all the time if I needed a break. Always patient and always with a great sense of humour too. I learnt so much about the the Nepalese culture from them. I am so pleased at the quality of staff provided by the company. The downhill was another difficult challenge but they were never far from me. The hotels provided by the company in Kathmandu and Pokhara were excellent too. I was very pleased with the choices and the rooms they put me in. I will definitely choose them again for my next trek which will be likely Annapurna Base Camp!

The most spectacular adventure!!!. We had one of our group recommend Ace after dealing with them a year prior, and we were not let down. They make sure that everything is taken care of no matter how short or long the trip, and ensure that tourists really get to know the real Nepal and see how much beauty it has to offer.Our guide, Santosh will forever remain a close friend that I stay in contact with, he became the newest member of our little group. He and the other guides made sure we were as comfortable as possible and enjoying everything around us. Seeing Nepal the way we did will be one of the highlights for the rest of my life, it was the most grandest of adventures and I would not change a single moment of it! I highly recommend Ace The Himalaya for anyone eager enough and adventurous enough to trek across this beautiful country, or be crazy like us and mountain bike it!

Incredible experience in Annapurna!. After researching several trekking tour companies we opted for Ace the Himalaya and we were very happy with the service we received. The initial email correspondence was terrific; quick responses and informative advice. From aiport to hotel to mountain to airport, we received guidance throughout our entire twelve days in Nepal. We began with an excellent day trip around Kathmandu in a comfortable van and a fantastic guide named Dil. We felt very reassured after having a pre-trek meetig with Prem, the managing director, who went over the itinerary with us and answered our questions. The trek itself was incredible. We went with the 6-day trek through Annapurna. Despite our beginner-to-intermediate trekking ability, we were well taken care of and didn't feel pressured to walk at a pace we were uncomfortable with. Our guide, Kamal, made for fantastic company. He was very knowledgeable about the mountains and very helpful throughout the trek with everything from guidance through tricky terrain to recommending food. Similarly our porter was fantastic; very polite and made for good company. Overall we had an amazing experience with Ace the Himalaya and would recommend it to anyone considering a trek.

Ace brings the goods!. Ace brings a top notch experience as they share a Nepal experience like no other. The guides are top notch, and the destination could not have been more welcoming. The team at Ace from cooks, to porters, to guides, to the home office made sure that everything was lined up and taken care of. They chose the coziest of tea houses, and arranged the tastiest of meals throughout. There may be many guide companies to choose from in Nepal, but I would never look at, or hesitate to recommend Ace over other companies after the experience that the Ace team provided. Hopefully you are lucky enough to get Santosh or Yem as your guide. If not, rest assured that Prem has staffed his company with a group of smart, fun, compassionate, dedicated individuals who will give you the best taste of Nepal, no matter what adventure you choose.

Ace is the Place!. A group of 9 friends trekked to the Mt Everest Base Camp in January 2016. A lot of people questioned our sanity, Trekking in January, but the weather was perfect, mostly cloudless days and only one day of snow. There were few people of the trail so it was very peaceful and added to the feeling of being away from civilization. Temperatures were cold in the early morning and at night, but once the sun came out, it was near perfect temperature for hiking. Prem runs a well organized organization. His staff was right on time to pick us up at the airport. They were helpful in helping us find last minute gear and trekking items that we needed. I might add that EVERYTHING you need for a trek like this is available in the Thamel, tourist area at 25% to 50% of what you would pay in the states. It is all chinese copies of the originals, backpacks, coats, gloves, sleeping bags etc, available at a fraction of what I paid in the states. I realize that the quality may not be quite as good as the originals, but unless you are a professional trekker, save the money and help the Nepalese economy. If I were to do it all over, I would have arrived with only my broken in hiking boots and and empty suitcases. The amount I would have saved on gear, would have paid for my trek.Nepal is in a state of turmoil right now. It is surrounded on three sides by India and China (Tibet) on the north. Since the Earthquake, the high mountain pass from China into Nepal is closed. Nepal imports virtually everything from India. India does not approve of the new Nepalese constitution and with one of their political parties which is trying to be less reliant on India, so India has created a blockade on exports into Nepal. This has made gas, diesel and propane very difficult to obtain. There are lines two days long from people waiting to purchase 5 liters of gasoline for their scooters and motorcycles and 10 liters for their cars. If you need more gasoline, people are paying as much as $20 a gallon on the black market. It also created an electrical shortage, There were planned blackouts and we generally only had electricity for 10 or 12 hours a day. This makes for a difficult environment to live in or run a business. I am sure that this is a temporary issue and the two governments will work it out soon, but even operating under these difficult conditions, Ace The Himalaya, kept things running smoothly. It was business as usual, they got us out to our different side tours right on time, kept us well fell and absorbed all the additional operating expenses they were experiencing.All of the Ace team took great care of our group. The office staff was well organized and friendly, our guide Kumar and his assistant Kamal were great. They were true professionals/ They always had a smile on their faces and kept our group of 9 hikers with different skill and experience levels together.We had two 70 year old men in our group, they kept them at the right pace, helped them with their backpacks when needed and made sure that everyone made it to base camp. This is not an easy trek, it was much more demanding than any of us realized, but they helped us all make it to Base Camp.Our porters were amazing. I am still in awe, that these young men were carrying 70 to 90 pounds on their backs, up and down difficult terrain, always smiling! and they would beat us to our next stopping point to have lunch or dinner ready for us as soon as we got there. The trek was amazing!, The landscape and scenery were beyond description. I took thousands of pictures and I could not capture the complete beauty before my eyes. It must be experienced to comprehend. I simply cannot give these guys enough praise. If you have ever thought about visiting the Himalayas. DO IT! meet the great people of Nepal. Experience this diversity of cultures and religions. Help out these great people in their post earthquake time of need. Help bring in tourist money and give them the jobs they need to rebuild their lives and their Country. Do not think of using anyone else for your trek. Ace the Himalaya is a first class act. Book with them and be confident that you found the best. Experience the Himalayas! I have traveled a lot and this trip was an unforgettable, life changing experience.

Trip to Annapurna Base Camp - 2nd Fabulous Trek with Ace Tours. This was my second time trekking with Ace, this time to Annapurna Base Camp. Whilst i previously traveled with a friend and a small group to Everest Base Camp , I returned on this occasion with my teenage daughter , a close friend and his teenage son - a good number for trekking. As before we met several different people and groups along the way - so much fun and so interesting and entertaining ! Ace were as on my previous trip absolutely fantastic and professional. From the staff and management in Kathmandu to our wonderful guide Kumar, our trip was unforgettable . On our arrival in Kathmandu we were met by Ace and transferred to our hotel, the Gaju Suites which was clean and centrally located in Thamel. The rooftop bar/ restaurant is particularly good. We then transferred by minivan to Pokhara , a challenging 5 hour drive (!) and then after a night's stay to the Annapurna base camp trek for 9 days . The trek itself takes in some magnificent scenery, staying at little hotels/ tea house houses throughout. Best to be a vegetarian in the mountains :) It's hard to praise Ace and particularly our guide Kumar enough . The team make the trip to this amazing country so enjoyable and unforgettable . Whilst the trekking can be challenging its more than worthwhile and a visit to Nepal leaves a deep and lasting impression. I've no doubt that we will return to Nepal again soon and will most certainly trek again with the team from Ace . Many thanks to Prem , Kumar and our wonderful porters - Namaste !

Everest Base Camp - trek of a lifetime. My wife and I undertook a trek to Everest Base Camp in December 2015 with Ace the Himalaya and we cannot recommend this tour company highly enough. From meeting our guide Madan upon our arrival to being returned back to the airport following our trek, we were attended to at every stage. We were taken to the company offices for a briefing of what to expect and to go over the itinerary where it was obvious that AtH were experts in this type of trek. We immediately felt confident and at ease that our trip would be a success at a time when we were a little nervous about our undertaking.We have to single out our guide Madan for particular thanks - his reassurance, patience and knowledge were invaluable to us and we left him after our trek with a heavy heart. Everything he did for us felt like it was done out of friendship, rather than as part of his role. Our porter Prakass was also a great addition to the group - he ferried our duffel bags to each teahouse we stayed at, effortlessly it seemed despite the incline of the hills we were climbing, and always with a smile on his face.This really was the holiday of a lifetime for us but it was made extra special by the excellent organisation of AtH but moreso because of the incredible service delivered by its staff. When we return to Nepal, we will definitely be using AtH as our tour operator and will request Madan to rejoin us on a trek.Many thanks to Prem and all his staff for an amazing trek.

I'll never forget this trip. What a trip. I did 10 days (I know this heading says day tours but I couldn't find another option.) I travelled in January after the earthquake, so it was just me and the guide, Sunil. Sunil and I were brothers: 40K of biking every day and a combination of resorts and tea houses gave me the full perspective of Nepalese lifestyle. The biking was followed up by a four hour drive to Chitwan, where another guide named Krishna led me on a day-long safari through Chitwan National Park. I also spent three nights in Kathmandu. I can't imagine getting more bang for my buck on a trip. Highly recommend.

Excellent tour of Kathmandu valley. Had a brilliant day trip after volunteer re-build program with an excellent guide and driver! Visited Dubar Square, The Monkey Temple, Pashupatinath Temple, Boudhanath Stupa and Ason Market. Extremely professional, knowledgeable and friendly guide whose enthusiasm was contagious. Had a brilliant day and saw far more than I would if I had done this tour independently. Would highly recommend both this tour and Ace the Himalaya!

Fantastic - Highly Recommended. As both a solo and first-time traveler to Nepal, I was not only concerned about just seeing the sights, but also about my safety, my health, getting around, and not making mistakes that would jeopardize my adventure. I could not speak highly enough of Ace and its staff. Kedar provided so much information about the history of Nepal, the people, the religions, and, of course, the sights we visited. He is such a sweet and patient man. He even guided me in my shopping excursions to purchase authentic and handmade mandalas, mala beads, and healing bowls. My trek on the EBC trail was amazing. Raj took care of everything including providing a hot water bottle for a particularly cold night. He was always "protecting" me (in terms of the food, water, and physical elements of the trek, not in others doing harm to me...that was never a concern) while he let me do my own thing and go at my own pace. I was able to sort of experience trekking on my own while having what felt like a guardian angel in sight. If you want company, he's there. If you want to walk alone, he lets you do that too. Great guide and all around good guy! I will use Ace again when I return!

Ghorka rebuild w/ trek to poon hill. This trip is worth every penny. The rebuilding experience in ghorka was eye opening and I enjoy every minute. Ace so far has helped complete two homes for large families and we began the foundations for a third. It was hard work but the families in the village constantly offer food and drink, making you feel welcome. Ace also supplies delicious food (cooked by a very friendly chef named Pemba). And when all the hard work is done for the day, I played football with the kids when they were out of school. I decided to do this trip solo, make myself to meet new people, and the Ace guide brought me in like family. Santosh is an amazing guide and constantly is working to make sure everyone taken care of. The second half of the trip was trekking to poon hill, and again Santosh makes sure the lodge is friendly/accommodating. Of course for this portion we required porters to carry the heavier bags. Their names were Dipess and Rufess, both were always smiling and went as fast or slow as the group required. Overall I will recommend this trip to everyone. It's one thing to visit Nepal and trek, like most do. However with the addition of rebuilding homes you become more a part of their community and have a more fulfilling experience. Ace offers all this and the bonus of an excellent staff. This is a trip I will never forget

A perfect guided tour to Pangboche. Our trip to Pangboche (from Lukla) was very well organized and our Guide (Kishore Neupane - Krish) was very helpful and always friendly and we were very happy during the whole tour.I can highly recommend ACE the Himalaya, represented by Mr. Prem (who gave us also very good informations and was also very helpful and assisted us) and shall definetely book again my next tour with ACE the Himalaya.

Everest Base Camp. We had two friends do the same tour the year before, and they were so enthusiastic that we had to sign up. Ace the Himalaya did not disappoint. We had a spectacular time. Our guides, Madan and Rabi, were very attentive, fun and kind. They kept us engaged and informed of the beautiful surroundings, and the lodging and tea houses we used were well-chosen in good locations. If we get to return, we'll definitely use Ace to help set up our visit.

Raj is Best. Prem has it figured out. Don't worry. He has an excellent team around him. If you need gear, buy it in KTM - except for footwear. Gear quality is usually not quite as good, but sometimes better. For the price, it is an excellent value. The locals will thank you. I wish I would have know that before going. Plus, it is fun to practice your barter skills. Dumb goras.The Lukla flight allows 15kg per person in gear TOTAL. If you are over, it is 100 Nepali per kilo. Keep it light for the porters. Poor suckers, you know they won't be seeing hardly any of the candy you are packing. Don't eat the yak cheese. Yaks don't produce cheese.People will find you far more interesting after this trip. You will have something exciting to talk about, finally. You will remember this forever.Have a tea for me.

EBC 14 Day Trek. The Everest Base Camp Trek was truly extraordinary! I booked this trek through theclymb.com while the trek was on sale, and was skeptical, but all of my concerns were unwarranted. Ace of the Himalayas is a excellent company, they were on top of everything, from picking me up from the airport to making sure we had lodging, food, transport, everything! I cannot say enough good things about my experience, and the wonderful people I met. Our guides, Kumar and Kumar were truly wonderful. Thank you!

EBC. Ace was very organized, the guides are knowledgeable and friendly, and the office was quick to respond to emails and questions. Their pricing is also very reasonable. I definitely recommend using them!

Everest Base Camp. My first time in Nepal, and I felt very well taken care off by the staff and team at Ace the Himalaya and I will definitely use them again the in the future. Staff seemed to know the names of every peak along the way, and never tired of our near-constant peppering of questions. Guide Raj and Asst Guide Depak were spirited and fun companions, and were discretely (& carefully) watching each clients safety without fail.

Everest Base Camp. On our day trekking to Namche Bazaar we walked for hours, over high suspension bridges with amazing scenery and the sound of bells from the animals. One of our group was struggling and our guide Milan stayed behind with him and encouraged him to that he could make our destination. This trip was one of the most worthwhile, exciting, challenging experiences of my life and I would recommend it to everyone.

ABC 14 Day Trek. This was my first trek, but I went with friends who were experienced. We all had a fabulous experience with Ace. Our guide, Santosh, and porters, Sujan and Sudip, were very kind and helpful throughout the entire trip. We had a few minor injures that slowed our pace, but they still kept us on track with the itinerary, allowing those of us at a quicker pace to move ahead while helping the slower ones makeup time. The accomodations and food were much better than I had anticipated. Of course, be prepared for bare minimum as you move further up the mountain, but everything was clean and the people were always very courteous and accomodating.Follow the equipment list Ace provides and you should be great. If you are young and athletic or live at altitude, this particular trek will not be too big of a challenge. If not, I would reccomend some incline and stair climber training to be prepared for a few of the grueling days of nonstop incline/decline.

Village in need. Traveling to Nepal was an adventure in and of itself. To say that I had been half way across the world on a whim was a story that I couldn't wait to tell my friends. However, while booking the trip, I never could have imagined what a profound experience it would turn out to be.

Mountain Biking. Went on a 7 day mountain biking expedition around the Kathmandu Valley. It was one of the most intense and beautiful things I have ever experienced. Our guide, Santos, was amazingly knowledgeable and extremely helpful. He was very friendly and I felt like we had been friends for way longer than a week by the time the trip was through. All I've been thinking about since I returned is how I can get back there and do it again. Absolutely amazing trip!

Amazing experience!. Thank you, Ace the Himalaya for such an incredible experience! Our guide, Krish and his team did a fantastic job ! Now that my son and I are back to our daily busy schedule it feels like our visit to Nepal was just a beautiful dream. Thank you, Krish for making this trip unforgettable. We are hoping to come back soon!

"Why Not?!" - Words of Wisdom from my guide, Madan. From the moment that I chose to book with Ace the Himalaya, the team helped me in every and any way! Prem set me up for success before I landed in Nepal. Madan, well words can not quite describe how awesome he is! Madan made the hike from Lukla all the to Everest Base Camp beyond memorable! Then there is Rabi. Rabi made every moment happy and joyful despite the occasional lack of oxygen. All in all, these are the people you want taking you to the Top of the World!

EBC 14 Day Trek - Amazing trip!. My brother and I just completed the 14-day EBC with Ace and had an amazing trip with great service throughout from Ace the Himalaya. Everything was well organized and scheduled and don't believe it could have gone any smoother. All the accommodations were better than expected.As for the trip itself; it is a once in a lifetime experience to be able to trek through the Himalayas and see the top of the world. The trail itself is well maintained as were the locations where we stopped. We did not experience any negative issues due to the earthquake aftermath, so do not let that be a deterrent. We couldn't ask for better guides (Raj and Dipak). They were extremely knowledgeable and accommodating the entire trek. Raj even accompanied us back to the airport when departing Kathmandu!The EBC trek is an amazing adventure and we are so glad to have book it through Ace the Himalayas. It was also great to be able to support the local economy after the earthquake, since tourism is down. Another reason to go through Ace since they are a local company. Definitely book this trip as you won't regret it

Breath-taking landscape, self-less culture, and outstanding people!!. Annapurna base camp trek was gorgeous and simple. Especially when you have a guide like ours. Santosh knew his way around, perfect distances between breaks, and help our group out a lot due to the language barrier. It was a trip made by the experience and helpfulness of ACE.

Once in a lifetime experience - highly recommend!. From start to finish, this was an incredible experience. The excursion was extremely well-planned and well-organized. The guides and team of porters were exceptional (thank you Mansingh!) and I can't commend them enough. Ace took all of the worry out of this trip - we trekkers were able to take the time to fully enjoy and absorb the magic of the Himalayas - which we all did. Thank you Ace!

Everest Base Camp trek. We just completed an amazing trek to Everest Base Camp and Kala Patthar with Ace the Himalaya. From the planning stages, I appreciated the great communication with the Sajiya the Operations Manager while we were still in the United States. She made sure all our questions were answered and that we received reassurances about the state of things in Nepal after the earthquake and the fuel shortage. I'm so glad that we did not give into fear and cancel or alter our trip. Everything worked out fine and the country is determined to keep a good level of service for tourism. We were met by a driver on our arrival to Kathmandu and that made the transition to the hotel very easy. The accommodations set up on this trip were clean and comfortable. Ace provided plenty of support during the trek. Our lead guide Kishore was so helpful, encouraging, and fun as he lead our group to the top. He had much to offer in terms of history and geography of the area. The porters that carried our gear were helpful and cheerful and were well treated by the company. Our gear arrived before us every day without fail. Everyone in our group made it successfully to Everest Base Camp including a 12 year old boy and an amazingly fit and accomplished 68 year old. The scenery on the trek was so beautiful, but I would definitely say that being part of this group made it infinitely more enjoyable. It's a great way to travel. Definitely check out Ace the Himalaya- you will a see a highly professional company run by local people who are invested in the community and are giving back and supporting areas in need across Nepal.

Excellent trip, excellent organization and of course an excellent guide!. All was excellent !Everything was well organized, i was very satisfied.Also my Guide Santosh, he knows a lot about many local thing, a very friendly and reiable person.All over all: I was one of my best trip!Many thanks to all from ACE, specially to Santosh!!!

Great trip - no downside. Did the Everest Base Camp trek with Ace - seriously impressive service, couldn't have wanted more. Milan was the best guide possible - constantly looking after us, always ready to answer any questions, and went out of his way to help whenever needed. Assistant guide Rabi and all the porters were equally as helpful. Will bring my family back here one day and will book with Ace.

Ryder, highlight - everything. I highly recommend this company. The service was excellent. Milan and Robbie went well beyond what we expected to make our time very special. It was my first trip to Nepal and when I go back again will definitely book with Ace . Very good value for money.

Yet Another Brilliant Trip!. This is my third trip with Ace The Himalaya. And it went off as perfectly as the previous two. I saw some brilliant sights - from city monuments, to beautiful mountain scenery, to amazing monasteries. I'd like to really thank my guide Sunil who took great care of me through the tricky bits (and there were a few this time!) and was always looking to get me the best accommodation and make sure I was comfortable. And also to my porter Elsan who was always smiling. Together they made our time together a trip of a lifetime. Special mention must go to them, and Ace The Himalaya, for running the trip as planned despite the major fuel shortages across the country - the impromptu jeep trip that Sunil arranged was a 'memorable experience' . If you are looking for a trip in Nepal that is reliable, well organised with professional, friendly and knowledgeable staff, then you will not go wrong in choosing Ace The Himalaya.

Everest Base Camp Trek. This was an amazing trek in the Himalayas which culminated in reaching Everest Base Camp and an early morning hike up to Kalapatter Pass at 5,555 m. A truly memorable experience and a definite bucket list trip of a life time.

"Sightseeing". First time to Nepal, saw the ratings of ACE on Trip Advisor and we used them. Excellent. They were very accommodation and helpful in all our needs and met all our expectations.The trip was wonderful and the guides very knowledgable.Bauman's from FL

Incredible!. We spent 14 days with ACE going to Everest Base Camp and had the most incredible time! The Himalaya mountains are something that everyone should see in their lifetime. I don't typically enjoy group trips but this one was fantastic. I was nervous about the elevation and altitude illness but I felt like our guides Madan and Rabi were phenomenal and took great care of our group. They were fun, professional, encouraging and safe. I'm already looking forward to planning another trip with them.

Trip of a lifetime!. I cannot say enough about Madan and Rabi from Ace the Himalayas. Madan, our guide, is extremely knowledgeable (he's been doing this for around 15 years, first as a porter, then assistant guide, and now guide), constantly checked in to see how we were doing, laughed with us constantly, and was with us from the time we arrived at the airport until he escorted us back when we left (even though that was 2 days before and 3 days after the trek ended). Rabi, our assistant guide, is one of the kindest, gentlest souls I've ever met. He was the "frontman" in the group each day and worked to pace us, he waited on us hand and foot at the guesthouses even when we begged him to sit down and take a break, and he constantly worried about each and everyone of us (someone in the group got sick and was sleeping in his room and he went to the room to check on him and got his sleeping bag off the floor and wrapped him in it). Madan and Rabi will forever be cherished friends and thank god for facebook for allowing us to keep in touch. In addition, Ace the Himalayas, is hands down the best touring company I've ever used. I cannot imagine this trip without them coordinating every single detail. It went off without a single hitch, which is really tough to do when you're hiking to Everest Base Camp.

Experience Of A Lifetime. Trekking with Ace the Hmalaya was wonderful and truly an experience of a lifetime. We trekked to Everest Base Camp and also Kalapatther Pass, 18,200'. Our guides and porters were very professional and helpful in so many ways. I highly recommend them.
Everest Base Camp Hike. Amazing trek and a memorable experience! We were looked after well on the trip and had a fantastic hiking group which made the journey lots of fun!

Combo - village rebuild and trek. I signed on to the the Project Rebuild Nepal and Annapurna Trek and it was a perfect balance.... a humanitarian trip with my fix for adventure. Ace the Himalaya is a first-class tour company and personally ensures that you have the best possible experience. Our guides Santosh and Yam were awesome and I hope to see them again for a return trip.

Sightseeing Tour. I had always dreamed of going to Nepal, and this year I was finally able to make it a reality. I found out about Ace the Himalaya through a website called The Clymb, but booked my tour directly through Ace. The tour went off without a hitch. To say that Ace the Himalaya and my guide Suman are professionals and experts in what they offer and do is an understatement. Every detail of the tour was very well thought out and planned in advance...all I had to do was show up! Everything about the tour met or exceeded my expectations, and I look forward to my next tour with Ace the Himalaya. If you are planning a visit to Nepal I wouldn't look any further than Ace the Himalaya. Great experience!

Wonderful trip to EBC!. World-class service from beginning to end. From the purchase all the way to seeing us off to the airport home. Our guides and porters were professional and courteous, and the trip was perfectly planned! Can't recommend them highly enough!

Everest Base Camp Tour. If there is a trip that you must make in your life time this is it. I keep looking at my pictures, they are amazing. Yet they do not do justice to the splendour of taking it in with my own eyes. I am hooked now and hope to one day summit this mountain.My guide Ram was knowledgeable and friendly. His second in command Dep was an amazing mountaineer. It is a difficult trek, but their experience, constant attention and encouragement made it extremely enjoyable. They were highly competent and I had complete faith in them to keep us safe.If you are looking for 5 star accomodation this trip is not for you. But the accomodation was much better then I expected and the food was plentiful. After a long day of hiking the guides would not retire to have their meal. Instead they waited on us until they were sure that we had our fill and anything else that we desired. I have never been so well looked after.I thought we were lucky that we had such exceptional guides. But on the trek we met and hiked with two other groups that were also touring with Ace the Himalayas. Their guides were also friendly and, from all reports, just as amazing as our own.I was lucky enough to do this trek with some of my best friends. I witnessed my friends' proposal to his fiance, 5364 m above sea level.This trip has changed my life. I lost a dear friend prior to the trip. I started the trek stooped with the weight of the world on my shoulders. Each day as I climbed towards Everest, was like a balm on my soul. By the end of the trek I felt rejuvenated. Able to take on all my troubles, with a smile on my face, and my eyes firmly set to the heavens.You can not put a price on this. Yet I paid a minuscule amount. To say it was an absolute bargain is an understatement.Remember to tip the guides and porters at the end of your amazing trip guys. Pretty sure that you will all be extremely generous after the trip that they provide for you.Shout out to Ram, Dep and our Porters.Thanks for everythingQuang Tran

Great organisation, safety conscious, top tour. Thoroughly enjoyed our tour organised by Ace the Himalaya. We used an Australian travel agent who then booked the tour through Ace. Another time, I would definitely use Ace directly. They are professional and expert at what they do. Ace provided and organised everything to make our visit a low-stress success. This is following the April earthquake and during a fuel crisis. None of this stops Ace delivering a smooth, problem-free Nepal experience. Don't be put off going to Nepal - it's safe, friendly and open for business.Nima, our guide was fantastic. His English is not perfect, but fine. He is energetic and attentive, loves to share a joke, was always watching to make sure that we were safe, and understood well the needs of Western visitors.This was a tour to remember for a lifetime.

16 Day EBC Trek. The trek to EBC was always going to be amazing and the professionalism of Ace the Himalaya resulted in a seamless trip. Everything from the time I arrived in Kathmandu until the time I departed was arranged by Ace in advance. Our guide was fantastic and I'd certainly recommend Ace the Himalaya to anyone considering trekking in Nepal.

Trekking in the Annapurnas. I spent several years working on my trip to Nepal and wanted it to be the best possible experience. I cannot say enough now AMAZING it was to travel with Ace. From the smallest details to the largest, ACE was in EVERY way accommodating. EVERY need I could possibly have was taken care of, and my amazing guide, Santos, was willing and able to make modifications if needed along the way. Although I am a very fit individual, trekking in Nepal was definitely a physical challenge but no matter how fast or slow I wanted to go, Santos was encouraging and supportive. He was irreplaceable in helping me every step of the way. Along with Santos my porter, (I think his name was Depwess?) was also a great sport, and both saved me from over doing it or feeling rushed, while keeping me laughing and educated on Nepali culture along the way. I simply cannot say enough good things about ACE. They communicated with me regularly prior to my departure and answered my slew of questions, arranged all my transports, all of which went smoothly, met with me before and after my day trek and arranged wonderful hotel accommodations. I plan to return to Nepal and would not consider any other company with whom to travel.

Awesome Trek. Ace the Himalaya is an awesome tour company. My guide Nimesh was excellent. He was very helpful and spoke perfect English. The pace of my hike was perfect and my whole Everest experience was perfect. The price of the trek was also very reasonable, I would highly recommend Ace the Himalaya and would use them again in the future.

ACE The Himalaya Everest Basecamp Trek. Im so glad I went on this trek with Ace! The whole experience was perfect. Mansing is the best guide ever! He watched over everyone and made sure everyone was enjoying their trek!

Great experience and Ram was best guide on the mountain. We had an amazing 13 day trek to Base Camp. It was hard and one of our group had to be evacuated. But the guides were caring and very professional and looked after group at all times. Food was good. Guides (Ram and Dep) and porters were superb. On the last night everyone in our small group including porters and guides ate, drank $400 worth of beer, sang and danced together in Lukla pub. It was very memorable, and the other groups probably thought we were a little crazy.

Ace the Himalaya - Gorkha District Earthquake Rebuild volunteers. Ace the Himalaya assisted us in organising 13 volunteers from Australia to work within “Rebuild Gorkha Project”, going to Arupokhari, Nepal, a remote community affected by the recent earthquake. Ace efficiently organized transport and provided quality meals, even though there was a petrol and gas shortage (due to Indian border sanctions).Nothing was missed, excellent food, comfortable tents. We were welcomed on arrival and looked after by Ace manager Santosh, his assistant Yam and a very organized kitchen crew.Our manager Santosh was outstanding, he ensured that everything was perfect. He worked from early morning at breakfast till our evening meal.To his credit and his assistant Yam, they both worked very hard and helped us in our labouring work to commence building another house. I cannot thank Santosh & Yam enough for their efforts. In Santosh, Ace the Himalaya has an outstanding tour manager who can only go from strength to strength. I have visited Nepal over a dozen times in a 40 year period and have a keen eye for quality service and efficiency, as such I can highly recommend Ace the Himalaya for their efficiency, organizational skills and constant efforts to maintain high customer satisfaction and a thoroughly enjoyable experience.Visited early November 2015.Dave OHara

Ace organised our trip for 13 people to go to Arupokhari for Earthquake rebulid. Ace organised our trip for 13 people to go to a village at Arupokhari for 6 days, to help with the earthquake rebuild program. They were exemplary in everything they did from travel to accommodation (in tents) to the food (we had a great cook). I would not hesitate to recommend them.

Top Notch Guides and a World Class Experience. I cant recommend this guide service more highly. Our guide was attentive, funny, knowledgeable and friendly. The trip was well planned and paced and none in our group got AMS. This may be the most amazing trip I have ever been on, and Ive been on a few

AMAZING....Kathmandu Valley bike trip and Chitwan National Park Visit. I had an amazing experience in Nepal - I didn't want to leave and once I have I want to go back. The trip started with a 6 day biking tour up and around the Kathmandu Valley with our amazing guide, Santos! The biking was a combination of road/dirt/mountain bike trail/cobblestone that provided us with a fun trip that worked us hard! With the ever changing scenery I never found myself bored. We typically rode in the mornings and by mid/late afternoon we were relaxing at our hotel/resort/guesthouse and enjoying the views of the countryside. Santos was an excellent guide; he was not just a guide but quickly became part of our close knit travel group (total of four) and a great friend to have. He was well prepared when it came to bike problems and set a good pace for all of us so that no one was left behind, but no one was bored. If I were to go back I would definitely choose a trip that has Santos as the guide. He definitely enriched our experience with the company. After the Kathmandu Valley biking a driver brought us down to Chitwan National Park, where we spent two nights just outside the park at a resort. Here we were guided through a local town, took a walk through the jungle, saw the breeding grounds for the elephants, had a canoe ride down the river and enjoyed the views of the jungle from the top of an elephant! What an experience!Finally our trip came to a close back in Kathmandu where Ace the Himalaya drove us to the airport for our flight. Overall I had an amazing experience with Ace and would recommend it to anyone. Santos was the best guide that anyone could ask for, I hope to go back soon and do another adventure!

Great guide, reputable, would use again.. We used Ace for a three day trip to Nepal/Katmandu for my wife and I. Guides were waiting when we arrived at airport. Vehicles were clean and well maintained. Guide and driver were friendly and knowledgeable.Couple notes on our trip. I will give them 5 starts because our guide was great, however if we go back I would stay at a different hotel. It wasn't bad, but there was a very loud bar on the roof that kept us up the night in Katmandu.The hotel we stayed in when we went up into the hills was amazing. Great view and good food. This was our favorite part of the trip. If we go back, we'd stay up there for 2-3 nights and just relax.As far as the temples go, once you've seen 3-4 they all blend together. This isn't a knock on Ace, just a comment on being a tourist. In Europe, all the big churches look alike after a while. The same hold true for temples in Nepal.DON'T LET THE EARTHQUAKE SCARE YOU AWAY. Nepal is open for business and everything is fine. They are repairing, but that should not stop you from making the trip. Great food. An amazing country.

Definitely a Must to Visit, Gokyo Lake. We trek up Gokyo Ri in September. We got marvellous view of Gokyo Lake on the way up, definitely worth to do. We can put our trust in Kumar Thapa the guide, trully amazing time with him! He is professional and so nice to talk with. I am considering to trek to Nepal again on the next.

rebuilt Nepal adn Himalaya treck. A lifetime experience. Ace Himalaya is a wonderful organization and have the best guides we have enjoyed ever, they made us feel as part of their families. Prem organized everything for us, he is an excellent entrepreneur and a visionarie.We had Milan and Yam, and could not have asked for better guides.

Trip of a lifetime View of Everest, Ama Dablam, and much more. Ace the Himalaya is an outstanding outfitter, they made our trip not only fantastic but unforgettable. Our guide Bareth was everything you could ask for in a guide. He has great knowledge of the surrounding area, Nepalese history and an awesome sense of humor. The trip is something we will never forget

Everest Base Camp. The trip of a lifetime. The schedule is not too fast. If you're prepared adequately at sea level to walk for 7-8 hours per day for 12 straight days, I believe you will have no issues.At times there were individuals on the climb complaining about the pace being too slow, but they were the kind of people who would rather be first up than enjoy the view.

Best Experience Ever!. I booked the Everest Base Camp trek and I have to say it was an amazing experience, since the beginning the communication with the people from Ace was great, they were very attentive and answered all my questions timely.The trek itself was mind-blowing amazing guides (Thanks Kumar, you Rock!!!), amazing views.. Overall one of the best experiences I have ever had!

Trek of a lifetime!!! Cant recommend Ace enough!!. I just returned from a 14 day Everest Base Camp Trek. I have to say that it was one of the most amazing experiences and the Ace guides were in large part responsible. We ended up having two groups combined so we had a merry band of 11 travelers and 3 guides. Kumar I Kumar II (Sarosh) and Dipak were the most amazing hosts and friends. I can truly say that they have eyes in back of their heads corralling 11 excited, eager trekkers over the span of 2 weeks. They had our backs at all times and we did not have 1 problem with AMS or any other issues. The kept us going at the appropriate pace and always had a smile and a joke to keep our spirits up. They are a great team and its evident that Kumar has much experience and a great bond with the guides as well as our porters. I feel that our group developed a special bond with them that was hard to leave. I know that I plan to return and tell all of my friends about Ace..and to request our guides. I have to give special recognition to our tireless porters - we met up with them regularly along the route and they always were laughing and smiling. My porter - Bilgagi made me smile with his great attitude from morning to night. Mealtimes were very well organized and a special time to see the guides in action. They were attentive to our every need. I equate it to service at a very good restaurant. I would be looking around for the salt and turn my head and there was salt magically appearing lol (just one example). Dipak would even remember the meals and milkcoffe that I preferred every day! They had an eye on each one of us at all times and looking to attend to our every need. I even suspect that they distributed room keys with an eye for the photographers in the group who would have better views for late night photos :) I feel like I am gushing but they truly deserve it. They will work tirelessly to ensure that they do everything in their power to help and make you comfortable. Anyone with specific questions about this trek - feel free to contact me for more details.

Had an amazing time!!!. Ace was a wonderful company to do our Everest Base camp trek with! Arjun was our guide and he was absolutely amazing...I wouldn't have been able to do it without him :)I recommend Ace to anyone looking to do a trek or excursion, I only have good things to say about them. Very helpful and informative & they let you know exactly what to expect!!Thanks so much Ace & Arjun!!

Great Customer Service. I chose Ace the Himalayas because of their excellent reputation. When an usual situation occurred they were quick to resolve to my full satisfaction. Add me to the long list of those who sing the praises of the Ace the Himalayas. Will definitely use them on our next excursion to Nepal.

OUTSTANDING TREK - DHAULAGIRI CIRCUIT WITH ACE. This was our second trek with Ace the Himalaya and we were not disappointed. There is a reason we returned to Ace & it is called "customer service". Prem's communication is swift and his organisational skills excellent. We requested our previous guide Kishore, who obviously has great rapport with all of his team, is an excellent guide, has very good English and a great sense of humour. Unfortunately I became ill and had to be heli evacuated back to Kathmandu towards the end of the trek & Kishore (Krish), handled this extremely well while managing the remainder of the trek for the rest of our friends. For experienced walkers, not afraid of some hard work, I can highly recommend this trek with Ace - the views & experience were fabulous.If you want to do any trek in Nepal, please do not hesitate to give Ace a go - you will be looked after.
