Mt Everest Base Camp Trek & Chitwan National Park Tour. My husband and I have just returned home after completing a 13 day trek to base camp with Ace and we both had a wonderful experience. This is a very professional, friendly company. I purchased the trek on a Scoopon and from the time I commenced the booking process until we left Kathmandu everything was like clockwork. I communicated with Prem prior to leaving Australia and all my questions were answered promptly. We were collected from the airport by our guide, taken to our hotel and pre-trip meeting arrangements were advised. Ram was our guide and he is fabulous with many years experience of trekking to base camp. He is mature above his years (23). Any problems any of us had along the way were solved by Ram (there were 10 of us in our group). The day after we went to base camp I was affected by AMS (Acute Mountain Sickness) and needed to be airlifted back to Kathmandu to go to hospital. The evacuation was arranged by Prem and Ram and all went very smoothly and I arrived at the hospital in Kathmandu one hour from when I left the teahouse closest to base camp. When I was discharged from hospital we went on a 4 day/3 night tour to Chitwan National Park and again this tour went like clockwork - very enjoyable. I would highly recommend Ace the Himalayas for any trek or activity you were thinking of doing with them, especially if Ram is your guide.

Everest Base Camp Trek and Kala Pattar. I just recently returned to California from my trek to Everest Base Camp with Arjun as my guide. I can not say enough good things about Arjun as my guide and my experience. From getting us the best seats on the plane to Lukla, always making sure we were comfortable and getting us the best rooms in the tea houses - Arjun always made sure we were taken care of. He set a very comfortable hiking pace, was very knowledgeable, spoke very good english and had a great sense of humor. I would recommend him and Ace the Himalaya to anyone considering a trek in Nepal. I felt very safe and very well taken care of.

Everest Base Camp Trek. I was very happy using Ace the Himalaya for my recent Everest Base Camp trek. We had Arjun for our Mountain Guide and he was very knowledgable about the area and set a good pace with adequate breaks to make the journey pleasurable. Most importantly I felt that we were in good hands in terms of safety. Lastly, these guys are very flexible with accommodating schedules and seem to have access to the best lodging available on the trek.

Nepal Annapurna Circuit Mountain Biking Sept 2015. Mountain Bike trek on Annapurna Circuit was excellent in all respects. Well organised from arrival Kathmandu to departure 12 days later. The guide Santosh was always courteous, knowledgable and spoke English well. We felt very comfortable under his guidance, particularly his adaptability to unusual situations that occurred always culminating in good outcomes. I look forward to a future Everest Base Camp trek with Santosh as the guide.

Everest Base Camp Trek. First off, ACE is a very well organized outfitter. Correspondence was easy and Prem always responded in a timely manner. Never a delay in replies to my various questions prior to arrival in Nepal. Upon arrival, I met my guide who I have to say left me feeling uneasy as I was unable to communicate in English with him. His English was very limited and he couldn't understand the most basic of questions or inquiries. We went to the airport on the day we were to fly to Lukla and throughout the 6 hours we were there due to inability to fly as a result of weather, we barely interacted as he couldn't understand me. Knowing my safety during the trek was in his hands, I was uncomfortable and quite anxious as to how we were going to communicate if I ran into trouble on the mountain and had to communicate. Thankfully, we couldn't fly that day and as a solo traveler, I was added to a group the following day and had a different guide. My new guide was refreshing and spoke great English! Things were pretty chaotic at the airport waiting to board to Lukla and the group was split up on different planes. This was a bit stressful as we were expected just to meet up in Lukla. It all worked out but appeared a bit crazy and disorganized at the time. I do not believe this is the fault of ACE, just how things run at Kathmandu airport. Once in Lukla, the trek began and everything was great. The trek is quite exhausting and as compared to climbing Mount Kilimanjaro, I found it more difficult. Climbing many stairs as opposed to a trail/path. Many sections of stairs along trail especially through villages. Support along the trail was great and our guide was very very friendly and extremely knowledgeable about the area. Each day we received a plan for the day as well as a pat on the back at the end of each day before dinner. Later on in the trek, I became quite ill. My guide followed my condition closely and the day before we arrived at base camp, I developed Pulmonary Edema and Pneumonia and had to be air lifted off the mountain. It was my decision to go down as I was so incredibly ill and honestly felt like I was at deaths door. I had wished that my guide had realized how sick I actually was earlier before my condition got so bad. The helicopter arrived and I boarded (alone) and was flown to another location on the mountain. I had no idea where I was and was ushered off the aircraft and left at a building without any further instruction. No one spoke English and when I asked why I was here and not off the mountain, I was just told to "wait". I had no idea why I was there and for how long. This was a bit unnerving. After approx 2 hours, I was flown to Kathmandu in another helicopter. I later found out that I was dropped off as the crew had to return up the mountain for another more life threatening rescue. I wish someone had been able to explain this to me at the time. Upon landing in Kathmandu, a vehicle pulled up to the helicopter and told me to get in. Driver had NO ID...did not identify himself as affiliated with ACE so I again, felt uneasy but got in the vehicle which thankfully transported me to an ambulance which took me to the hospital where I was treated. From when I landed in Kathmandu at the beginning of the trip to this point...no one has ID. It would of been helpful if employees of ACE has a badge with their picture and the ACE logo to assure clients that they were representatives of ACE and that they are in good hands. This is a strange country and getting in unidentified vehicles with people you don't recognize isn't ideal or advisable. My Doctor at the hospital was fabulous and the bed side manner of all the staff at the hospital was wonderful and better than that of my native country of Canada. The care was of high standard and very professional. I did not hear or see an ACE employee for most of my stay which at first upset me as I felt alone and lost and was very ill. I later found out that the Doctor prefers no visitors and this is why they weren't there. I wish I had been told this earlier. I did see them closer to the end of my stay and they brought me fresh fruit which was appreciated. If you want anything in hospital such as food/clean PJ's, towels etc... you must ask. Supplies are limited and these things will not be offered to you. You must be assertive. I had no trouble with billing. My insurance company and the hospital sorted everything out for me and there was no confusion in regards to charges etc...They did everything. All I did was sign the forms. It was seamless. ACE was very organized and transported me back to the hotel and returned me to the hospital for follow up upon the Doctors request. I was well taken care of throughout this scary ordeal and I commend ACE for taking good care of me. Overall, I loved my experience in the Himalayas and despite my trek ending early, it was a one in a lifetime adventure that I will never regret and always be thankful for experiencing!!! The Everest region is spectacular! Despite the few hiccups, I wouldn't hesitate to use ACE again should I return. It was evident my guide Krishore loved his job and I couldn't of had a friendlier more caring guide. I met some great people and the Nepali people are the kindest people I have ever met in my life and I've traveled to many countries in the world. Thank you ACE!!!

3 great days!. I booked ACE for a 3 day weekend. Saw all the sights one day, trekked the second day and did mountain biking the 3rd day. One day one saw all the major sites and the guide was excellent. Day 2 and 3 was with a different guide who was amazing. My 3 days in Nepal were amazing and can't wait to come back and will plan on using ACE again.

Sightseeing tour. Had an awesome time. This company is fantastic. The guides are super helpful and entertaining and everything is taken care of for you.. so you can worry about nothing and enjoy the adventure.

Amazing experience. Had one of the most memorable trips of my life this past April. Ace the Himalaya is well known to the locals and travelers to the Himalayas. I chose them as I wanted to go with a reputable company.Two guides our group had, Toya and Rabi were awesome and such compassionate and kind people. The fees the company charge were reasonable. All Nepali people in the region seem to be genealogy happy and content and also kind.Himalayas are breathtakingly beautiful and mystic and I recommend all my friends to go to Nepal and see them! Highly recommend this company.

Trip and Experience of A Lifetime. We used Ace The Himalaya for our trek to Everest Base Camp this year and would highly recommend for anyone looking to do the trek to use Ace! From the minute we stepped off the plane to when we left it felt like they were there to assist and look after us at every point of the trek and our time in Kathmandu. We ended up in a small tour group of 5 plus tour guide Raj and a couple of porters. All the way Raj looked after us both ensuring we were well serviced at the tea houses but also for our wellbeing all the way along the trek. He was well equipped for any situation and had a wealth of experience and knowledge of the Khumbu Valley which ensured we learnt as much as possible along the way.I can't wait until my kids get to an age so I can do the trek with them and of course use Ace The Himalaya.

Tremendous Experience. I am so thankful and felt lucky to have chosen the "Ace The Himalaya" to handle and managed my tour visit in Nepal, as i 'd say they are well organized in dealing with their client's needs and demands. It was my my first time visiting Nepal and i would definitely use them again on my next visit. I'd like to appreciate the assigned tour guide, Mr. Dil Tamang for his skills of knowing the history of Nepal as well as the cultures, his knowledge are in details and very well expressed. It was unfortunate for me to feel that, the time we were in Darbar Square, I was taking videos and pictures on those buildings/temples and asked him ignorantly this line, "when was the last time does Nepal got experienced of having earthquake?" then he looked at me wondrin why asking such rare question.. but he then answered "our country is prone of earthquake and perhaps the strongest one was 1934's" and i just obliviously shrugged off and resumed the tour. 23 April i left Nepal, just about 2days, a dreadful news has came to me about Ghorka's earthquake.. that made me goosebumps and called my friend rigth away.I was so thankful that his entire family were safe and wished that i could help those affected at least stronger than i wanted to..My great appreciation to the driver, MR. PRAKASH, (can't remember his last name) a very humble and attentive guy. He knows all the way and of being readiness all the time you require his assistance.​Furthermore, if you wish to visit their country, I would definitely advice that Ace The Himalaya tour services can be the best choice ever, not only because of being professional, your needs and requirements can be absolutely be accommodated.I would say, everyone should try to have the Nepali tour experience at least once in a lifetime. See you there again ATH, on the next no time!​--vinfrom Philippines

Professional tour company that made my visit a life experience.. Enjoyed "Ace Of The Himalayas" sightseeing services with tours of Kathmandu and Nepal. Professional smiling guides with local knowledge and a personal touch. Answered questions from local customs, religion,trekking to personal requests of a Kathmandu local swimming pool or a European style safe and fun pizza restaurant. Services included tours and transportation all done exceptionally well. Have come to Nepal with little expectations and left with deep regards to the locals, the city, the food and of course the sights.

UNFORGETTABLE MEMORIES. We booked through a secondary company and were forwarded through to ACE, and could not be happier. A reliable, cost effective and knowledgeable company, from the initial brief that was held by Prem to the farewell dinner and everything in between my girlfriend and I were blown away by the precision and professionalism of the company. We always felt safe and well informed mainly due to our guide Milan and our driver Sukhra who were both always exuding positive energy towards our group. We would highly recommend anyone travelling to Nepal to touch base with this company to arrange any activity you wish to do as you will definitely not leave disappointed.

Great Experience. My entire experience dealing with "Ace The Himalayas" from start to finish was exceptional. The level of expertise, knowledge, and the overall friendly nature of everyone from the porters to the owner of the company floored me. I would absolutely recommend this trekking company to anyone seeking a get away to the Nepal region.

Reliable company with very competent staffs. It was our team's first expedition far away from home and finding a reliable company at the lowest cost was the biggest headache. Our team leader screened through dozens of companies and quotations down to Ace the Himalaya (Ace). The main confidence gripper was the response rate of Prem, the boss of Ace. Every email sent out was replied in a jiffy and our requests were very well accommodated.Next part in deciding if Ace is truly a reputable company, is its logistics and admin support. An example was when our plane arrived late by almost 6 hours because of bad weather resulting in a backlog of activities. One of them was equipment preparation. Staffs of Ace made this fuss free and was delivered right to our hotel lobby, warm sleeping bags and down jackets which many of us did not have prior to the trip, saving us from bitter cold nights up in the mountains.Last and most importantly, good companies like Ace have to depend on their competent guides and porters during the trek itself. I'll leave the reviews of the actual trek, terrain, food, lodgings, photos aside as they are pretty generic in other companies. My focus will be on the people of this company, the guides and porters. Our main guide Suman, assistant guide (Thirta Puri aka Raj) and porters made sure everything was hassle free. Suman's knowledge of the mountains and terrain is enormous enough to constantly keep me in awe. Coming from a society that takes things for granted and all things material. Suman's humbleness and also attitude to towards work and life sets an example for all of us in the group, never failing to cheer us up during the hardest of climbs. Through the journey, he has become more of a guide but a friend, a brother to me. Raj the assistant guide comes across as an energetic and knowledge hungry , he constantly ensures that the last person is well taken care of, never hesitating to relief us of extra baggage which might slow down the group. He is also very clear of the terrain and the different routes to take even though our itinerary has changed. And finally the porters, without a doubt, the champions among the crew. Lifting baggage of minimally 30Kg on their backs and ensuring our belongings are intact, in our rooms by the time we end our grueling day. Along the way, we hear stories of groups not being able to cross high passes because their porters were not willing to do so. Hearing this, we can only keep silent and appreciate our group of tenacious portersWithout Ace and its crew, our journey to EBC and back (thankful) will not be complete. Thank you Ace for making this trip a very memorable one :)

When looking for a guiding company to hike to Everest Base Camp. Wow, what a wonderful surprise. I booked with this company through the clymb, not knowing what to expect. What I got was a professional outfitter who had the best guides and the best porters to make sure we made it to our destination (base camp) and back safely and with a smile. Kumar, Madan, Raj, and Robbie all worked together to guide 24 people up the mountain despite the different abilities, ages, and personalities. From the moment they pick you up at the airport to the moment they drop you off after your stay, they make sure your every need is met. They have amazing attitudes and are just there to serve in their highest capacity. If I were crazy enough to ever do this trip again (which trust me I am not) I would book with this company without question!!! A trip this difficult would not be easy under the best of circumstances but they pulled if off as if it were easy. I have nothing but praise to report about this company and would recommend you booking with a company that comes with high marks because up on the mountain it will make a huge difference!

Outstanding trekking company. Ace the himalaya were outstanding from first contact to the end of the trek. I took a school party from the UK to Annapurna base Camp and their services are second to none. Santosh, out guide is outstanding and nothing was too much effort. His sense of humour lightened some of the more difficult points on the trek and he worked tirelessly to ensure the students ha an exceptional experience. Having been trekking in Nepal many times with school groups they are by far the best I've ever used and will be using them again. Thanks again Prem and Santish and the team.

We were safe and happy with Ace the Himalaya. Organizng our trip was easy with this company. We are leaving today , having accomplished way more than we expected. We are very satisfied with professional and friendly guidance. Manoj, our trekking guide is the best!

Marvellous . We had a wonderful time in Nepal. Our guide Manoj was very helpful and service-minded. The very trip was well arranged. Despite different physical abilities between the members in our group our guide Manoj managed to make our trip enjoyable to everyone.
Mt everst base camp trek. Amazing tour with amazing guide. I highly recommend doing this tour and if possible get ram as your guide he's the best there is!

Trip of a Lifeltime. I went on a 13 day Everest Base Camp trek with Ace the Himalaya in March 2015. There were seven in our group which is an ideal number & we all thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The trip was well organised & the Ace staff really looked after you with nothing being too much trouble, in fact they could not do enough for you!Special mention must go to our guide Ram who was simply fabulous. From the outset his goal was to ensure all of us had a great time right from when he advised me of the best side of the plane to sit for mountain views when flying into Lukla right up until he escorted us to our hotel back in Kathmandu. He also had a great sense of humour & made everyone feel like they were in safe hands. Our head porter Rhobi was also fantastic; I honestly do not think that I have ever met such a caring individual. After hours of trekking this guy’s first priority when arriving at a tea house was to make sure all of us were taken care of even to the point of bringing us our meals, amazing!Anyone thinking of doing the EBC trek should consider this company, the trek is no ‘walk in the park’ but you will be rewarded with what I consider to be the best scenery on the planet as well as memories that will last a lifetime!

Perfect Company for your Bucket List needs. Almost everyone has a bucket list of some sort, and for most, you get only 1 (maybe 2) chance to cross something off your list. In early 2014, I jumped on the chance of crossing off #1 on my list to reach Everest BC. I found a great deal through theclymb.com for a 16 day Everest BC trek (other deals are available now as well). I saw that Ace the Himalaya was leading the tour and I did a quick research on the company. After seeing mostly, if not all, positive reviews, I felt confident in choosing to go with them and chose a March 2015 date. Knowing that I was going into this trip without knowing anyone, sense of security was very important to me, and Ace provided that. From the time I booked, Prem, the company's owner, was in constant contact with me to provide me with all the information I needed as well as answer any questions that I may have. For 16 days in Nepal, basically everything was set up for me. From the hotel in Kathmandu to all meals throughout the trek. My guild, Dev, and other members of the Ace staff were extremely professional, punctual, and friendly. Even if I did the trek on my own (luckily I was joined by two other people who I now consider friends), I would have felt really comfortable. The trek was the most difficult thing that I have ever done. Looking back on the trip, I am even more grateful to Ace and my guild, Dev, for my success (yes...I made it). Dev was knowledgeable, energetic, caring, and humorous. He provided interesting facts and figures throughout the hike to help keep us informed and educated. He was always smiling, which made us feel like we were in good hands. He was always aware about how we were feeling by constantly checking in with us, and adjusted the pace appropriately when things got tough. He was always making jokes and even did some magic to help ease our minds. All of these little things, I believe, ultimately gave me the best chance of success. All in all, you can choose many other options to try to get to Everest BC. You can choose to go solo or you can choose other tour companies. None of these will guarantee your success, and that is just a fact! What you should be looking for is the BEST chance at reaching your goal. For many of us, we only get one crack at this, and I believe that Ace the Himalaya and their staff are the best bet! I would highly recommend them to anyone. I am already thinking about a different trip with them in the near future.

Annapurna Region. Our second visit to Nepal, and again we used Ace the Himalaya. Again the tour was well organised and our guide Santosh and porter Emo looked after us so well. Prior to the tour all our questions were answered within a day by Prem, the owner. Have no hesitation in recommending this company.

Day Tour Pokhara. We had a day tour with this company in March 2015 and it was a very full and interesting day. The guide was very knowledgeable and helpful. He was willing to take us to places that we suggested. The company is always on time and the drivers reliable. We always recommend this company to people considering a visit to Nepal.

Great company, excellent service. I did the Mt Everest BC trek with Ace the Himalaya in March 2015. I just could not get over the scenery, it was fantastic and I couldn’t believe it that it was getting even better the further we went. It is certainly a must do trip. We had 7 of us in the group one guide and 4 porters. We all had a great time, the porters and the guide provided an excellent service. From the beginning, Prem and Ace the Himalaya was very responsive to all my questions about the trip, and organized everything. We had a good trekking group, the guide Ram was very caring and looked after everyone. He is very knowledgeable and responsible individual and at the same time has a great sense of humour. All porters were very kind and friendly and Ram had Robi assisting and he was great too. I would highly recommend to do a trek with Ace the Himalaya. I was sad to leave and I am planning a return trip already!

Super Organisation. Just back from a once in a lifetime trip to Nepal. What an amazing trip. Ace the Himalayas had everything organised to perfection. Recommended by a friend, this company came out much more reasonably priced than our local travel agent. Couldn't recommend them enough, nothing was a problem and they were so informative before booking. A super 5 stars to our guide Bharat, full of advice and information, and made our trip really special. Thanks to every one at Ace the Himalayas for an amazing time. John and Jason.

Amazing trip with an Amazing company. My friend and I decided to vacation in Nepal and were lucky enough to find Ace the Himalayas for our trek. We chose the Annapanura Himalayan 10 day trek which included a day tour in Katmandu. Prior to our trip, Prem, the owner, was attentive and very responsive to all our questions. Even though we arrived a few days early and stayed a few days after the trek, they helped us with lodging and additional excursions (we added Chitwan National park). From the time we were picked up at the airport till the time we were dropped off, we were treated like family. The trek, with all the steps, is indescribably beautiful. Santosh, our guide, was always on top of everything. Taking care of every detail and of great support to those of us who were struggling with all those steps (ok, really it was mostly me struggling). The porters and assistant guides were great, fun and added to the experience of Nepal. We were blessed with a great group and Santosh set the mood throughout the trip, keeping everyone's spirits up and sharing his extensive knowledge. I strongly recommend Ace....and although I am certain all the guides are fantastic, know that if you get Santosh, you'll be very well cared for!!! The only thing I regret is that I had to leave. But warning, I will return.

Amazing trip by Ace and our guides. I did the Poon Hill trek with Ace the Himalaya in October 2014 and it was the best trip I've ever taken so far. From the beginning, Prem and Ace the Himalaya was very responsive to my questions about the trip, and organized everything so that I didn't have to worry much about logistics once I got to Kathmandu. We had a great trekking group and got along so well, and this was helped by our awesome guide, Santosh, and our assistant guides Dipesh and Raj. Santosh was so caring for everyone's needs and was an amazing leader for everyone in the group.During the trek, we learned so much about the area and had a lot of fun all hanging out. We always felt that our guides were prepared and we were taken care of, and we enjoyed our trip so much more because of this. The guesthouses along the way were not luxurious, and the food wasn't the best, but none of us minded much because we enjoyed each others' company so much. The scenery along the way and at Poon Hill definitely was the highlight of the trek.I'd definitely recommend Ace the Himalaya for any future treks.

Outstanding service!. Prem and his team at Ace the Himalaya were really great on doing their job! They always made sure that things go well during the trip. They are really helpful and attentive. Their guides (Kedar, Kishore, Sangeh, Resom, and Raaj) knew the Nepali politics, economy, and cultures really well and they were willing to share their knowledge with their clients. I can tell that they really love what they do. As many have said on their reviews, Ace The Himalaya should be your only choice when you travel to Nepal!

ACE - a company which lives up to its name. Our trek to Poon Hill was exceptionally well put together by ACE The Himalaya and we recommend this company wholeheartedly. Our experienced guide Deepak and our strong, kind porter/guide Resham provided impeccable serivce and help throughout the whole excursion and were always ready and willing to answer any of our queisotns be they about flora and fauna or more in-depth subjects such as local politics, religion, welfare etc. The walking up to the highest point of this trek - Poon Hill - is not particularly strenuous but there are a LOT of steps. People with weak knees might want to take some knee supports. We also recommend trekking sticks to help. However, there is plenty of time planned in to the excursion and no one need feel rushed or stressed at all. The food along the route was just great - we were advised to opt for vegetarian dishes which we did and enjoyed every single thing we had. To my personal taste, some of the dishes could have been a little spicier - and we were happy to find out that local chile sauce was available which one can add as one wishes. We also tried "local wine". This was a surprise indeed! It looks exactly like water - and tastes like some kind of schnapps. We shared one "cup" and didn't go back for seconds! Everything was extremely well planned by ACE but what I would really like to mention is the extremely competent guides. On the way up to the highest point of our trek, I felt extremely ill. Our porter/guide stayed with me whilst the rest of the party continued. After a little rest I was fine again but Reshams calm presence really did reassure me that if anything were seriously wrong, I was in good hands. His strength and compassion are very valuable assets to any trekkers in difficult at altitude. We travelled in winter and were extremely glad of the sleeping bags we took with us. The accomodation was basic but clean and comfortable - and everyone was extremely friendly. Toilet paper is not used by locals so you may want to take some with you. We also took disposable bags so as not to leave any tissue waste along the route. Littering is a problem - children beg for chocolates and then let the candy wrappers on the ground. Our guide hepled in explaining why dropping plastic etc is not good and we hope this problem will be addressed conscientiously by future trekkers. This excusion was an unforgettable experience and we will be back for more. ACE gets our full 5-star rating without any hesitation whatsoever. Absolutely 100% recomend this company from start to finish.

14 Days Everest Base Camp Trek. It was my first time for to travel to Nepal, I had so many questions prior to my departure, I communicated with PremK. Kathry, the Managing Director through email. He was very helpful, and prompt responding to my questions. Our guide, Kris, speaks fluent English and very knowledgeable. Our assistant guide, Kumar was very kind, helpful, and caring. The trek went very smoothly, they made sure nobody left behind nor got hurt. I fell on the slippery ice a couple times, Kris always helped me going through those slippery ice and so did Kumar. Our group was very well taken care. I really enjoyed the trek and I would recommend Ace of Himalaya to anyone. Thank you Prem, Kris, and Kumar for such great experience!

Everest base camp. I found out about ace the Himalaya through a friend who found a scoopon voucher for trekking to Everest base camp. The hotel we stayed at in kathamandu, provided in the voucher, was good quality and the staff there were extremely friendly and provided great service. Everything was very well organised starting the trek, including the option to hire down jackets and sleeping bags, I provided my own gear but was good to know I had the option. The guides were very friendly and gave plenty of information about where we were going, what we were seeing and were always smiling making plenty of jokes.The accommodation along the trekking was much better than what I was expecting and we were kept very well fed with a decent selection of meals to choose from. All up the trip was amazing and got to see some awesome places. The physical aspect of trekking wasn't overly demanding, it was still hard at certain points but going at a steady pace and breaking when needed there were no dramas.

Trekking Nepal. I had the best vacation ever with Ace The Himilaya in Nepal! I was able to see the tallest mountain in the world with great friends and an awesome guide. Thanks to Ace providing a quality, professional, and personable guide I was able to enjoy my time even more. My guide Milan provided fascinating information about the surrounding regions, mountains, gave good food reccomendations and I always felt safe. Next time I visit the beautiful country of Nepal I will be sure to use the services of Ace and would request my guide Milan again. There are so many beautiful and historical sites to visit and activities to do that I can't wait to go back!

Trek to Bace Camp and Summit Kalapatter. Unforgettable experience. We had an exceptional guide named Krish. I would recommend Ace the Himalayas to everyone. They had everything covered from start to finish plus more.

Once in a lifetime Experience. From start to finish, Ace the Himalaya was a well oiled machine that took care of our group and gave us an unforgettable experience. We felt not only safe in a foreign country, but free to explore the best of Nepali culture with the help of our wonderful guide. Look no further; Ace is the company that will not only take care of you but will guide you on an adventure you will not soon forget!

Everest base camp. This was the best adventure ever. My guide Madan was fantastic from the moment I got off the plane with no luggage and he had to take me shopping on a Friday night to the time we said goodbye I could not have asked for a better guide! Thank you Madan!!! There are not words to adequately express my gratitude! Fabulous! I highly recommend Ace!

Sight Seeing in the Himilayas. Our guided experience trekking through the Himalaya's was absolutely amazing thanks to Ace the Himalaya. We were provided with a guide named Milan who was both professional and personable, made us feel safe and well taken care of, and was an overall fun guy to be around. During the trek you pass trekkers from all over the world and local Sherpa people who constantly greet you with a warm "Namaste". The views of the mountains along the whole way are beautiful that one must see for themselves to truly understand how magnificent they are! There were plenty of rest stops along the way, tea houses, and places to eat that had great tasting food. One thing I would advise is to not forget to bring your own toilet paper! Overall it was an unforgettable experience and I would like to return someday and plan another trip through Ace the Himalaya.

Nepal Tour - Guides. 40 other class mates and I went on a trek in Nepal. Not only was the experience AMAZING the tour guide went above and beyond with his service. Santosh Khatri did not stop caring for us and making sure we were able to get through. He is the best tour guide and also a great friend of mine. I he truly the best guide and anyone would be lucky to get him as their guide.

Brilliant time. I trekked with a group of 17 other travellers - all excellent people. Ace were well organised, our guide Santosh looked after us every step of the way. All of the guides and porters were very helpful and friendly. The trip through the Annapurna region was stunning and moderately challenging - lots of steps! The accommodation is basic and most places were generally quite clean. You could pay for a shower each night and they were always hot. Santosh advised us to eat vegetarian and that kept us all well and healthy. Thanks Ace, Santosh and my fellow travellers for a highly memorable trip. I would definitely recommend Ace.
Great. Santosh Khatri guided the tour and did a fantastic job of showing us the many sites of the Poon hill trek with the many features nepal had to offer

100% Exceptional Service!. Our guided experience by Ace the Himalaya in Pokhara, Nepal was absolutely exceptional! Madan, Dipak, and Govinda were all extremely attentive to our needs and went above and beyond to make Pokhara a life-changing experience for us. Madan was incredible at coordinating each activity but also allowing us a bit of free time to explore and meet new people. Govinda was a safe and accommodating driver. Dipak was extremely knowledgable about Pokhara and led an exceptional afternoon city tour, and even went out of his way after the tour to show us Helping Hands Handicrafts, a weaving studio run by the deaf and the blind, and coordinated a meeting for us to talk with the owner. All of Ace's guides have superb English skills, and they made us feel right at home, like true friends would. Overall, Ace the Himalaya provided incredible service and we cannot wait to return to Nepal and book with them again!

Everest Base Camp Trek.. The most amazing trip! I met the most wonderful group of people. The guides and porters were phenomenal and super friendly! I did it with my best friend but I would have felt very safe doing it alone with this company. Everything was dealt with professionally - I would highly recommend.

A very professional approach with perfect service.. I am most impressed with Ace. As a local company, they seem to do everything right: everything is taken care of, well planned and organised, and they really want you to be happy with every aspect of the service. But at the same time the experience still feels authentic, not manufactured. You cannot and should not expect a Hilton experience: this is Nepal, and throughout my trip I felt I was getting to know the real country, meeting real people, in other words it felt as authentic as if I had put the whole trip together myself - but without the hassle!

Kathmandu Valley Tour plus Annapurna Circuit Trek. I went on my own to Nepal for the first time over xmas and new year 2014-15. I was a little nervous but from the first, Prem, the owner of Ace the Himalaya was helpful, reassuring, knowledgeable and filled me with confidence about the whole trip. Everything was well organised even before the trip, with lists and instructions sent to me. We had a trip around some sites in Kathmandu Valley on Day 2 and Dil, the guide, had an amazing amount of knowledge and facts. It was a fantastic day with amazing places to see. The trek itself was (with the exception of my kids of course!) the best thing I've ever done. It was challenging, but all the more rewarding for that. Our guides, Raj and Deepak, were just the best. They became our mates very quickly, and I couldn't have asked to be with a better group of people, including Raj and Deepak. Raj kept us laughing throughout, even when we were a bit fed up (tired and cold), which we needed. I couldn't recommend this trip more. I will be going again!

Tough but Great. The trek via Gokyo to Everest Base Camp was unforgettable. It was not easy for sure, but immensely character building and rewarding. Ace the Himalaya did a flawless job - from communicating excellently in the organising process to setting up a great trip. We also summited Island Peak at 6200m, and Ace took care of that adventure perfectly. Our guide Milan from Ace was a joy to have - his knowledge of the mountains coupled with a special sense of humour gave our group a huge advantage, and the morale was always high. I met a few guides from other companies along the way and few of them could speak English as well as Milan. All in all a worthwhile experience and highly recommended.

Fantastic Experience, fab company. We booked our trek with Ace the Himalayas. Prem was completely on the ball and responded to email queries quickly and promptly. The Guides and porters on our trek were fantastic and they looked after us very well. They made sure that as a group they tailored the pace for all the different levels of fitness. We had such a fabulous time in Nepal and on our trek and that in a large part was thanks to Prem and the team.

True professionals. Absolutely amazing experience and one thing is for sure, you will be looked after at a very professional level with this company. Safe genuine trusting staff genuinely here to ensure you get the best from your tour. Lots of experience and not just in Kathmandu a company with a wealth of knowledge and I would certainly use them again for another tour trek etc!

Island Peak Summit; Very Professional Tour. We aimed high for this Adventure and got in very deep at times .We did Goyko Lakes ,Ridge ,Cho LaPass ,Everest Base Camp, Kala Patthar and then Injatsu (Island Peak ) base camp and finally the summit @ 6189m.We used ACE before to do a Anna Purna trek and this was our second experience with Ace. The company owner, Prem Khatry runs a sharp logistical show and we were fortunate to get a guide called ‘’Milan’’ who turned out to be a fantastic trekking companion with his perpetual buoyant attitude. Nothing phased him and his porters Krishna and Sandeep were always in attendance during meal times .Krishna deserves a special mention as he was a source of constant amusement with his offbeat manner. Then for the climb we had Pemba Sherpa and Karma Sherpa who really went out of their way in terribly cold conditions(refer to photos)to make sumptuous meals, although my appetite was dodgy at the best of times. I could’nt fault them and found the whole experience professional .I can highly recommend Island Peak as a taster for anyone who wants to go further (up another mountain ..that is )and this is a good way to experience ice climbing with all the kit under trying conditions .Prem, to you and Milan ,thanks again .See u in a Spring time or 2 as were considering doing Mera Peak at arnd 6461 m as believe its beautiful and u hv great views of Ama Dablam ,Nuptse and Lhotse ..and then some .Or we might just aim high again and go for Peak 38 @7590m Till then Namaste

Excellent Experience. As part of a university excursion we were set up with Ace the Himalaya. From day one in the hustle and bustle of Thamel, Kathmandu, we were able to see that the business was well-run and efficient. Porters, acommodation and guides were all outstanding during our five day excursion through the Annapurna Circuit and the Poon Hill trek. All our needs were attended to, from arranging transport through the rocky roads of Gorkha to rafting trips. We all felt that we were in good hands, and founder Prem and our guide Raj were both outstanding.I wouldn't look any further than Ace if I were to go back to Nepal.

An Amazing Experience. We had an amazing 19 days in Nepal. Prem was very prompt in answering all my queries regarding the EBC trek. The day tour that we had on the second day was great. Dil was a very knowledgeable guide and we had a great time. We were a group of 9 and all of us were of average fitness level. My trekking guide,Toya, was very experience and after the 2nd day of the trek, he suggested a slight change to our trekking itinerary which would make it easier for us. We must thank him and our wonderful assistant guide,Dipak, for making this trek a memorable and amazing experience for us. I will definitely come back to Nepal for other trek and ACE will be my 1st choice.

There should be six stars...fantastic company and people. We booked our five day trek of Annapurna Circuit online through Ace the Himalayas, not sure what to expect. Even our travel agent said to be careful as she had not heard of them.Well... from the time of booking, we felt a good connection. The owner, Prem, was so attentive to our questions and concerns. As our luggage allowance on the airline was 30kg, but our bags were 15kg we took over many school books, crayons, pens and supplies. Through Rotary Prem arranged for these to be delivered to an orphanage 7 hours away.When we got to Kathmandu we went to see Prem a couple of times, but he was always busy. We started to think of Prem as "Charlie" as in Charlies' Angels. We saw his staff, but never him.Anyway, the night before the trek he came to the hotel we were all booked at and briefed us on the trek. We finally met him!!The first day was a sightseeing tour of Kathmandu with Dill as a guide, who was wonderful - so passionate and knowledgeable about Nepal.We met our guide, Raj and our assistant guide, Dipak. Next day, it was on... on the 8 hour bus trip to Pokhara.During the trek, Raj, Dipak and the Porters were great. As we tended to be in the front half of our 16 pax group, we spent more time with Dipak (Raj was at the rear, herding the tail end).Once, my wife fell over on black perma-frost and hurt her hand. Dipak and Raj could not have been more attentive. From then on, Dipak made sure he was not far behind to help in case my wife needed any help.Ace the Himalayas is 7 years old and has grown from a small company created by Prem. Due to his work ethic and the great people he employs, we know that this business will grow bigger and better and we hope the same culture remains in the future.Thankyou Prem, Ray, Dipak and the porters for giving us such wonderful memories.

Kathmandu Day Tour and Remote Trek. We had a great time on our day tour of Kathmandu! Raj set everything up for us and although we were jet lagged and a little nervous our day was wonderful. We saw all of the wonderful sights, had a delightful lunch and left feeling like we knew the city. Thanks to Ace the Himalaya and Raj for starting us out on such a remarkable journey! We would definitely use them again!

Experience of a Life Time. Visit to Nepal was in my "to do" list for a long time. Each time something did come up at last moment preventing me to go there. Finally, I made it this December. There were several places in Kathmandu which I put in my list as a must to see. Durbar Square was on the top of my list. This historical place is probably the most popular UNESCO World Heritage Site in Nepal. Amazing concentration of various temples in a relatively small area. The 3-roofed Taleju Temple is my favorite there. Try to allocate several hours for this place and, also, look around at the nearby streets. They are full of life which goes just outside... Another place in my list was Boudha Stupa, one of the largest in a world. Honestly, I wasn't much impressed by this particular attraction. However, the area around is charming, with a lot of restaurants and shops. My tour to Nepal was organized by ACE the Himalaya and Prem, the owner, and his staff have done a fantastic job to make my trip smooth and pleasant. My guide, Ram, was taking a great care of me. I would highly recommend Ace the Himalaya. I’ll definitely be back in Nepal for another tour with Ace!

Kathmandu Day Tour & EBC Trek. We had a terrific and memorable experience in Nepal - 20 days including Kathmandu and EBC legs. Prem's organizational communications were flawless and helpful. The best part of our trip was Raj Rokaha our guide; he lead us, entertained us, arranged for everything and kept us safe. The safety part is quite important with the risk of AMS. If I return, and I hope I can someday, I will ask for Raj. I would recommend ACE to anyone planning a Nepal trek.

Staircase to the Skies. I visited Nepal in mid-late November through Ace the Himalaya. Their prompt replies to my numerous questions with enthusiasm before arrival and booking their Annapurna trip, ensured me that I would be well looked after. I was surprised that I was the slowest in our group, but felt reassured by our group leader, Santosh, that I shouldn't feel rushed and to take pictures and rest stops whenever I needed to. I also felt very safe as a tour guide, or even Santosh himself, was always right by my side or very nearby in case of a stumble! I had had a fractured wrist at home only recently! Boy, can Santosh spin round fast when he heard me take a wobbly!! He also made sure I was very warm at night by providing me with extra quilts at every overnight stay! Meals and every break on the trek were well organized ahead of time so no wasting time!I was a little angry towards the end of the first day, as the staircase was never ending and much tougher than anticipated, and when the staircase got more like a wall of a staircase, Santosh was there to organize a pony for me which has now become one of my best memories ever! He organized a white pony ( on my request as a bit of a joke) and Santosh even delivered there! I can thoroughly recommend Ace the Himalaya. Nothing is too much for them. Their porters were also excellent as were the staff at Hotel Family Home in Kathmandu.

A totally incredible experience. From the time we arrived until the time we left we were incredibly well looked after . The care & attention that Ace the Himalayas offer is outstanding . They look after you incredibly well and Kumar in particular is fantastic . He is supportive and sympathetic for the older adventure seekers . I cannot compliment Kumar enough , or thank him enough for all his help . Our trip was outstanding ; the local people very friendly ; the scenery awesome .

Unforgettable experience. I visited Nepal in November and had one of the most exciting adventures of a life time thanks to Ace the Himalaya! The day tour of Kathmandu was very worthwhile to see the beautiful temples with our guide Dil who has great knowledge of the history (even better if you're an architecture fan like me!) We also booked a trip to Gorkha through ACE where we had the opportunity to visit local schools and stay with a local family, this really was one of the highlights of my trip, the family were so friendly as were our guide and driver who really made this trip worthwhile and comfortable for us. We spent our last week trekking Poon hill, having never trekked previously, we were supported greatly by our guides Santosh, Yam and Dipesh, these guys are truly amazing at what they do. It really was a fantastic experience and I would highly recommend Ace the Himalaya, I’ll definitely be back to climb Everest with Ace!

Memories for a lifetime. We had an amazing experience in Nepal. Prem did a fantastic job helping us define our itinerary and communicating with us in the days leading up to our trip. In Nepal, his team did a great job coordinating all of the logistics and making us feel comfortable in such an exotic location. I truly feel like we experienced the trip of a lifetime.

Ace to base camp, Great trip great bunch of people. Recently trekked to Base Camp with Ace Himalaya. tough trek particularly the altitude. this aside, we had a great trip. the group we traveled with were tops and our Guide Arjun is a champion. Hint, make sure you are fit. The terrain is not that difficult, We walked the Kokoda Track earlier this year and the terrain was much tougher in PNG. Its the altitude that knocks you around as you head to Base camp. So do some training, ascend slowly and you will be OK.I would recommend ACE to anyone looking for a quality, good value trekking experience.

Kathmandu and The Himalaya-Outstanding Service. Jay Nelson - My second trek with ACE....the first was excellent, the second was outstanding. Excited to do a third. The only thing that can compare to the scenery and the landscape is the service provided by Ace. From start to finish the personal interaction and individual care is as good as you can get. Our guide Raj was well prepared, professional, attentive, extraordinarily friendly and more than willing to make this a memorable experience. The client guide relationship quickly became one of friendship. My climbing guide Pemba provided me with one of the most extraordinary experiences I have ever had while at the same time keeping me safe. I congratulate the entire ACE team for making this an incredible experience for me and look forward to the next one.

Desperate to return!. I went to Nepal for 2 weeks with a friend and we booked trekking and tours with ace the himalayas. Once we arrived at the airport we were immediately looked after throughout the entire duration of our trip. The ace team were friendly, caring and warm. We did a selection of village stay, sightseeing and trekking and would definitely recommend and book with these guys again. Thank you everyone for an unforgettable experience, see you soon!

Smooth adventure in the extremes of altitude and ice.. These guys are sharp! Milan our knowlegable guide was a joy above 5000 metres. Kamal set a good steady pace up front. We all immensely enjoyed this tough trek.

incredible experience that will always be remembered..... .....going to nepal has been a dream of mine since childhood and this year i finally decided to bring the dream into reality. i booked the trip through travelzoo and was both excited and nervous about it since i did not know anyone and was traveling alone.....well, i was in for an incredibly great surprise...from the moment i landed to the moment i left simply everything was perfect. the airport pick up and departure were on time, hotel accommodations were as good, food on the trek as well as the farewell dinner was tasty and i cannot say enough about the owner, Prem, as well the trekking guides and porters. everyone was very professional and friendly and there was never a time when any one in our group was left out or the needs not met.....i have only great things to say about Ace and Himalaya and will definitely come back!

Wonderful trip. As an almost 65year old solo traveller I booked with great trepidation but need not have worried as there was great attention to my every trivial concern. Amazing country of warm kind and accommodating people. Good food and comfortable lodgings. Can't wait to go back

Unforgettable Holiday. We had a wonderful trekking in Langtang: thanks to Manu and Raza, our guide and our porter, went higher than any mountain in Europe and most of all were introduced to the wonderful People of Nepal.When we were back in Kathmandu valley, Dil showed us sites so different from our culture and explained local religion, architecture, tradition.We were positively impressed by the professional and kind attitude of all Ace employees: they made us feel at home in this wonderful Country.

Great travel company. Ace had an amazing staff and was able to answer all questions we had during the temple sightseeing tour in Kathmandu. Our guide during our trek was amazing and whenever someone felt ill or was having trouble walking due to knee pain, he was with them every step of the way ensuring the safety of the individual. The food was great and plentiful and you can always switch it up from the recommended suggestions. I highly recommend this company and I highly recommend going to Nepal! It was a great vacation and any one who loves the outdoors will love trekking. I feel this is a great way to do the trek for couples, family, friends, and if you are solo there are plenty of people in the group to hangout with.

"No Doubt". this is my second time trekking with Ace The Himalaya crew. and I choose my second trip to Everest Base Camp, as I trust Ace The Himalaya since the beginning so I continuing to use their services. And yes another good experience with Ace The Himalaya, with my broken ankle (after 4 months accident) finally Kishore the great guide could help me and bring me to reached Everest Base Camp and go back to Kathmandu with a good health and condition. so proud! and this is the things that i really happy about the crews as they will NEVER.. never left us behind :) Good food, good lodge, GREAT Guide and Team (Kishore, Nimah Sangeh, Resom and all the porters) they are great!! Excellent Trip, good itinerary, well organized,majestic scenery, and good travel partner :DWell, for sure will come back to Nepal over and over again as I falling love with "Never Ending Peace And Love" of Nepal :)Prem, be prepared! will make you busy for another trip :DCheersAbex - Indonesia

couldn't be better. I booked a "one to one" tour with Ace the Himalaya and my guide was DiI was met at the airport in the early morning by Dil and a driver and had a most comprehensive and informative tour of Kathmandu- tailored to my personal preferencesI would recommend the company - excellent service,,good communication,good timekeeping, and a stress-free tour

An exciting glimpse of Nepal. My cousin and I recently celebrated 50th (ish) birthdays in Nepal on the Ace multisport adventure. This is more fun than two 50 year old gals should ever have. The tour had 6 other people which was just the right size to get to know folks. Sharing these experiences with new friends was the best part of the trip. There was a great variety in the activities, whitewater rafting was fun and quite managable for novice paddlers given the level of the Trishuli River at the time. Paragliding in Pohkara was a favorite for most of our group.Accommodations varied widely from rustic mountain top inn, to a luxurious resort it Chitwan, all were comfortable and met expectations for their respective settings. The elephant ride in Chitwan was fun, but we didn't get very far into the forest and never saw any rhino's, whereas other guests who did the jeep tour did manage a sighting, so if Rhino spotting is a priority, you may want to conisder adding a jeep excursion. The only excursion that begged for some revision was the mountain biking. To get to anything that resembles a trail, you need to spend a fair amount of time navigating the streets and traffic of Kathmandu, which turns out to be far more exciting and treacherous than the bungee jumping. Our guide, Arjin, was very friendly and managed the group with a very laid back style. Overall, I had a great time and would recommend the trip to a friend. I do recommned adding a day or two at either end of the trip to allow for a bit more sightseeing in KTM.

Exceeded expectations!. Without question, I would highly recommend Ace the Himalayas to anyone planning a trek/tour in Nepal. Prem did an outstanding job of preparing us for the treks--giving us advice on what we needed, what conditions we would face, and answering all of our email questions promptly. All of the guides that we had were very knowledgeable about the history, culture, politics, and economics of the area. We learned a great deal from them. And all of the guides, porters, office staff were polite, kind, and very responsive to our needs/wants. Coupled with the natural beauty of Nepal, it made a really great adventure!

Rewarding Volunteer Experience. I was lucky to have the experience of being a volunteer English teacher at Bhairabi School in Ratmate Village in Gorkha. As an experienced Canadian teacher it was fascinating to work with dedicated Nepali teachers and to share ideas and lessons. The teachers were welcoming and interested in my different methods. The children were amazing - fun, smart and kind to me and each other. It was a great learning experience for me, really unforgettable. the children loved the songs and games I used to teach them English and rely appreciated the materials I left for them. I recommend this experience for anyone who loves working with elementary school aged kids and want to offer assistance to a village school.

Trekking In Nepal. I would recommend Ace the Himalaya to anyone planning a trip in Nepal. Prem was so helpful with our queries and needs prior to our trip starting, and gave great advice about what to bring. He answered our emails quickly and clearly, and the trip was was well organised. Our guide Santosh was fantastic - we all felt very safe and in good hands with him. He is knowledgeable, has a great sense of humour, and is very patient. When I apologised for making him wait while I took yet another photo, he said, *Don't hurry, this is your time". The whole team from Ace the Himalaya were fantastic - friendly, helpful, and always smiling. Thank you, all of you.

Amazing adventure. Used ACE the Himalaya on - private day tours on my trip to Nepal. The company went above and beyond my expectations. The information provided pre-arrival to Nepal was perfect; they gave us everything we needed to know without too much details. Email questions I had that were not provided in the information were answered within a day or two of me sending the email.The tour itself was great, but our guide Nimesh was amazing! It just goes to show how fantastic customer service (or a guide, in this case) can make a tour or experience exceed all expectations and turn a tour into memories of a life-time.

An incredible trip. Not only was the trek to base camp amazing but equally amazing was the job done by Ace the Himalaya. Everything was planned and organised for us and our expert guide was both knowledgeable but also a very friendly person. I could not fault them if I tried. Thank you so much for the experience. I highly recommend this company.

EXCELLENT SERVICE and GREAT PEOPLE !!. I have been on few organized tours/treks, but the service and professionalism provided by ATH has been way above any of the others; it has exceeded all my expectations. Right from the beginning even before committing to the trek, Prem and their associates were very quick in answering all the questions about the trek very promptly. Once the trek started, I know I had nothing to worry about from the minute I landed in Kathmandu. EVERYTHING was perfectly organized and taken care of. The treks are very well balanced. The guides are very knowledgeable and friendliest people on the planet. Along the trek, the guides have tremendous patience and they make sure every one is taken care of. Towards the end of the trek, unfortunately, I fell sick and required evacuation. Just one phone call and they orchestrated the whole rescue quick and perfectly. With ATH, you know you are in good safe hands!

Amaaaaazing Trekking Trip with ATH!!. This was my first time to go to Nepal. Thanks to ATH giving me such a memorable experience trekking in the Annapurna regions! Not only could I see the magnificent scenery but also I have a chance to know more about the rich Nepalese cultures. Everyone in this tour are very nice that makes my trip more enjoyable. Special thanks to our guide Suman, who has professional knowledge in the routes & always take the initiative to help us, trying to make everything go smoothly. Also thanks to Prem, who responded quickly to my queries when I organised the trip. Highly recommend you to explore more about Nepal with ATH!!! Enjoy!!!

Great Nagarkot & Kathmandu day tour. We thoroughly enjoyed our amazing one day tour which started in Nagarkot observing the sunrise over the Himalayas. Dil our guide was very knowledgeable and good company. We would recommend this company and tour without reservation.

Everest base camp trek. What a great time! We had incredible weather and great views of the surrounding mountains. Our guide, Raj made the trip even more enjoyable with his knowledge of the route and area and his leadership abilities to keep everything moving along smoothly! I would highly reccomend Ace the Himalaya and especially our guide Raj and his team of porters to give you the best experience possible as you attempt to reach base camp.

You're in good hands. Going to EBC is one in a life time experience and you certainly want an organisation that is big enough to have resources on call with quality staff but small enough to have direct access to the MD when you have queries and requests. This is what I liked about ACE and their ability to put together a great trek package that looked after us from the time we landed in Kathmandu to the time we left.Unfortunately for me, I was unable to complete the trek due to altitude sickness in the middle of the mountains. Our guide ensured that I was provided with emergency evacuation co-ordinated by Prem and was air lifted back to Kathmandu and admitted to an international hospital which nursed me back to health. It was highly professional and good to know that in these times, you could depend on an organisation like ACE to take the necessary action to ensure your safety comes first.What I saw on the trek was amazing with Kumar our guide and porters doing an amazing job. I am planning a return already and ACE will be my first choice to get me there the next time!

Aced it. An incredible trip.Certainly great weather and stunning views played a part in that, but our knowledgeable and attentive guide Toya and our unfailingly happy porter Kumar (aka Superman) really made this experience a honeymoon not to be forgotten for my wife and I.Toya had an answer for all our questions, a great sense of humor and was always excited to play card games with us in the evenings - even teaching us a couple of his own. And he's a magician!Both Toya and Kumar made sure we were well fed, well rested and well cared for. When Sheila felt ill, Toya was right by her side, and in constant contact with the folks back in Kathmandu in case she took a turn for the worse. She recovered, we saw the sunrise behind Everest while atop Khala Pattar, and we couldn't have asked for more.Prem was also amazing at answering us quickly and frequently in the weeks leading up to the trip, and our driver and guide around the Kathmandu Valley kept us safe in the chaos of the city's streets and showed us some really incredible places.Don't miss this trip, and thanks to everybody at Ace.

Great time in Himalaya. I am glad that I entrusted ACE the Himalaya to organise our once in a life time trekking experience to the EBC. ACE director Prem had been fast and reliable at addressing any of our concern even before arriving in Nepal. Never tired at getting back to us even though we had sent countless emails to him. Arjun, the guide provided by the ACE the Himalaya was a very experienced guide, very reliable and helpful. The trip could be dangerous without his knowledge on various issues pertaining to the area. He even helped solo trekkers on the EBC trek who faced problems. The scenery was superb even though the area was most of the time surrounded by clouds. I highly recommend ACE the Himalaya to anyone who would like to experience this impressive mountainous region.

WOW The holiday of a lifetime !! - thanks Sumana and the team. I can not recommend this enough, well organised, excellent support team, great mix of people, amazing views, life affirming experience. Sumana helped from arrival, helping me relocate my lost luggage, get kit for the trip, and then guiding us informatively and with good humour through our amazing Annapurna circuit trek.He was full of knowledge, led his team of sherpas well, made us feel safe, informed and fulfilled. This trip surpassed my expectations and I can not imagine there is anyone better to trek the Himalayas with.Enjoy!

mountain bike and trekking tour with ace. I had a perfect time in Nepal! I was trekking in the Sagarmatha NP for almost 2 weeks. The nature and the mountains are overwhelming, I fell in love with this country. the lodges were middleclass and I think you could find some better lodges along this trek, but it was ok. Our guide was a quiet person and didnt tell us a lot about the count and the culture, that was a pity. But I think it depends very much on which guide you have (as there are a lot of different guides in the agency). When I was back in Kathmandu, I did a mountain bike tour in the kathmandu valley, where I had a very good and communicative guide! Over all I enjoyed my journey and would recommend it to anyone who loves the mountains :)

1 day Kathmandu Tour. I was looking for a reputable tour service in Kathmandu and good thing I was able to come across Ace the Himalaya. We inquired through email and response is quick and they were able to process the tour request right away. The tour guide assigned to us is Kedar and he was amazing. We requested to just have an overview of every place we went because we have a very limited time and he gladly complied. We explained everything very well and this by far is the most easiest tour I've been on, he will not drag you too fast from one place to the other. Overall, I highly recommend Ace the Himalaya and I will not hesitate to book our future trips with them.

Adventures in Nepal!. The programs run by Ace the Himalaya are soo fantastic! Their staff were so cheeky and fun, but also extremely qualified and helpful, no matter what their job, and our group loved the cheeky tour guides immensley! They have had so much experience in the tourism industry and as a result they are so professional with their services, being organised and on time with their tours. They took us to all the best attractions in Kathmandu, offering the best cultural and language insights! The intinerary was incredibly flexible, and we could pick the places we wanted to see most. They also gave us great advice on transport and accomodation and locations to visit elsewhere in Nepal.I also loved the fact that the organisation was run entirely by locals, which meant that they had the best knowledge about the locality, but also they were offering more jobs to lcoal Nepali's. Having a positive effect on the community is always important to me while I am travelling and this is a good thing for any other ethical travellers out there! Ace the Himalaya are simply the best at what they do!

My Favourite Trip!. Helpful, happy, cheeky and adventurous I could have asked nothing more of the team at Ace! The staff at Ace the Himalaya have an insight and passion unrivalled by any tourism company that I have encountered thus far on my travels in any part of the world. The itinerary was both flexible and exciting so as to ensure that we gained the best possible experience of our time in Nepal. Prem and his team were more than helpful and dealt with any concerns or questions before, and during the trip with efficiency and utmost professionalism. The trip provided activities that were specially catered for our interests and adapted to what the group wanted to see and experience whilst in Nepal. Our guide Milan, and porters Dipesh and Raj were brilliant. They had a genuine passion for what they do and were always up for a laugh and an adventure! This trip was made so easy by having these guys as support and they truly contributed to one of the best trips of my life. I'd have no reservations in recommending Ace for anyone looking for an absolutely amazing adventure in an incredible country, with beautiful people and landscapes that will take your breath away (even in Monsoon season!)

ADVENTURE - July 2014 in Nepal. Adventure it is! Nepal is certainly not a holiday destination so be prepared to experience amazing sights, smells, heat and everything in between. A university trip during Monsoon season turned into the adventure of a lifetime. "Ace the Himalaya - Day tours" was organised by Prem and was excellent. All paid for and organised prior to our arrival. Thoroughly informative before we arrived and continued along the journey. I could not have asked for a better guide and glorious encounter in this beautiful country. Amazing sights and amazing company!! Definitely recommend anyone who wants to go on this adventure!

Everest base camp. I booked a trip to EBC on November 2013 and it was the most wonderful excursion I've ever had. Ace the Himalaya is a small tour operator owned by an ex porter. That prior experience has given the company a lot of insight about the business and it shows in several areas from the attention to detail, wonderful staff to the value for price.Every person I interacted with during my whole stay was exceptional. Our guide, Suman was the best host one could have in a foreign country. During the trek he explained all sorts of detail about the geography and history of the area, safety tips and I always felt he took great care of all of us in the group. One group member didn't acclimatize well and I witnessed how they worked diligently to get the person extracted and followed up after the hospital release. No one signs up expecting to get extracted but it's great to know that Ace will handle emergencies with dedication and responsibility. That's great service.The trek was simply amazing. I traveled with my girlfriend and got paired up with 6 other folks who were great friends. The trek pace was well planned to allow for acclimatisation. I'd say this trek requires a moderate fitness level (e.g. doing a long hike +10mi, +6h). The accommodations are some of the best available in the area without being luxurious. By that I mean clean, cozy and in most cases with the best view available. For example, our room in Tingboche overlooked Mt. Everest, amazing!Outside of the trek our trip included an excellent tour of Kathmandu and a delicious cultural dinner with dances. I can't wait to return to the Himalayas and when I do I'll definitely book it with Ace.P.S. If you stay at Hotel Access Nepal do yourself a favor and try the food from their restaurant, they are to die for.

Could ask for nothing more.. Avoiding going in to details (everyone else here has provided plenty):-My friends and I were 18 and inexperienced in travelling in this part of the world. Ace did not let us down.-The organisation of the trip by Prem and Ace the Himalaya was excellent.-Ace were very flexible when I requested certain alterations to the original itinerary to suit me and my friends (mainly in regards to mode of transport).-Our guide, Chris, and porters, Sunnil and Yam, were faultless. They are great people with a good sense of humour, and not too bad at singing either.-The accommodation was beyond what I expected.-The monsoon weather isn't that bad in the mountains. You can get worse rain in England in the summer.-Look at a handful of the photos I took!!! :)

Safe, Exciting Senior Solo Adventure. As a female senior travelling solo I was nervous at first. However as this was a return trip to Nepal I knew what questions to ask ahead of time. Prem answered them all within a day with lots of detail. I was able to be with my former guide Raj N. From the moment I arrived I felt welcome and safe. Raj’s caring, sensitivity to my needs, knowledge of Nepali culture, sense of humour and friendship were outstanding in every way. He checked in with me by direct question every evening to ask how things were going and to make sure I not only felt safe and comfortable and but also that my goals were being met. I am a freelance writer so Raj acted as my assistant, translator, and sometimes photographer, helping me to set up excellent interviews with some people who might have been otherwise inaccessible. He acted as a co-teacher while I was volunteering at Bhairabi Primary School in remote Ratmate, his home village, helping me to understand the children and get to know the head teacher and staff. He took me to visit his welcoming family several times (I got to taste fresh buffalo milk!), arranged for me to attend a village Hindu wedding (he explained the customs) and toured me to other remote schools in the area. Raj worked very long hours to make sure my trip went smoothly. He remained in good spirits and positive at all times. My accommodations, while rustic in some areas, and tenting in some, were always just right for the situation. Special kudos to my village cook Kamal, and porters Resham and Tika. All fun, friendly and accommodating staff of Ace the Himalaya, truly an outstanding organization. I also love the fact that they are linked to a charitable foundation, Sambhav Nepal. Prem arranged for me to meet with the young female student my husband and I are sponsoring to go to school in Kathmandu. A joyful experience.

Much more than what i expected. Ace the himalaya provided a unique experience by organizing a trekking through the beautiful mountains of Nepal with excellent staff, super service minded, good humored, capable guide that managed extremely well to make every traveler wish be fulfilled before even asked. For sure I highly recommend them to my friends and anyone looking for organized trekkings and day tours in nepal!

The Perfect Tour Experience for the Solo Woman Traveler. As a woman traveling alone in Nepal for the very first time, I am very glad that I arranged my tour of Kathmandu with Ace the Himalaya. The staff provided highly personal attention and took care of all my travel needs -- transportation, entrance fees to cultural sites and a top notch tour guide, who was very fluent in English and had extensive knowledge and insight about the history and significance of Bhaktapur, Boudhanath and Pashupatinath. I especially appreciated the opportunity we had to visit the apprentice mandala painters near Boudhanath. It was an very enriching day tour. I will definitely call upon Ace and their excellent guides the next time I plan tours or travel in Nepal

Lifechanging Experience. I chose this Ace the Himalaya trip on a whim through a good deal on The Clymb. Going into it, I assumed it would be fun and exciting but my expectations were thoroughly surpassed. Nepal itself is beautiful, peaceful, and welcoming. The culture is rich and quiet, leaving space to put your own personalized touch on your experience. Ace the Himalaya suggested a great combination of destinations, from the mountains of the Himalayas to the jungles of Chitawan. The accommodations were always above and beyond what I expected. While I was prepared for limited accommodations (running water, heating optional, electricity varied) most places made sure the stay was comfortable, if not luxurious. Our guides, Madan and Krishna, were knowledgeable, friendly, safe, and enjoyable. They really helped to shape my experience and help me get the most out of it. All of the activities were well researched, with instructors knowledge and certified. Even on some of the more "adventuresome and dangerous" outings, I always felt taken care of, which is saying something as a young female traveling alone. Nepal will forever hold a special place in my heart, and my amazing experience is credited much to the facilitation of Ace the Himalaya. I highly recommend the tour I went on, and assume their others are equally amazing. I can't wait to go back and revel in the beauty of Nepal.

Outstanding tours and staff. Ace the Himalaya organized our Kathmandu tour and did a great job of it. The price was reasonable, they had excellent staff to work with and a knowledgeable congenial guide who communicated well. We saw a lot of Kathmandu and our guide gave us a lot of cultural insight. We had set this up before our departure from the U.S. and Ace's staff was great at getting back to us to answer our questions. All the members of our group recommend Ace. We'll go through them again the next time we go back to Nepal and will happily recommend them to our friends.

Outstanding Trip!. I had an outstanding experience on the 16 day Everest Base Camp trek with Ace the Himalaya. I cannot say enough good things about the company and out guides. I booked solo as part of a 12 person group trek. Ace was very organized and promptly answered all my question via email before my trip began. During the trek our guides were extremely professional and prepared, and handled any situations that arose (such as altitude sickness or other medical situations) with complete ease. They did a fantastic job of making sure everyone had a safe and fun experience. I hope to return to Nepal in the future, and if I do I will most definitely use Ace again.

Ace the Himalaya was terrific!. Hello travellers, I want to strongly recommend that you use Ace if you're going to do the Annapurna Circuit. My wife and I went with my 62 year old mother and we had a blast. Santosh and our porters M and Debesh were curteous and friendly for the entire trip 23 days total. They knew the best places to stay and never let my mother think she couldn't finish the trek, even though her pace was a little slow. We got over Thorung-La pass without problems from altitude and without needing Diamox. We never felt they had anything but our best trip in mind. If I ever return to Nepal, I will definitely use Ace and request Santosh as our guide.
