Outstanding Experience. We had such a wonderful time with Ace the Himalaya! The trek was absolutely incredible. Our guide was so friendly, helpful, and fun. I couldn't imagine trekking with a better company or guide. Everything was taken care of for us once we arrived in Kathmandu. Ace ensured we did not have to do anything besides take in the sites. I recommend Ace the Himalaya to anyone wanting to trek in Nepal. I cannot say enough good things about this company and I can't wait to go on another trek with them soon!

trekking, safaris and more!. I flew to Nepal on my own first for a safari in Chitwan National Park then later met up with friends for trekking. The Ace guides were great! I met two of them since one picked me up at the airport and traveled with me to Chitwan while I had a different guide for trekking. Everyone I met was very friendly and helpful which really helped when arriving on my own. The trekking was amazing and a big part of that (aside from the truly amazing views) were our fun and wonderful guides and porters! While in Kathmandu we also ended up adding on a city temple tour and mountain biking. Overall, I would definitely recommend Ace the Himalya to others. The customer service of all the people involved will make sure you have a great experience!

Amazing trek!!!!. Everything was very well organised from the time of arrival in Kathmandu to my departure; the hotels & guest houses booked were comfortable . Thank you Kumar my guide on this trek and my porters for your support & experience & would highly recommend Ace the Himalaya. Look forward to another trek with you guys in the near future. Thanks so much!!! Namaste!!!

amazing experience. The trek was great. The views were incredible, the guides were funny, nice and friendly, and the group I was trekking with were all very easy to get along with. I definitely recommend Ace the Himalaya!

Great trip with ATH. I had a fantastic trip with ATH last month, and was thoroughly looked after from start to finish. The guide & porter were professional throughout and the region itself is unlike anything you'll see anywhere else in the world! I would highly recommend Ace the Himalaya and will be using them again next time I visit Nepal!

The difference was experienced.. Ace the Himalaya gave us an awesome tour. The company went above and beyond to make sure my father and I were safe and having a great time. Our guide, Nimesh Nepal, was a very kind and knowledgable person. Overall, the whole experience was one that I will never forget. The scenery was spectacular and the whole staff was the best in the business.

very customer friendly. we had a great time with Ace in Tibet, and Prem & team (in Kathmandu) and Melanie (in Switzerland) were extremely helpful, very responsive, and a great source of knowledge in the preparations. We had some issues the first time round of getting into Tibet, they reacted very fast, offered us alternatives, and made us feel important all the time. We can highly recommend the team, they are very motivated, and the private tour we had with them was incredible!!

Ace still stays on my mind. After having a bad day at work I thought why not book a trip to Nepal . It was the best decision I made back in August 2013. Prem was attentive in answering a whole host of questions I had before and after I made my purchase. I was sad to leave but Nepal will and the great experience I had with Ace will always stay in mind.

Just got back. Terrific trip, highly recommended.. I went on the EBC trip advertised through the Clymb along with 10 other strangers, all ages, abilities and backgrounds. Some with high altitude experence, some not. We headed up on May 20 for a late season trip- advantage, warm weather in the lower areas, disadvantage, as with any mountain range, the chance of snow. And snow we got, two feet of it at Loubouche. Some opted to head up the mountain to EBC, many of us didn't (me included) and opted instead to rest, relax, shower up and wait for sun. Our guides Raj and Deepak were cheerful, competent and talented. Raj was full of good humor and laughter every day, and even when we faced the identical menu choices at every single stop we found a way to get fed and fortified. One accustoms to the icy rooms, because once you're on the trail you are greeted by what most people will only have photos of in their houses: massive great walls covered with snows, looming Everest and her sister peaks, a stately monastery and a chance to listen to prayer services in person. The snows against those blue skies are something else again. We even got to see the Everest marathon head down hill through the same snow that kept us from heading up!You must be prepared for the long uphills and downhills which are hard on the feet and shins, and relatively good shape is not the kind of shape to be in for this trek. This is serious walking. One of our group got very ill with ALS and was not taking Diomox and that is another very serious piece of advice. Don't come without out it and use it while you're here. Altitude sickness is nothing to be trifled with thinking that you're young and strong is a good way to get helicoptered off the mountain. Fitness is not a preventative. If I had one complaint, and this does not in any way reflect on Ace the Himalaya, it is the condition of the toilets on the mountain. Considering the masses of people going up and coming down, one would think that some kind of effort would be made to recirculate the sewage gas so that it is not such a constant and overwhelming companion to one's toiletries. At one point i was told "this is the mountain." To a point I most certainly understand. But there are ways to pipe this horrific smell somewhere other than into one's bedroom (yes really)and we used outdoor toilets which utilized wood chips and other compost to great effect. As this is my third major climb, I remember that the Inca Trail suffered the same issue. Do not travel with out a great deal of toilet paper, no matter what, extremely good glacier glasses, and a huge sense of humor. Take an alternate pair of hiking boots, you will use them. Ace did all the rest, by making sure we were safe, happy, saw blooming rhododendrons and gorgeous scenery the envy of all our friends and took care of all the administrative details so that we were free to do all the hiking, walking, gawking and standing in wonder- and there's a great deal of that- we wanted. One last note: get to know your porter. Kopal lugged my oversized load (by about ten pounds or so) and I made sure that he got something special every morning to start his day. At the end of the trip we were talking and laughing and having a great deal of fun interacting, and I also made sure that he got a nice big fat extra tip for his effort. I really appreciated that he had extra to carry, and a Snickers bar stuck into the handle (or two) was definitely something he enjoyed. But he enjoyed the big tip at the end even more. What's key to enjoying this trip is to remember that the end goal is not the goal. As with trips like the Inca Trail, it's the journey, the EBC is really just a place. Kala Pattar was ultimately too dangerous to climb. But the chance to make way for yaks, walk across heart attack inducing suspension bridges, watch donkey trains head by, and marvel at the human train taking massive boxes of Pringles and coke up the mountain so that you and I can consume that in Gorek Shep, and being able to sit right behind the pilot as he comes in for a landing at Lukla which will decide for you once and for all to let your grey hair grow in, well, only here. The kids faces, the ancients saying Namaste, the excellent company of your group- that's the journey, not whether you made base camp. Prem started out as a porter, Raj our senior guide did too, and so did Deepak our assistant guide. They all know the mountain, the trails, the best views, and they want you have a magical time. They give back to the community, too. In all regards, an excellent operation all around. Strongly recommended.

Ace is the Place!. The people at Ace the Himalaya did a fantastic job with all our many trip details. We were very pleased with our Nepal Adventure and would recommend this trip to anyone wishing to experience Nepal and be challenged on a sport level as well. Our particular trip included whitewater rafting, paragliding, mountain biking, hiking and bungee jumping. We also enjoyed sight-seeing, experiencing Nepali culture and cuisine along with an elephant safari in Chitwan National Park! Prem was very helpful in answering all our questions before the trip and provided us with valuable information concerning arrival procedures and suggestions on necessary gear to make the trip more enjoyable. As experienced travelers, we usually book everything ourselves. Having Ace take care of the details was like having your own personal concierge service. They were professional, courteous and were very flexible, allowing you to "tweak" your itinerary and tailor your trip to your own personal tastes. I would recommend Prem and the staff at Ace to enjoy Nepal in a "worry free" environment. I would recommend Nepal to anyone interested in a fascinating encounter with a very warm and welcoming people who live in a truly beautiful part of the world.

EBC Trek. What a fantastic experience. A very remarkable trip with some great memories. Everything was arranged, trouble free and no fuss. Our guide, Arjun was also sensational making the trip very enjoyable. Highly recommended.

"Nepal Multi Sports Adventure" - 10 Day Tour - AWESOME!. This trip was amazing, Ace did a wonderful job putting this together and went out of their way to accommodate us with any changes we needed when possible. (Not to mention answering all the questions we had before booking the trip.) From the time they picked us up at the airport to the time they dropped us off 12 days later we never felt unsafe. The driver was absolutely wonderful, how he's able to drive through that was unreal - you have to see it to believe it! They had everything planned for us and we even had time to venture out on our own. This is the first guided tour group we have booked with mainly because we like time to do things on our own, Ace was perfect for that. We even stayed an extra day so we could take a flight over Everest and Prem even sat that up for us. The only thing we wished we had known was how CHEAP you can purchase trekking gear for in Kathmandu. We could have packed light, gone with no gear, bought it there and brought it home with us to use here. Of course we still bought gear, but the extra baggage cost was brutal. You can't go wrong with this group. How many vacations can you say you went white water rafting, hiked up Sarangkot and woke up to a breathe taking view of the Annapurna range, para glided off that same mountain, took an Elephant Safari, played with a baby elephant, biked Kathmandu, jumped off a 524' high bridge to a 328 ft free fall Canyon Swing and flew over The Himalayas to see Everest (not to mention all the cultural sights along the way) - all in one trip! You can have all this and more with Ace the Himalaya.

Trip of a Lifetime. My son and I had the most wonderful time in Nepal. Ace the Himalaya was the best company to work with. My e-mails prior to the trip were answered quickly and completely. We felt very prepared upon our arrival in Kathmandu. Everyone we encountered throughout Ace was helpful and kind. We learned so much about the country and were able to see sights that defy description. Hopefully we will return to Nepal with the rest of our family and when the time is right, the first call we make will be to Ace the Himalaya.

Nice Guides and organisation! Trekk to Gokyo Ri. I had a great time trekking to Gokyo Ri with the Ace The Himalaya Crew!Once I arrived I had a meeting with the manager of the Trekking agency who informed me about anything relevant and had time to answer all questions I had.Very nice to mention is following:I had booked a group trekking. Once I arrived they informed me that other group participants changed their trekk so I was the only one in the group... Nevertheless they gave me a guide so I had a guide for my own without paying more! Furthermore they managed to give me a helicopter flight instead of a plane flight without paying more :) (Kathmandu to Lukla) All in all great experience with the Team!At the end a personal recomodation: Plan 1 or 2 extra days for the return... The flight back from Lukla to Kathmandu can be a total mess! The airlines there dont have a ticket system as people are used to... It might be that you are stuck in Lukla for some days which can be really bad if you know your plane home will fly on the next day....

A great time in Nepal. I had an excellent time in Nepal with Ace, visiting the country for the first time this year. Prem's team is very well organised and everything ran very smoothly. I found the entire team very knowledgeable - thanks to my guide Raj N in particular. In my own view, travelling with Ace is safe, well-structured and most importantly fun. I would recommend Ace for anyone visiting Nepal, whatever their abilities or interests are - I was and still am very impressed!

Rom should be guide of the year 2014. My boyfriend and I did the Langtang trekking. We were really lucky to have Rom from the booking agency ace the himalaya as our guide . He was very friendly, helpful and cared for us very well when we were sick. He was eager to tell us lots about the mountains, the beautiful nature and the Nepalese culture. He was not only a perfect guide, but also a great companion to us. We can also recommend the agency Ace the himalaya. They organised very good trips for us. They were very uncomplicated, we were able to change plans spontaneously. Rebecca and Florian from Germany

My first amazing trip to Nepal with Ace support. I had unforgettable travel to Nepal for first time on March 2013 , I coordinated everything with Prem, Ace. Co. sent nice Compact plane by email to me. Really everything was fantastic with Ace. Because of hi level accommodation in everywhere, on time planning, nice and smart guide T Oye and good porter, strong and professional Pemba Sherpa , nice driver , so . I was really impressed by the level of service provided at all levels .therefore I will recommend Ace to everybody wants travel to Nepal.

visiting Nepal. I visited Nepal for the first time earlier this month May 2014, I booked my tour with Ace the Himalaya after checking them out online. I was really impressed by the level of service provided at all levels, from the CEO Prem to the Guide Dipak, the driver and the porter Binod. They were punctual, very well organized and able to reschedule my plan on a short notice. I ran into some health issue and they looked after me as well as my own family would have. They made all the arrangements in a seamless fashion and without troubling me with details. I was obviously vulnerable but felt safe and well looked after. For anyone out there looking to visit Nepal, I suggest you book with Ace the Himalaya and do not bother looking for another company

Mount Everest Base Camp. My teenage son and I had a fantastic experience with Ace the Himalaya! Our guide, Madan, was amazing, the office staff were very nice and Prem, the owner was very quick to answer all questions. It was a fantastic experience that I would recommend to anyone!

Great Company. I had a great time touring with this company. Everything was very well organized with a great combination of time to relax and time to do and see things. I would reccomend this company to anyone.

Excellent Service. This was my second day trip with Ace the Himalaya and my second perfect trip. What an experience ! Everything was handled in a very professional manner. And their personnel are the best. I must highlight my guide Krish who was truly excellent - from his local knowledge of the sights, to teaching me card tricks. Even his jokes helped brighten up the day! I cannot recommend this company highly enough.

Excellent Service. Our day tour through the Kathmandu Valley with Ace the Himalaya was excellent. Our day wasn't rushed and we were able to fit in seeing Boudhanath Stupa, Bhaktapur and Pashupatinath Temple grounds. Our guide was really good, he had an amazing knowledge of the areas we visited and the history.Booking the tour was very easy with Prem responding to emails and requests quickly. Ace were very punctual, showing up on time, every time. I can't rate their service high enough.I will be sure to use Ace again next time I'm back in Nepal.Thanks Prem and Ace crew, Graeme.

Unforgettable adventure!. I will never forget my trek in the Himalayas with Ace the Himalaya. Loved the views, fantastic overwhelming beauty. Loved the people, my fellow trekkers, the guides and porters who were very helpful and accomodating in every way. Prem organized everything very well and Raj and Ram were wonderful guides. I would highly recommend this company.if you are into.active adventures with spectacular scenery and experiencing a different culture.

Reliable, punctual and honest. We have used Ace the Himalaya on a number of occasions, the last time being in March 2014. Prem and his crew are an honest and reliable group of people who you will always feel safe with. Our trip to Arupokhari was great and our driver lovely. In Nepal, Prem/ Ace the Himalaya will always be the company i make bookings with with and refer other people to

Ace is amazing. WOW is all I can say about Ace. Prem and staff were amazing throughout the entire process. Friendly, super knowledgeable, and handled everything for my trip. They were always concerned about my comfort and seeing that a memorable trip was had by myself and my partner. I had a medical issue that caused Prem and my guide to both work into the night to get resolution on. Of course being sick in a foreign country can be a scary ordeal, but it was handled professionally and worked out well.I can say with certainty that they'll be at the top of my list for my next trip and I can say without reservation that I'd go with them again.

ACE is perfect. Our trip could not have been better as our guide, Santosh Khatri, and our 3 porters were overly friendly, helpful, caring, protective and informative. They were all highly professional, knowledgeable and spoke great English (along with a few other languages.) Santosh is an amazing guide, not enough could be said about how exceptional he was. Everybody at ACE made sure all of our desires were met.

Ace is Tops!. This is the second time I have used "Ace the Himalayas" and I expect it won't be the last. A very professional outfit all around. The guides were terrific - caring and enthusiastic. Prem manages a first class operation.

Ace the Himalaya aced it!. In short, they aced everything from pick up to drop off and everything in between. I was extremely satisfied with the company and how they took care of every little detail, which allowed me to fully enjoy my trip. My guide Khilnath was perfect, and very helpful when I got sick. I would recommend Ace for any trip your thinking about!

My Experience with Ace the Himalaya. I had a very good support system with the day tour.....even though I became ill, I felt the company was there to support me in each and every way...and I am grateful for that Roj was my guide and I felt he did an outstanding job.

Incredible Adventure. From the time we landed in Kathmandu until we departed, Ace took care of every need and made our adventure and incredible experience. Super friendly and knowledgable staff, guides, and porters made the trip a blast. Our lead guide was Raj Khatri, with Rajan as our assistant guide. These guys did a great job and really bent over backwards to make sure every member of the group was being taken care of and satisfied. I didn't want to leave and will most definitely be back. I won't hesitate to book with Ace in the future and would recommend them to any of my friends who are looking for a first-rate adventure tour.

A Fabulous Taste of Nepal. We can't say enough about Ace the Himalaya! From booking the trip with Kathy and Prem to our guide, Ram, the whole experience was seamless! All of the staff were professional, helpful and flexible. We needed to change one part of the our itinerary and it was no problem. And our guide was from Nepal, not some other country, and was so informative and gave us a great taste of Kathmandu!

Another incredible stay in Nepal. It's hard to put into words what has become my passion for Nepal. This winter was my fourth visit and each time all the arrangements have been made by Ace the Himalaya. I would highly recommend this company to anyone contemplating a trip to Nepal for their excellent, personal and caring service. What started off as an Everest Base Camp Trek several years ago has turned into a series of amazing experiences and friendships thanks to my wonderful guide Kishor Neupane who is so much more than just a guide. I have learnt so much from him and today after my fourth visit he has literally become part of my family to the point where I have had the honor to stay in his home with his parents in his village. Again, I can't speak highly enough of Ace the Himalayas especially as not only are all the arrangements for trekking and touring so good but part of the policy is to give back to the village communities which is so vitally important in Nepal.

Global Village Nepal Trip. The Ace the Himalaya team were positive, motivating and very competent. The entire trip was well organised and an amazing experience. I would highly recommend these guys to anyone

Yala Peak 5700 Climbing - Langtang Himal. We had a GREAT and FANTASTIC Trip. Langtang and Yala Peak was GREAT!! peaceful place, and its really nice trekking to begun your adventure even for beginner. Nepal is truly "Never Ending Peace And Love" for the ACE Himalaya, your crew was unforgettable great. patient, friendly, nice, helpful, polite, and they are really strong to carried more than 45kgs of our stuff :))Prem is nice person, responsive, responsible and kind. The service was good, the hotel is nice, the meals, as long as you can put green chilli and more salt that's okay for us ;p lolfor sure we plan to get back to Nepal :) note : for the porter it would be more good if you can improve for the english :)Cheer'sAlfira, Jacky, and Billy - Indonesia

Highly recommend. I used Ace the Himalaya to help organize a group tour of Nepal and was very satisfied with Prem's professional, efficient, and clear communication and organization. He was very responsive to my requests and offered many thoughtful suggestions. I would definitely use Prem the next time I take a group to Nepal and would trust his recommendations.

Great personalised service!. Ace the Himalaya were instrumental in making our UNSW volunteering and trekking adventure as successful as it was. They offered a completely personalised and hands on service, with a strong sense of community awareness and responsibility. They were able to tailor our itinerary to suit our requirements, and made things possible that I believe many other companies couldn't, such as white water rafting on the Bengali river. This was due to their ties to the local community in Arupokhari village district.I cannot recommend travelling with ACE strongly enough, their level of service is second to none, and the experience and wealth of knowledge presented by the guides and the company is exceptional.

A perfectly organised trip!. If you are looking for a well-organised, caring and trustworthy travel company then look no further! I travelled to Nepal in a Univeristy trip with 9 others. Ace organised our sight-seeing in Kathmandu and Pokhara, our trek (the Annapurna Circuit) and most importantly our two week volunteering in a remote village in Gorkha.The most important thing with Ace that we found was they really looked after our group. Ace provided everything we needed for all of our activities, so the entire trip was completely stress free. Sight seeing was well organised with very knowledgable guides with great understanding of english.For the trekking, our guide became like a close friend who really looked after our needs. The porters they provided were cheery and very helpful, and the accommodation and food all previously organised. There were no complications so we could concentrate on the trek and not worry about where we were going to stay and what we were going to eat. They also gave us down jackets for free hire because of the cold and duffle bags for our belongings. The volunteering was also very well organised, with a chef accompanying us, and the guide was a local who helped integrate perfectly into village life.All together it was the perfect trip! Ace are highly, highly recommended!

Amazing trip - Arupokhari Volunteer Program. If you are adventurous, excited by different cultures and a dose of personal challenge, this trip is for you. I signed up with a group of UNSW students for 2 weeks of teaching primary school students in the mountain village of Arupokhari, 5-8 hours from Kathmandu, and about a week of trekking, rafting and general touristing. Upon arrival at the village, the kids welcomed us with buckets of flowers, a tune of the national anthem and wide smiles that were extremely contagious. Despite their limited English and our even more limited Nepali, it wasn’t long before they treated us like big siblings. Day 1 of teaching was challenging, as the kids are more shy than the average western student. But we soon grew in confidence and developed ways of engaging that will no doubt be useful for public speaking or in the workplace. I stayed in the family home of one student. The facilities are simple, but I had access to clean water and everything I needed. Most importantly, I woke up each morning to the world’s best sweet milk tea, some nice conversation with the family, and a stunning view of paddy fields covered in clouds. We were fed with dal bhat, a traditional Nepali staple, and a collection of Indian-Western fusion dishes that tasted delicious. The village is generally clean as it is sparsely populated, and we all stayed healthy. Upon returning to Sydney, I deeply missed the days filled with purposeful trips to the school and making friends the old-fashioned way, without facebook, email and other things that we keep busy with. I might have taught them a little bit of English, but they taught me how to live happily from the inside out.

Everest Base Camp trek. This was my first solo international trip and I wanted to go with a reputable and local (Kathmandu) trekking company. From the opening inquiry to final post-trek correspondance, Ace the Himalaya's customer service was prompt, helpful, and comprehensive. It was important to me to trek with a group and I ended up with just two other people and the guide. Prem let me know in advance how many people I'd be trekking with and answered a host of other last minute travel and tip questions. As for the trek itself, I got within two stops of Everest Base Camp (Dinboche - 14,800') and did not acclimate well. Apparently I'm a "slow acclimatizer" and needed more than the two nights we had to adjust to that altitude. At any rate, my guide, Bharat, arranged an alternate route back down to Namche Bazaar, thru villages we hadn't previously trekked up. At that point, one of the young porters, Binot, served as guide, too, and did a splendid job of it! He was cheerful and always helpful and the trek down took on a new, more introspective turn. It was actually my favorite part of the hike, stopping at Khumjung for the night, followed by a leisurely stroll adjacent to Shyangboche airstrip then a short hike back down to Namche where I reunited with my small group. I had a great travel experience using Ace the Himalaya and would recommend them without hesitation.

ABC trek - trip of a lifetime!!. My dad and I did the Annapurna Base Camp trek with Ace the Himalaya this September and had the time of our lives!!! The customer service that Prem provided from afar was top notch. Even before we got there, we felt comfortable, well prepared and excited! And the service once we got there did not disappoint. We were picked up from the airport, taken to the hotel, given a tour of Kathmandu, Pokhara, etc. There was always someone there to help without feeling like they were hand holding us. And the trek was amazing!! Our guide, Suman, was the best - so warm and friendly, incredibly knowledgeable and helpful - just a lovely, wonderful person. Our porter Prassand also couldn't have been nicer (and was incredibly strong and fast to boot!) We felt so well taken care of the whole time. We were a bit slower than most trekkers, needing to go at our own pace, especially on the steep hills. Suman NEVER rushed us, and even helped set us at a nice, steady pace. We spoke to some people who were not happy with their guides - one woman felt uncomfortable by the way her guide looked at her (yikes!) I can't stress how important it is to feel safe and comfortable with your guide when on the trail, and Suman was top notch. It was truly a once in a lifetime trip and we couldn't have been happier to do it with Ace.

Excellent trip to Everest base camp!. This was my first "solo" international trip and I couldn't have been more pleased. All accommodations and transportation in Nepal were taken care of, which took a lot of burden off of me. The trip started as a solo trip but I was paired up with another person that signed up for the same trip. I'm really glad it was more than just me on the trip, in Kathmandu I was taking in so much just seeing a culture so different from my own for the first time that I had no idea what questions to ask, the other person on the trip had a lots of questions and our guide was very knowledgeable and answered all of the questions. When we flew up to Lukla to start our trek to Everest base camp we got a different guide, Raj, who has more experience in the mountains. The pace of life up there was much slower and I had more time to take things in and start to ponder them. Raj was able to answer all of my questions and he makes some good jokes too. He kept things interesting, helped me pick food that wouldn't bother my stomach when I got a little sick after my water filter broke and always made sure we were having a good time. When we made our way out to base camp he pulled candy bars and other snacks out of his bag for us since there aren't any places to get food out there. In the evening he would meet with us and let us know what to expect as far as weather and amount of hiking for the next day. Overall the trip was excellent and I highly recommend Ace the Himalaya for anyone that wants to see Nepal, even if they've never traveled internationally before.

A great tour of Kathmandu!. Going to see Everest has been on my bucket list for many years. After illness struck, I had to stop early and head back down to the city.The guys at Ace were amazing, encouraging me to tour the city since I had some unexpected free time on my hands.The driver and guide arrived promptly, just after breakfast. We stopped off at three major monuments in the city, taking time to walk through them carefully, stopping often to discuss details of the various locations.The guide was amazing, having a masters degree in polisci. It was great getting a history lesson, talk geo politics, and discuss and compare our lives.There was ample time in the tour to see (and buy from) the local artists, but i never really felt pushed into making purchases.I look forward to booking with Prem and Ace again next time I come to Nepal!

Mt. Everest Basecamp Trek. We hiked from Lukla to Gorak Shep. From Gorak Shep, we went to Everest Basecamp and to the top of Kala Patthar. This is such a beautiful hike. The best words I have to describe Everest Basecamp and viewing the surrounding peaks from Kala Patthar are other worldly. One of the best views you will ever have. Many people I met on the trail said they weren't going to go up to Basecamp because there wasn't anyone there this time of year (Nov). It was their loss. Hiking along the Kumbu Glacier with Nuptse towering is worth every second.Many thanks to everyone at Ace, especially my guide Raj and my porter Krishna, for making this trip possible. The pace they set for the elevation gain was perfect. Raj always answered my questions about which peak was which, why this or why that. I learned a lot from him, not just about the mountains, but about the area and the trail. I would recommend Ace to anyone. They take care of you, are well organized, are professional, are fun, and are an all Nepalese company, meaning the money you spend stays within Nepal, which I really liked. Happy trekking!!!-James

Everest Base Camp Trek. An amazing experience! A dream fulfilled thanks to ACE and its team. My friend and I finally fullfilled a wish to see Everest Base Camp. Thanks to our outstanding guide Suman,not only did we see Base Camp, but also Kalapattar. Without his Himalayain trekking knowledge and guiding expertise our trek would not have been as successful and enjoyable. His knowledge was often sought by other guides and trekkers. He is well respected by many and he shared his expertise freely. We both appreciate Suman for his concern for our wellbeing throughout our trek and his consideration for us to achieve our goal. There were times when we had doubts as to whether we would be able complete the trek. But with Suman's encouragement and support we were able to continue. Also our sincere thanks to our porter " Binord" who was friendly and totalling amazing. We thank and wish both of them all the very best in the future . I have no hesitation in recommending Suman, as his organisational skills along the trek were outstanding. A thank you to Prem and his team from ACE the Himalaya for a professionally co-ordinated travel experience.Arn and Daz

Island peak summit trek. I would like to take this opertunaty to thank Ace the Himalaya, Prem, Arjun, Des and the whole team at Ace for a fantastic trek. My guide Arjun did a terrific job and his knowledge and organization along the entire trek was nothing short of the best! i took on this climb as a fundraiser for children with Autism, so it was very important to me and the cause that everything went well and to plan. And all did. Next time i head to nepal i will be ringing the team at Ace as my first phone call and also asking for Arjun as my guide once again. Thank you all again for a great experiance ! Danny

Annapurna Circuit Trek. Now back home from the Annapurna Circuit I would like to thank Prem from the ACE very much for the perfect organized three weeks trek. Santosh, my guide picked me up from the airport, the next day I had a very interesting tour in Kathmandu and Bhaktapur, which was ideal also to get „acclimatized“ and a first impression of the country. Well equipped with the additional material offered by the ACE (in the higher regions I was grateful for the down jacket!) we started our trekk. My guide Santosh and Ram who carried my bag were great, always cheerful and very caring! They are doing such an excellent job that I was even asked by other trekkers how I have found them. They explained a lot about Nepal, the different regions and cultures and both did not get tired to give me the name and altitude of the mountains when I was asking the dozenth time (since the mountains look different from each perspective…). Thanks to them I got to know Nepal (and a little bit nepali) as good as possible in such a short time. Since we were a small size group and met so many other nice trekkers on our way it was even possible to vary the itinerary and stayed one day in the beautiful Kagbeni. And last but not least not to forget the extra fruit desert which they serve every day.Thanks again to Prem, Santosh and Ram and hopefully see you againVeronika

Smooth Trekking. Just returned from the Annapurna Base Camp Trek, my first trip to Nepal. Weather disallowed the flight to Lukla and the planned Everest BC trek so we had to do a different itinerary. The ACE team made the transiton for us very quickly and very smoothly. We decided to change our destination to Annapurna around noon when we realized a flight to Lukla was impossible. They had us on a van to Pokhara that same evening to start the ABC trek with a new trip itinerary. Our trek guide Ganyu was experienced and knew what he was doing. He knows all parts of the trek like the back of his hand. He was fun to be around and knowledgably answered all of our questions. His team took care of all the little stuff and were courteous and friendly. That helped me to just enjoy the nature of Nepal and enjoy the company of the others on the trip. ACE seemed like a very organized company and I would recommend them for anyone looking to do a trip to Nepal. Since an honest review will also point out things that need improvement, here is what I say they can improve on. Charging for every cup of tea and coffee along the trek starts to get ridiculous. You sort of feel like you are getting nickle and dimed the whole way. I also had to wait for my pick up from the airport for more than an hour when I arrived. Overall a memorable trip that I will not soon forget.

Plan B-Annapurna Base Camp. Since June of 1998 my goal has been to summit Mount Everest. With the cost, vacation time, physical, mental, and psychological challenges Everest creates a lot of barriers to overcome. I thought to myself if I cannot summit Mount Everest I would be satisfied with stepping foot on Everest. In 2011 I came across Ace the Himalaya and called up a buddy to see if he would like to share this experience of climbing Everest Base Camp. Prem the owner of Ace was very flexible, informative, and responded to each of my emails throughout the year until our dream came true in September of 2012. Although due to bad weather our dream was placed on hold, Ace the Himalaya provided us with an immediate backup plan....Annapurna Base Camp. At first I was very frustrated but knew that no one person can predict the weather and we needed to take advantage of something before we ran out of time. Most people come to Nepal to see the mesmerizing beauty of Everest, but I would highly encourage Annapurna Base Camp. Gyanu our lead guided was very knowledgable and spoke excellent english. My hat goes off to the porters. I'm always amazed how these guys who wear flipflops and throw 80-100lbs over their heads and climb up a mountain as though it's nothing is done with such ease. And for Dale our city tour guide to Bhaktapur Durbar Square, we couldn't ask for a better guided. The compassion and emotion he showed to his city was felt throught the history lesson he gave our group. The only suggestion I would give is train on the stairmaster, drink lots of water, and avoid buying thousands of dollars worth of gear. In Kathmandu there are stores every other building with cheap prices (this will save you lots of money if you're on a budget).

Great guide for Kathmandu area and Trek but really outstanding when things didn't go as planned!. Prem and his team provided seamless oversight from planning to post-travel. While guides Dill in Kathmandu and Raj on the Everest trek were very good, we really appreciated the team when things didn't go as planned (as often is the case).One of our party (total of 5 friends and family) missed her flight and arrived almost two days later than planned; Ace arranged for a pickup in Kathmandu International Airport then speedy shuttle to the regional airport to catch the last plane to Lukla. When she arrived in Lukla she was greeted by a porter and they hustled to meet the rest of us (at a very fast pace). This was all done while keeping everyone informed and on schedule.Our group's return to Kathmandu from Lukla was delayed because of weather. We were able to arrange for a helicopter charter on the third day but in the meantime all arrangements were made by Ace and our local guide Raj. We were in very capable hands and never had to worry about accommodations or meals. Everything was smooth on our return to Kathmandu including a half day tour of the city when we arrived and hotel room to prepare for the long flights home.Thanks to Ace we were able to enjoy Nepal and leave most of the details to them.

Great Trip. I methodically researched multiple Guide Company's before deciding on ACE for my and my friend's Everest Base Camp Trek. Prior to our Trek date Prem kept us completely in the loop about our trek, our timelines and what to expect. Everything went exactly as he explained it and as he led us to expect it. On the actual Trek our Guide Gyanu, and porter, Ratna were tremendous people as well as knowledgable. They went out of thier way to make sure we were safe, comfortable and had a good time. I cannot recommend them enough.

Everest Base Campe Trek - Awesome!. Everything about our trek was first-rate. Our guide and porter took excellent care of us. They watched over us for AMS, handled all our flights, food, and lodging, and kept us in great spirits. I would recommend Ace to anyone who is interested in EBC.

Sambhav Nepal volunteering expedition. It was a great experience, enjoyed every minute of it. The quality of my personal guide was exceptional and the plan of the trip was perfect. I recommend this to anyone who wants to volunteer in Nepal and have an experience of a lifetime.

Educational Tour. I could not ask for a kinder, friendlier or more professional tour company than Ace. I had been in contact with Prem for 3 years to arrange a trip for 14 people (17-18 year olds) and we were not dissapointed. We were met at the airport by Amret who stayed with us for most of the trip. Although young, his sense of humour and helpful nature was exceptional. Our tour guide around Kathmandu, Dil was extrememly knowledgeable and as for Rajendra our main guide, lovely, caring, knowledgeable and very funny. I cant wait until I can plan another trip with this company. I cannot speak highly enough of them all.

Jomolhari Trek and Bhutan Culture Tour. "Jomolhari Trek and Culture Tour June 2012" - Martin Suter, Julian MeitanisWe spent 2 wonderful and unforgettable weeks in Kindom of Bhutan for which we are very greatful. A 9 day trek followed by additional days to explore land and culture completed the experience. ACE cooperated well with the mandatory local travel agency and showed great flexibility in adjusting the trip to our needs and wishes. Swiss ACE travel agent Melanie provided us with plenty of useful background as well as timely information... all went perfectly smooth.We could not have been more lucky with our local guide Tendin and his cultural know-how and great experience. His humor and charismatic character made us think more of a friend than of a guide and we spent many hours of laughing and talking on the trip. All the other crew members were competent and very helpful leaving us without any wishes. Optional side trips and talking to locals like remote monasteries and schools made the trip even more unforgettable. Food, accommodation, trekking equipment... all to our satisfaction and we were always surprised by some occasional goodies and "specialities"!We definitively can recommend the trip to everyone, even in late June, having the route and the beauty for yourself...Martin SuterZurich, Switzerland

Everest Base Camp- One in a million!. A friend and I have just returned from completing the Everest Base Camp trek with Ace and the experience was sensational! Our guide Toya was brilliant- he knew the track like the back of his own hand and could answer any of the numerous questions we fired at him each day! What made the trip is that the trek was our own- Toya walked to our pace and ensured we knew exactly where we were headed each day and his knowledge of the region meant that we learnt so much and never missed a beautiful photo opportunity! Before heading off Ace also ensured we were adequately prepared and filled in the gaps with their own gear- sleeping bags, goose down jackets etc. We plan to head back to the Himalayas next year for another trek with ACE!

Everest Base Camp via Gokyo Lakes, April 2012.. My husband and I have wanted to trek to EBC for ages, and finally a large chunk of leave allowed us to do it! The first thing was to find a reputable company. Like others we wanted to use a local company to try and keep the profits in Nepal. Ace the Himalaya had fantastic reviews Trip Advisor, and the rapid and courteous response from Prem confirmed that this was the tour group for us. We did some research and realised that the EBC track is really crowded and pretty much a long dirt track, so we decided to spice it up and go via Gokyo which was the BEST decision we made! The Gokyo scenery is amazing, seriously amazing, compared to the EBC trek (you come back down via EBC trek, so we so both ways). You come across people from time to time, but you feel like the whole universe is yours alone.Our guide, Raj, was an absolute champion. He knew all the ins-and-outs of dealing with any bureaucracy etc, and when we arrived early to Lukla on the way back, he somehow managed to get us two seats on a flight home when they were booked solid. Our porter, Gopal, was hilarious! He was a dead ringer for Marky-Mark (Mark Wahlberg) but the Nepalese version. He was strong as an ox and fast as a race-horse and always had a huge cheeky smile on his face. Both men took care of us at all times, particularly when crossing the Cho-La Pass, and on the morning of Kala Pattar. Those two days are really tough going. Up to 8 hour days in the freezing cold, and the altitude was pretty intense. It was just the four of us, so we felt like a fabulous little team (aka The Funky Bunch). The tea-houses are pretty simple, and increasingly so as you climb higher and higher. Electricity and hot showers disappear after Namche and the yak dung fires only got lit at about 530pm, so we were usually wearing everything we owned all at the same time. Again, Ace supplied great down jackets and down sleeping bags. That was another bonus of going via Gokyo... less people crowded together meant we didn't get the hallmark "Khumbu" chest cough. I can't express the beauty of the scenery of the entire trek. It's just overwhelming and it hits you right at the root of your soul. All the big mountains are stunning, but yes, something about Everest is frightening, grave and majestic at the same time. You start getting glimpses of Everest on about the second day of walking, and you'll never forget the first time you lay eyes on it. You will never forget this entire experience.Thanks to Raj, Gopal, Prem and the whole Ace Team. You might see us again very soon!

Everest Base Camp Trek. ACE and my guide, Gyanu, and my porter, Ratna, provided excellent service on my Everest Base Camp trek. Without their help and knowledge, it would have been difficult and not nearly as much fun. I was able to enjoy the most beautiful place in the world to the fullest extent. After talking with other trekkers, I KNOW I had the best company and guide and porter in the business. I highly recommend ACE The Himalaya and its guide and porter.

Ace the Himalaya review. Its been six months since we got back from our Everest base camp trek with AtH, looking back at our trip photos it brought back tons of good memories hence the review. AtH did a good job getting us organize amid the craziness at the end (more below), overall our guide Raj did an awesome job leading us and took care of our needs along the way. We had a good crew and Raj treated us like team members more than 'clients' which is very welcoming! only thing we felt a little cheated was the meal options. We get that it was a really busy season and time is always a constraint we felt like our meal choices were really limited most of the time...somehow the next tables food always look better! at the end of our trip we were trapped in Lukla due to bad weather and plane cancellation and that got really chaotic as NO ONE seem to know what is the plan of action or when we can get out...our guides seem like they did the best they can to get us out and looking bad it really wasn't as bad as it seemed (tho at the time it was really scary..not knowing how long we would be trapped on the mountain). In the end we paid for helicopter rescue and thanks to Prem, we got our money back from insurance after he provided us with receipts thru emails. (make sure you get travel insurance, apparently this happens often enough...and it was 700US pp for the helicopter ride!). Overall, it was a trip of a life time and i highly recommend going with Ace :)

 Arupokhari Schools Volunteer Program (for teaching). What a fantastic experience, Gill and I spent just under 2 weeks teaching English and researching Ethnobotany with children at the Shree Bhairabi Primary School. Where to start? A big part of the experience was staying with Raj's (our guide and translator's) family. We were made so welcome, we indeed believed we were part of his family. The day's started early, 5am before the heat became too hot, school started at 10.00 and lasted to 3.30-4.00pm. The evenings were cooler, an opportunity to relax with a walk or even a swim in the river (and prepare the next lesson plans). There were some stunning views of distant ice covered mountains.Despite the heat the children were full of energy, they seemed to have learnt a lot of English by rote. Using creative games such as matching words using cards/pictures/removing word cards/hangman/miming all seemed new and went down well - lesson planning was essential!Part of our work was to record local plants recognised by locals for their medicinal value, we set a homework exercise with the children, asking them to seek information from their family elders. This was a mixed success, the children certainly had a good grasp of identifying local flora, but parents and grand parents had far more knowledge. We hope this initial work will be followed up. A very effective way of researching 'Ethnobotany' was to sit with a family elder using a Nepalise/Latin/English plant dictionary (available from Pilgrims book shop in Kathmandu - we also donated a copy to the village library). There just wasn't enough time to go right through the dictionary with enough people!I was really moved by the endearing friendliness of all the local people we met, the quality and delicious flavours of the local produce and cooking. The village had only been connected to the electricity grid for 2 years, like the water at the standing tap, the supply kept coming and going, people just cheerfully got on with life, working around these 'small' inconveniencies.As I said at the start; an amazing experience, I really want to go back, despite the levels of poverty, many aspects of this life style, often lost in the 'west' where community pull together to help one another, are really appealing. I hope this isn't lost as the nation develops.

My Dream Holiday. The most rewarding hiking adventure ever with a very professional and fun loving team to guide the way around Annapurna. Prem is a the very capable director of Ace the Himalaya who bent over backwards when the hiking gear of one of our group failed to arrive from Singapore. He tracked it down and had it sent to Pokhara the day before the trek started. The rest of the trip was hassle free. Prem is an inspiration with his Sambhav Foundation which is well worth supporting. Put it on your bucket list. Everyone should see the beautiful Himalaya mountains.

Ace the Himalaya (Tibetan Cultural Tour). This was not my first trip to Nepal, but it was the first with my family. I was keen for my husband to love Nepal like I do and wanted to make sure that everything was pre-arranged, as we only had three weeks and were travelling with our daughters aged eight and ten. As I’d already travelled to the areas of Nepal that we were going to, I thought it would be nice to also go somewhere new, so decided upon Tibet.I first contacted Prem when I was having significant difficulty organising the Tibet component of our trip through a Kathmandu-based company that also had an office in Sydney. In contrast, Prem was a delight to deal with. He answered questions promptly and provided exactly the information I needed. I wished I’d also organised the Nepalese component of our trip through Prem.When we arrived in Kathmandu, Prem and his staff were terrific. Our Tibetan visas were organised with a minimum of fuss. The hotel that we had been booked us into (The Samsara Resort Hotel) was a little piece of calm within the hustle and bustle of Thamel.We thoroughly enjoyed the Tibetan Cultural Tour. Our guide Pasang Nodup and our driver Kelsang Wangdue were lovely. They were friendly, helpful and we always felt like we were in very safe hands. The vehicle was extremely comfortable. The monasteries we visited were incredible and Pasang gave us wonderful information on each. The Potala Palace was amazing ... difficult to describe in just a few words. The Tibetan countryside was rugged and beautiful and the people were truly lovely. So many of them wanted to spend time with our daughters. We were fortunate to have very clear days and so were afforded stunning views of the Himalayas including Everest. All of the hotels and guesthouses were very comfortable and well located. We enjoyed the authenticity of the guesthouses and we enjoyed the comfort of the hotels, so it was good to have a mix of each.It’s certainly not an easy trip (the “strenuous” rating became apparent when we were at altitude), but it was fabulous and we’ll be reliving it through our memories and photos for a long time to come.Thank you so much to Prem and his team at Ace the Himalaya. It’s always a leap of faith arranging a holiday from a different country, but I’d thoroughly recommend Prem and his team. My husband was so impressed that he’s already planning a return trip (he trying to decide between the cycling trips run in Tibet and Nepal, but I think Nepal’s currently winning). I’ll be returning to trek Upper Mustang. And while we’re each off doing our adventure bit, the other will be trekking with our two daughters, who would return to Nepal and Tibet in a heartbeat.

The best local himalayan trekking company. I am from New Zealand and I stumbled across Ace while surfing the internet for my himalayan trekking adventure. Based on other positive reviews, I decided to go with them. Now I don't regret that decision because I had a wonderful time, and all because of Ace The Himalaya and their lovely guide, Arjun. Ace is a local company managed and run by local people. From what I gathered, they employ all local people and pay and treat them well. Remember not all touring companies in Nepal do that, they just want your money, but don't care for their employees. Ace made me have a wonderful experience. Prem was very quick and prompt in his email responses and was happy to respond to the silliest of my enquiries. A very patient man with excellent customer service focus. For Ace their customers come first and they will be ready to go to lengths to make sure their customers safe and well looked after.They employ an amazing group of guides and porters. I did the Everest base camp and Kala Patthar trip and my guide Arjun, a 23 year old boy, made sure that I had a wonderful time. A soft spoken and polite boy, Arjun, looks too young, but has the maturity to take the responsibility of his customers in the mountains. Through out my trek, Arjun was in the front and the Porter, Mohan, was at the back. They made sure I never slipped or took a wrong step. They don't push you, and give you all the freedom you want in the mountains, taking as many rest and photo stops as you want. Arjun took take care of me in every lodge, even bringing me hot water bowl in the mornings so that I could wash my face and teeth. Believe me, it is so cold up there that without that bowl of hot water I would be feeling pretty low through out the day.I even met a single Canadian lady doing her trek with a male guide from Ace. She mentioned that the guide was taking care of her so well that she did not feel uncomformtable even for a second, although being a solo woman traveller. Ace guides have a lot of respect for woman tourists.Overall, I can vouch for Ace the Himalaya and their guides and porters. I think their customer focus makes them stand apart. Even when things go wrong, like flight cancellations or weather delays, or your sickness, they don't complain and put the priority of their customers first.Well done Ace. Keep up your customer friendly focus, and thanks for my lovely trek up the mountains.I will be going back with them again in three years :-).

Annapurna Circuit, amazing trip. Thanks to Ace The Himalayas we have just completed an amazing trek around the Annapurna Circuit. We booked a private trip through Ace The Himalayas for just my husband and myself with a Guide and Porter. I found the trip on responsibletravel.com and after writing to all the Nepal trip providers I felt that Ace was the most helpful right from the first email. They were able to tailor the trip to fit our requirements and were good value in comparison to other providers. We had an amazing trip, our guide Raj (KC) and our porter 'Kancha' were great. I probably wouldn't have made it over the Thorung La pass without them, especially as I slipped and slid my way down the pass they were also there with a helpful hand to catch me! Raj and Kancha also both managed to look ridiculously stylish at all times, while my husband was doing his best impression of a ginger yeti by the end of the 3 weeks Raj was immaculately groomed everyday! We were pleased that they were both well equipped when so many other firms let their porters go over the pass in trainers and without proper cold weather gear.Raj always chose great guesthouses, not the most commercial ones, he seemed to be very well respected by all the guesthouse owners, my husband ended up in a volleyball match in Manang with Raj and Kancha and the chef from our hotel there. Kancha joined in our nightly card games and kept us entertained with his card tricks! He is training to be a guide and will be great at this, I would have no hesitation in returning with him as a guide. The trek itself was immensely enjoyable, the scenery is unmatchable. While the route is touristy we managed to avoid the crowds by going at the very beginning of March and Raj always chose guesthouses slightly away from the crowds and always found great lunch stops for Dal Bhat. We would definitely book again through Ace if we return to Nepal and given what an amazing time we had I think that's more a question of when not if!

Ace the Himalayas recommendation. I went trekking with Ace over Xmas & New Year recently. From the initial enquiry Prem provided usefulinformation and a prompt response. The trip was very well organised, the guide (Suman) provided excellent service and knowledge about the area and was always there if needed. Although not the cheapest trip available, the excellent organisation and knowledgeable guides made it worth the $$. I would highly recommend using Ace for treks in Nepal and will certainly contact Prem & Suman for future trips.

Ace the Himalaya is the only way to go in Nepal. Our guide Raj and porter Khil took excellent care of us at all times. My husband and I, both seniors, were guided carefully at all times. We were advised what to eat, what each day's trek would be like and what cultural information we needed to be aware of. We felt safe, adequately challenged by the pace and comfortable with the accommodation, meals and water supply. And we had fun. We learned some Nepali phrases and songs, saw incredible sights and were never bored for one minute.We travelled to Annapurna Circuit, Annapurna Base camp, Upper Mustang and the Everest Region. Unforgettable. Don't hesitate to go with this company.

Incredible trek and amazing staff!. We celebrated my 50th birthday with a trek through the Annapurna Circuit and were very pleased with our experience with Ace the Himalaya. From the initial booking online, general transportation, and with the trek itself, the staff was always professional and very accommodating. They were incredibly supportive, met the various needs of team members and their extensive experience made us feel safe throughout our trip. The guides and porters were knowledgeable of the area, hardworking and very patient (even with difficult personalities). Accommodations were always ready at the end of each trekking day which was much appreciated. We followed their recommendations regarding food and were generally very happy and satisfied with our meals. We highly recommend Ace the Himalaya to anyone considering an adventure in Nepal! We look forward to future treks with them.

Trip was amazing!!!!!. Our guide was amazing and brought all of our group together. It really felt as if we were a team. I had an awesome experience and wish the exact experience upon all who wish to visit the Himalayas. ACE and their guides were very professional and knowledgable about all aspects of trekking and climbing.Thanks!!!
The time of my life. Go with Ace the Himalaya. Good guides, pro organised.

Why choose Ace the Himalyas?. There are plenty of trekking companies, but one that stands apart is Ace the Himalayas. The professionalism and expertise of this company was evidenced time and again during our recent trip to Kathmandu and Ghorka district.Our guides Gynu and Raj were very experienced, our driver Sungram was fearless on the country roads. The tents were luxurious and the camp kitchen delicious. My most favourite memory is being woken up with 'wake up tea, and a bowl of steaming water to wash the face. All of the Nepali team were friendly, helpful, humble and took great care of our group.Whether collecting us from the airport, taking us to secret shopping districts, leading us through village trekks or having a friendly joke at days end. That's why we chose Ace the Himalyas, and highly recomend this company.Joanne Nelson- Sydney Australia

Great time with Everest Base Camp trek. I organized my trip to Nepal and made bookings online via email with Ace. It went really well. I had quick replies to my emails which was appreciated.I had arranged for airport pick-up so it was smooth getting to the hotel after long flights. The hotel they booked for me was nice, a bit out of the touristy area yet within walking distance. It was nice to know I could go to Ace while in Kathmandu if I needed something (although I didn't).On the first morning of the Everest Base Camp trek, the guide came to pick me up at the hotel. From there it was a fun adventure in the Himalayas. Gyanu, our guide, and Ressam, our porter, did an amazing job. We were only two on our group, so it was quite nice! I was able to ask many questions to the guide, about the culture, life in that region, etc. He was very knowledgeable. He also had our safety at heart, with yaks and dzos on the trail! I was the slowest one in our group of two, but I didn't feel pushed to go fast, we had a good system going... Sometimes the guide would walk with me when it was rougher, but sometimes he'd walk ahead and wait in some spots for me to join up. I didn't feel rushed, I took many great pictures. Gyanu also made sure we got good rooms in our lodges, with a nice view or not near the bathroom for example! They also thought us neat card games and chatted during evenings in the lodges main rooms. It was a great trip to Everest Base Camp thanks to Ace and their nice staff.

Possibly the best and most authentic customer service experience I've had. My wife and I volunteered to do some teacher training in the Dharapani school near Arughat in the Gorkha district in January 2012. Ace the Himalaya was responsible for taking care of us from the moment we arrived in Kathmandu until we left again two weeks later. This included transport to and from the airport, accommodation and a sight-seeing tour in Kathmandu, transport to and from the village in Gorkha, preparing the site and pitching tents and providing all our meals.The accommodation wasn't exactly 5-star (tents and sleeping bags) but the personal attention and willingness to please was. You only had to ask and it was done, even if that meant someone popping down to village a mere 600m below and back again. The meals were outstanding and all prepared in a tent with equipment carried onto the site.We enjoyed outrageous views, some of the friendliest people we've met anywhere in the world and at night, singing and dancing around open fires. Our two guides, Raj and Gyanu, were friendly, polite and ever willing to help. Nothing was a bother and their commitment to customer service had a genuineness that I've rarely experienced anywhere.If you're visiting the small villages in the more remote areas you will need a camera, both light and heavy clothing as the days can be warm but the evenings and mornings are cold in winter, a head-lamp, a supply of toilet paper, and water-purification tablets and hand-distinfectant as a sensible precaution. Nepal can be a little confronting if you are used to the ways of the west but some cultural tolerance, respect, and modesty in dress and behavoiur will ensure your visit is as enjoyable as ours was.

Nothing was ever a problem.. ACE the Himalaya is a company that is full of dedicated staff. From the planning done by Prem, through to the excellent, attentive and extremely helpful guides Gyanu and Raj as well as all the other support staff. They went out of their way to make sure everything was alright and nothing was ever a problem. If you are planning a trip to Nepal I would highly recommend ACE the Himalaya as a company who will help you to enjoy your experience.

Extremely professional. I came across Ace the Himalaya by chance searching the internet. And what a lucky chance that was. I can't think of a company who would take me through my journey across the Everest region better and safer. Not only I booked just one week in advance, but I was solo and physically completely unprepared for the challenges that laid ahead. In fact, I had no trekking experience whatsoever and that was supposed to be my first one. So I simply ignored the "difficulty grade" and thought that EBC+Gokyo Ri/Lakes+High Passes+climbing Island Peak would be more fun than doing something easier, and that I'll deal with the "difficulties" later. I had no clue. And that's probably what Prem, the Managing Director, thought when he saw me, cause he kindly offered to do amendments to my itinerary, should i decide to quit half way through, so I don't lose the payment. Needless to say, not only i didn't quit any way through, but successfully completed the whole itinerary crossing all the passes and reaching the summit of Island Peak (i'm not mentioning EBC because it was kiddy stuff comparing to the rest;)). And all that thanks to the Ace the Himalaya team! I can't thank enough to: - Baikuntha (a.k.a. BK or Bai), who managed to take me through the trek without a single glitch; who kept my spirits high with his good humor and encouragement; who calmed me down when i was freaking out (about AMS mainly:)); who helped me pack when i was late (which was every day:)); carried my backpack when i was too tired; taught me so much about Nepal when i was bored; and who became a dear friend by the end of the trek, and i wouldn't go to another one in Himalayas if it's not BK leading the way:)- Raj, who, i can only imagine, has super human powers, cause i can't explain in any other way how on the treks where i could barely carry myself, he managed to carry all my stuff, get to the lodge ahead of us, and then come back to see if any more help was needed! And all that with a great spirit and cheerful laugh. At one point, when crossing Cho La Pass, he actually pulled me up the hill cause i couldn't take any step further:) - Pemba, without whom i would never be standing on top of Island Peak (6189 m) with no prior climbing experience nor physical training; whose approach to the climb was so professional that I think he actually counted my breathing to set the pace that i could follow and the amount of breaks i need to take (so i don't pass out half way up on the mountain lol:)). He also made sure the climb was very safe, the equipment in top condition, and that i receive an adequate amount of training to know how to use it. - Kishor (a.k.a. Kris), who sorted out all pre-trip necessities in Kathmandu and helped with helicopter transfer when all the flights to Lukla were cancelled. - and of course to Prem, who gathered such a great team and without whom this company wouldn't exist. His management and problem solving skills are outstanding and he always follows up with the team to make sure each of the clients are safe and happy and everything goes well on the trek.I would definitely recommend this company if you're traveling to the Himalayan region. You know you'll be in good hands!

Annapurna Base Camp Trek - Ace the Himalaya. I booked the Everest Base Camp trek but was unable to fly out to Lukla due to weather. I decided to switch to the Annapurna Base Camp trek rather than wait and take my chances flying out over the next few days. Although I was dissapointed I didn't get to see Everest, the Annapurna Trek was just as scenic as any of the pictures I had seen taken from the EBC trek. I couldn't speak highly enough of the trek itself. Accomodations are basic but I never felt I needed anything other than what was provided. I found Ace the Himalaya great. Everything to do with the last minute switch went smoothly. The cars provided were always high quality with professional drivers. I never got stuck waiting anywhere and they were always extremely professional. I would highly recommend my guide Rabin and porter Myla. I'm sure I could have hired a single guide and porter cheaper after arriving in Nepal, but being my first time there I was glad I went with an established company such as Ace. If anyone would like an additional information on the trek or the company feel free to contact me,

Amazing once in a lifetime experience!. My girlfriend and I had the time of our lives doing Everest Base Camp trek, Chitwan and Pokhara. The company looked after our every need and our guide Gyanu was absolutely amazing. Can't find a single fault with the experience and would definitely recommend Ace the Himalaya to others!

Tripe of a lifetime!. The Everest Base Camp trek with Ace the Himalaya was a trip of a lifetime! Our guide, Raj, and porters, Gobinda and Rotna, took great care of us and helped make the trip a safe and fabulous one! Raj was very knowledgeable of the area and the mountains. I would definitely recommend this trip to anyone who wants to take a challenging trek through the Himalayas. And I would also recommend Ace the Himalaya. The company was very professional, and the guides and porters were great! My only suggestion would be for the guides not to tell the travelers how much to tip the guides and porters unless they ask.

Trip of a Lifetime Gokyo - EBC - Island Peak. I recently completed a trek with 4 mates. We Flew into Lukla and trekked from there to Gokyo ( clmbing Gokyo Ri), across Cho La Pass and up the valley to Everest Base Camp (and Kala Pattar) then on to Island peak where we were taught enough climbing skills to get us to the summit and back down.The organisation of the trek was very good, the assistance we received from our guide, Suman, assistant guide Rewati and our porters was exceptional. Suman in particular was meticulous in preparing us for the altitudes we had to face. Our acclimatisation was very carefully managed. Our climbing guides at Island Peak were also very careful with our preparation for the climb, and their attention on summit day was excellent.A special mention to Suman for his efforts in getting us out of Lukla the end of our trek. We arrived during 7 day period of fogged in and closed airport. Suman did everything possible to ensure that we arrived back in Kathmandu for our international flights. Next time I travel to Nepal I will be arranging my trek through Ace the H. and requesting Suman as my guide.Cheers Brian

Great Everest trek with Ace. Some feedback on the recent Everest Base Camp trek we did with Ace in November.I was more than happy with the guiding and support provided by Ace.Suman our guide was great, very attentive to our needs and comforts during the trip, nothing was too much trouble for him and he was always smiling and cheerful.I would certainly be happy to trek with him again in the future or recommend him to others, the assistant guide and porters also did a very good job.The only problem I had was with the uncertainty of flights out of Lukla, however, I realise this wholly dependant on the weather and is out of the control of Ace.Ace did all they could behind the scenes to make sure we got out in time and for that I am very grateful.Once again I was very pleased with the trek and would be very happy to recommend Ace to anyone thinking of trekking in Nepal.

Nepal and Tibet 2011 with Ace the Himalaya. I have just returned to Perth after spending the past four weeks in Tibet and Nepal that was arranged thru Ace the HimalayaAfter my initial three days in Kathmandu, we travelled by coach for 4 days into Tibet on the Friendship Highway to Lhasa where we spent 3 days looking at the sights.The most memorial was be seeing the Potala Place at night. If you get the chance to go to Lhasa you must make the effort to see the palace at night it was beautiful.I flew back to Kathmandu, then had a driver take me to the Temple Tiger Safari Lodge in the Chitwan National Park, where I spent three days. The accommodation was great and the staff friendly and helpful. We did see Elephants, Rhino’s, deer, monkeys and crocodiles, But not any Tigers.On returning to Kathmandu we headed to the airport to start the 14 day Lukla, Gokyo Lake, Cho La Pass, Everest Base Camp return trek. Due to the weather our plane did not fly to we ended up taking a helicopter (great flight and being so low you see much more) to Surke, about two hours walk south of Lukla. Our first two days were damp and cold, but on the third day, the clouds cleared and we had fine weather for the rest of the trip. My guide for the trip was BK (Baikuntha Prasad Nepal) who is studying to be a teacher, so his English was very good and who had done this trip many times before and my porter Christian (Balkrishna Magyar) were both very helpful and at tentative.My goal had always been going to the Everest Base Camp after visiting Nepal some 30 plus years ago. We had trekked to Gokyo Lakes and the view was beautiful, especially with the light shimmering on the lake and the mountains behind when we climbed Gokyo Ri. All was going to plan other than me getting a chest infection the night before we climbed the Cho La Pass. That was hard, and took me 8 hours to complete with some assistance from both BK and Christian. What an achievement once we got to the top and cross the ice glacier. Now for the main goal of the trip. We reached Gorak Shep two days later and that same afternoon we headed for the Everest Base Camp. We saw glimpses of Everest on our three hour trek, and then we were there. The euphoria I got when I reached my goal was overwhelming. Photos, Video then the walk back to Gorak Shep, only took one half hours, but the sun was setting behind the mountains and it got cold. So cold that by the time I got back I could not feel my fingers as they were so cold and I had on two pairs of gloves. Must get better ones for my next trek.It had been getting colder the higher we climbed and most mornings part of my water bottle that I had in the room was generally frozen. The following morning in Gorak Shep the temperature inside the dining area was -4c and it must have been -10c to -15c outside. Although once the sun rose over the mountains it warmed up. We trekked back down thru the valley to Lukla and took the Yeti Airlines flight back to Kathmandu, then two days later flew back to Perth, WA.It was a fantastic journey, and one that that I had wanted to do for many years. Summary of trip;If someone said "would you do the same trip again", I would say "no" not unless I could be 30 years younger, although if challenged, would probably say "yes", but now there are other places and sites to see. What did I enjoy the most?• Seeing the Potala Place in Tibet both during the day and at night when all lit up• Catching the fist glimpses of Everest as we trekked towards it• Actually reaching my goal, the Everest Base Camp and having an enormous sense of achievement and overwhelming euphoria.• Likewise when taking off at the Tenzing-Hillary airport at Lukla and flying to Kathmandu, and again that sense of achievement. I've done it after all these years Some of the challenges that I had were;• Climbing Gokyo Ri at a height of 5360m then climbing down in the darkness and the freezing cold.• Trekking over the Cho La Pass at a height of 5330m With a chest infection and took 8 hours to complete.• The walk to Everest Base Camp at a height of 5364m was long and slow and satisfying, but it was the cold on the way back when I could not feel my fingers was worse. The food;I was very cautious on what I ate during the trip, and my general rule was that it had to be hot, and preferably vego. I had very little meat on the trip, especially once on the trek and no alcohol. Got used to eating Dal Bhat and lots of potatoes and eggs.The water;In Tibet and Kathmandu I purchased the local mineral water, but when trekking used the local water and added purification tablets. Suggested anybody else doing a similar trek consider purchasing a Permipen, a water sterilization device that sterilizes the water in 90 seconds and does not need any pills, just batteries, which are changes about every 50 litres.Washing;In Tibet there was generally always hot water available, but once on your trek, get used to washing in cold water as you have to purchase hot water for washing and showers, and sometimes they are not always hot as power is my way of solar panels. Accommodation;Whilst in Tibet, I ended up sharing a twin room with guy for Japan. It was difficult communicating with him as he spoke very limited English.Quite often we would have a room with ensuiteIn Kathmandu, I always had a twin/double room with an ensuite, and generally the condition was not bad.On the trek I always had my own twin room, so had plenty of room to lay out the clothes on the others bed. But these rooms were just a room, with twin beds, a thin mattress, a cover over the mattress and a blanket and pillow. I do not know how often the mattress covers, or blankets or pillows were washed, but it did not look like very often. I always used my sleeping bag liner and most nights my sleeping bag, then put the blanket, over it, plus the blanket from the other bed, so always nice and cozy.On the trek there was always a dining room in all of the lodges and they all had a pot belly fire that they stoked up as soon as the sun went down. Depending on the number of people in the lodge they either kept it going, or more often than not, by about 7.30 to 8.00pm that was it for the night and they let the fire go out, so it was always an early to bed.Toilets;I'm sure I could write a book about the different types of toilets we came across, some sit down, some crouch down, some just holes in the floor.
