But in essence you had to ALLWAYS, carry a roll of toilet paper with you and when finished place the paper in the nearby bucket/container, and get a tin/container of water and flush away what you had just done. Fellow travelers guides and porters;Generally there was always a "Namaste, hi, hello, good morning or Bonjour" on the trekking, although sometime nothing as the trekker was exhausted and reserving what breath they had.In the lodges everybody seemed to be quite friendly, and people seemed to get on well. Met different people from all parts of the world and they all had a story to tell of where they had come from, what they were doing and where they were going. Many, not just finishing the trek and going home but going to other countries to continue their travels. Health and Clothes;Unfortunately I got a chest infection and a fellow traveler gave me some antibiotics that helped. Think this was caused by a combination of the cold and the dust on the track. It has not rained for some time on the tracks and a combination of the Trekkers, porters and yaks, made the track very dusty. Had what I called was Himalaya/Everest cough.I ended up wearing a mask around the mouth for most of the trek, but even so, my throat got extremely sore thru breathing in the cold air all the time, and ended up drinking hot lemon or hot ginger with ginger or lots of sugar.Had no problem with the feet. Made sure that every day when we had finished trekking that I took the boots off and took out the insoles to dry, in the sun if possible, plus changing into a different pair of socks and slip on Crocs and wash the feet in cold water, not hot water! It is not good for them in hot water.I tried to rotate the clothes most days, as it is not always possible to put clean clothes on everydayLike always took some clothes that I did not wear and thought should have brought more of others. Cold hands was my biggest issue, even though I had three gloves, one I had purchased in Vietnam that were lined, and my hands got cold, I used a silk pair of gloves when the day had warmed up and added on top of this a pair of Gortex gloves that David and Tina loaned me, but even within both these, at times my fingers were freezing.For trekking I was always wearing a pair of thermal bottoms and tops so together with a pair of trousers, another top, plus quilted jacket, plus scarf, and one or two beanie hat was quite warm. The only thing is when I wore my Gortex jacket I purchased to keep both the water and wind out, I ended up beings wet on the inside from perspiration, but hey, I was warm. I remember taking the Gortex jacket off for lunch prior to reaching Namche Bazaar, and I was only wearing a thermal top underneath, and as soon as the top same off, there was steam rising from my thermal top.Suggest that anybody else doing this trek, if they haven't got all the clothes and kit, don't worry, buy them when you get to Kathmandu, there as you will have at least two days free prior to starting trekking. Just make sure you take and have worn in your own boots, and have a supply of undies, socks and thermals that you bring with you.Batteries;I was able to get my mobile phone and camera charged, but bear in mind that power on the trek is mostly Solar, especially the higher up you get. The higher you go the more expensive to charge I paid up to $5US per hour and then the battery was not fully charged. I took my iPad, and this was great for downloading the photos from the camera, plus was able to use the camera/video on the iPad, to film a 360 deg view of Everest Base camp, great. I also used the iPad for writing my daily notes, but I did have difficulty in getting it charged. I was only able to do this at Kathmandu at the hotel and at the Cho La Pass resort lodge at Dragnag, so other iPad users beware.Phone and Internet;In Tibet there was generally mobile reception but very little internet other than in the major cities, where the internet was censored by the Chinese In Kathmandu you can get mobile reception and the internet either at your hotel, or one of the many WIFI and internet shops and cafesOnce trekking, the mobile reception gets limited as does internet connection, which is more difficult the higher you get, although there is great mobile and internet connection at Gorak Shep, the last stop before the Everest Base Camp, so you can make the call and send the photos to say “have been there”, “have done that”, “here is the photos”.Thanks; To Prem the director of Ace the Himalaya for organising the trip, the guides, porters and guides who were so helpful and to my fellow travellers and trekers that I met on the trip to make it such a fabulous journey that I will not forget.

Everest Base Camp Trekking. Everest Base Camp Trekking is one of my best trips that i have done yet. To me who live in near by sea and do not have previous high altitude hiking, it was really adventurous but still i completed with full of enjoy. Thanks the management of Ace The HImalaya who supported greatly to succeed my trip.

Trekked to Tengboche with Ace the Himalaya - a magnificent experience. In October my wife and I trekked to Tengboche with Ace the Himalaya guide Robin Sapkota. He and our porter, Santos, took excellent care of us. Robin is highly professional and experienced, and beyond that he is simply a great guy to hang out with. He made sure that every aspect of our trek went smoothly and paid attention to the smallest details. I recommend him to anyone wanting to have a great time in the Himalayas. Ace the Himalaya's Kathmandu staff also attended to every aspect of our trek very well, from equipment needs to successfully handling all our requests. We had a great time in the Himalayas because of their efforts--our trip couldn't have gone better. Thank you Robin, Santos, Prem, and Prakash!

Best trip ever with Ace the Himalaya. Ace the Himalaya is one of the best companies out there when it comes to taking care of travelers. Right from airport pickup they have done a fantastic job of organizing the tour.Khatmandu tour was great, Prakash did an excellent job of showing us around explaining the history of Nepal. He did a great job again when he tok us to the Orphanage.Milan, our tour guide was simply superb. He was patient, thorough and sincere in taking care of us. Milan took care of us even when he was sick. That shows his sincerity.I would definitely recommend my friends Ace The Himalaya for their trips in Nepal.

Excellent. I organised a trip to Nepal that included chit was, Annapurna base camp and pokhara with ace. The organisationnwas smooth and easy. Prems replies were prompt and he catered to my wishes which when travelling solo is often difficult to find! Krish, my guide, and Resham, my porter were fantastic. Highly professional but also fun and relaxed to trek with. They went at my pace and found good lodges to stay at. I would not hesitate to use ace the Himalaya again. My only warning would be not to leave anything at Hotel kantipur in pokhara, which is the hotel they use in pokhara as things disappeared from my bag there. O raised this issue with Prem and I am sure it has been dealt with.

suman thapa for guide of the year!. My girlfriend martha and I just returned from our trip to mt. everest base camp.We booked our trip through ace the hlmalaya.We had the good fortune to have suman thapa as our guide.We made everest base camp; an expierence we will never forget.I would be remiss if I didn't comment on what a great job suman did for us.His service for us was way above just being a guide. When martha suffered hypotherma on the way up kala patarr he carried her on his back down to gorak shep. When I got dyesntery and had to spend 2 days in bed he hand feed me fresh fruit and attended to my every need 24 hours a day.We will be friends for life.It was a great trek but suman made it a superb expierence; truly the trip of a life time.Ace the himalaya is very affordable. I met others along the trek who paid up to double the price for the exact same trip.Ask for suman thapa for your guide and you can't go wrong.Also all meals and lodgeing are included along with your guide and our porter somboo who was a joy to be around.Jeff Schmitt

Awesome trip - memories to last a lifetime. The Everest Base Camp/Island Peak tour was everything we expected - and more! Great organisation, even when the weather was doing its best to keep us in Lukla. Prem was super-punctual and helpful with any queries leading up to the trip, making it an absolute breeze to get things ready.Milan, our guide, really felt a part of our group and not just there to show us the way. His wise words of wisdom helped us - everything from what to eat when at altitude to dealing expertly with potentially serious situations. Plus his patience, local knowledge and teaching us basic Nepali phrases - priceless! If we get the chance to go back, we'll seek him out not as a guide but as a dear old friend.The porters, too, were amazing. Amer (aka Som, aka 'Happy') and Hira were just quietly efficient in going about their business and unfailingly polite. It was humbling to see them perform their duties at the teahouses after lugging our heavy bags all day. Even with the disappointment of not being able to attempt Island Peak due to illness, the trip was certainly memorable and we had a blast. I've already recommended Ace to friends and will certainly go back to them for future trips.

You Beauty - I'll Be Back. “Bloody Hard, Bloody Fantastic, Bloody Rewarding!” From the moment we got off the plane in Kathmandu to the time we were dropped back at Kathmandu Airport, the level of service and friendliness by your employees was great. The trek itself.  Milan – Started off as our Trek Guide. Finished as a reliable and trustworthy friend. Whether it was teaching us card games at night and letting us win a few games to explaining and describing the mountains/history as we walked. A fantastic person and if I have the opportunity to visit Nepal for another trek in the future, I would request Milan to be our guide again. Futhermore, if anyone asks me who to use for trekking in Nepal, I would recommend Ace the Himilaya and strongly recommend that Milan be their guide. Thanks Milan  Amar – Started off as our Trek Porter. As with Milan, finished as a reliable and trustworthy friend. Was always smiling especially when winning cards. That smile made us smile even when we didn’t have enough energy to walk another step. One day, we misplaced our new camera. We were that tired, we didn’t even know we had left it somewhere. After a cup of tea, Amar walks in with the camera I had left behind. I was too tired to even remember that I had left it behind. When Amar walked in and said this was where it was, I remembered. Thanks Amar!  The Milan/Amar team was unique. We were very lucky to have two great people like Milan and Amar to be with us and become part of our team as friends. More than just a trek guide and porter, Milan and Amar made the whole trek enjoyable and a trek that will be remembered by the great countryside and these 2 great gentleman. For any employee reviews you may do in the future for Milan and Amar, please include this information and feedback from myself and my wife Helen. Thanks Milan and Amar.Thanks Ace the Himalaya

Everest Base Camp and Island Peak - Excellent. Highly recommended!. We did the EBC/Island Peak trip in October 2011. Our guide and porters (Milan, Amar and Hira) were excellent. Extremely professional, courteous and importantly, a great sense of humour. The trek to base camp was fantastic, the scenery absolutely stunning and the locals were super friendly. Milan, our guide, made sure everything ran smoothly and we always had great accommodation, food and water. Unfortunately my friend and I got sick and couldn't climb Island Peak but our team were quick in taking us to a lower elevation to recover. We were stuck for a few days with the bad weather in Lukla. Ace the Himalaya worked very hard to secure a helicopter for evacuation and we all made it back safe and sound.I would not hesitate to recommend Ace the Himalaya to my friends and family.

Gokyo and EBC with Ace : a wonderful experience. We did the Gokyo and Everest Base camp trek with the people of Ace the Himalaya and had a fantastic trip . The scenery is unforgettable and the people of Ace are professional , friendly and competent . A trip , although hard ,we will never forget .

The people and places made it feel like home in a far away spot.. This was the second time I used Ace and I'd use them again for sure. I went with one friend. I left with a few more. The Langtang trek was less physically demanding than walking in Everest region and much quieter. I felt at home, like I was walking in my backyard at times. The guys from Ace were super. Sangram was our driver and he was professional, reliable, polite, funny, and kind. I kept joking that I'd call him for a ride when I went back to Kathmandu and though it was a joke, I have no doubt he'd come through if I really needed a lift. Ganesh was our porter. He too, was very professional and efficient. He liked to be on the go and could always give us time checks and keep us on track- an important necessity when moving trekkers through terrain unfamiliar to them. He was also very sweet and consistently looking after us. After dinner each night, he would disappear for a few minutes, then return with a sliced apple or some orange wedges and though we didn't ask, we gratefully accepted the food. He took very good care of us in the guest houses and made sure we had what we needed. His charm and friendly spirit were also very refreshing and welcoming. He was both professionally attentive and responsible, but also extended his friendship and made us feel like we were important clients and friends at the same time.Rovin was our guide and he was great as well. He was my guide the last time I used Ace and I'll definitely ask for him next time too. He stayed right with me, even though I walked much slower than the others. He frequently checked in with me, made sure I felt good, and took pictures with me along the way. He was constantly aware of our surroundings, reading the land and weather, and always keeping safety and enjoyment as top priorities. He took care of the whole group, gave us lessons on language and culture in exchange for juggling and card game tutorials, and made the whole experience better. He pointed out landscape, livestock, and evidence of change on the way down that we didn't see going up. He went out of his way to make sure we were comfortable and happy. He was the same consummate, enthusiastic and skilled guide this time, as he was the last. Rovin became a good friend on this trip. His strong work ethic and attention to detail of his clients' overall enjoyment were both resoundingly clear. His friendship was extremely valued and I hope to walk with him again. Prem, as a repeat performance as well- was extremely efficient in answering all our questions about the trip before we got to Nepal and was attentive to our needs while we were there. It's clear he's worked hard to make Ace the great company it is. I'd choose Ace again and hope to have the opportunity to do so in the future. They are a good outfit.

Best ever trekking holiday - Annapurna Circuit & Panorama Trek. Our holiday to Nepal was one of the most enjoyable and memorable holiday experiences possible. Experiencing the Nepali culture and way of life by trekking through the local villages and mountains was by far the best way to see the true Nepal. We thoroughly enjoyed our time with our guide and the porters who helped make the experience. Our guide, Raj, was always keen to share his knowledge on all things Nepal, made sure we were well catered for to keep our energy levels up, and also took us to see some very interesting sites such as the Bat Cave in Pokhara, the Dasi Lama at Manang and the hot springs at Jinhu which are definitely worth a swim in. The efforts Raj made to ensure we got to see and do all that we wanted to was fantastic. We enjoyed having many laughs with Raj and the porters and the dinner table conversations whilst they took the time to teach us Nepali words each night. ACE the Himalaya are by far one of the most professional and well organised trekking / tour companies I have experienced.

Best guide ,Best trek. Suman Thapa was more than our guide. He became part of the family. I felt safe knowing that he would and could handle any situation - AND he did!!! When I found myself in a life threatening situation Suman carried me to safety. When I return to Nepal , Suman will be the guide I will request. A million thanks to you Suman!!

The beauty fo Nepali culture is an experience that I will take with me for my entire life. My fiance and I were very pleased with all of the information we received from our guide during our day tour of Kathmandu's cultural treasures.

What an amazing trip and experience!. My fiance and I did the Everest Panorama trek which we both thought was just amazing. It was our first time out of Australia and also our first trek. Ace The Himalaya and their team made the experience even that much better. Waiting very patiently as I very slowly made my was along the trail :)Great friends made and can't wait to get back there to tackle our next trek ! I would recommend Ace The Himalaya to all of my friends and family.

Worth the money just for the driver!. Did back-to-back tours: "Nepal Adventure Tour" and "Kathmandu to Lhasa" tour. Everything was well organised and coordinated. After hearing horror stories from other travellers in Nepal, I learned to appreciate the dedicated driver assigned to me by Ace. While the guides were friendly, knowledgeable, and made it a point to ensure I was looked after; the driver in Nepal was the best value-add (Note: a tourist bus crashed and fell off a mountain). He always had a smile on his face, was a safe driver, and tried his best to explain a little "off-the-beaten path" aspects of Nepal. James and Prakrash were excellent guides. You'll do well to tour with either gents in Pokorha or Kathmandu. But be extra kind to the drivers. By the way, bungee jumping and white water rafting in Nepal should be on everyone's bucket list! Lhasa is not impressive; would recommend spending more time in Pokhra - especially after Chitwan National Park. Either way, you cannot go wrong using Ace the Himalaya.

"We would not have been able to do this without our Ace Chief Guide (Bharat) and the rest of the ACE support staff". I just wanted to write a few words about our Annapurna Trek experience using Ace the Himalya as our trekking service. We were a party of 4 and I being the oldest at 61. The rest of our party ranged from early 20's and my wife was 49. Our party consisted of very experienced people and not so experienced people. That being said we overcame a number of adversities to complete the Trek and reaching our goal of getting over Thorung La Pass at 5,416 meters or 17,769'. But, we would not have been able to do this without Bharat our Chief Guide and the rest of the ACE support staff. Bharat and the support team were absolutely amazing and met our every need. They exceeded our expectations. This was the greatest experience and challenge we have ever had. And again this is because of our guide and Aces's "top notch" support staff. Lastly, our plane was delayed arriving in Kathmandu for over 6 hours well into the night and Ace's staff did not know when we might arrive--they waited the whole time at the airport for us for us and when we arrived we were cheerfully greeted and taken to our hotel--good luck finding another tour company that would do that.

Narayan from Ace The Himalaya is well....ace :). "I was very luck to have Narayan as my guide and he made the trip for me" - Heidi Gaffney-EvansThursday, 27 October, 2011I've just returned from a Base Camp Everest trip and would like to very publicly commend and thank my wonderful guide Narayan. He is very knowledgable, has excellent English, is interesting, entertaining and is an expert people reader. He managed to read me and tell me I was ill before I realised it myself. He knew what to do in any situation and I would not have made it to Base Camp and back again safely without him. Having encountered other guides from other companies on the trail, I know I was very luck to have Narayan as my guide and he made the trip for me. Thank you Narayan, may you be busy trekking for as long as you wish, you are a donkey and I am a monkey!Kindest Regards,Heidi Gaffney-EvansMornington AustrlaliaEmail: tigerback71@hotmail.comTrip: Everest Base Camp- Nepal

Great trekking experience, excellent guide. I just returned from three weeks in Nepal, trekking in the Everest region with Ace the Himalaya.This was my second visit (after treks to Annapurna and Everest base camp back in 1993) and this time I was looking for a more comfortable trek, staying in some of the luxurious lodges that were built since my last visit.I contacted several agencies with top Tripadvisor ratings in Kathmandu and asked them to propose custom solo itineraries and accommodations for a trek to Gokyo Lakes and Everest base camp via the Cho La pass. While the total cost quoted by Ace was not the lowest (but at the lower end) I selected them because I felt in my email exchanges with Prem K Khatry, the managing director, that he understood best what type of experience I was looking for. We ended up selecting Everest Summit Lodges in Lukla, Monjo, Mende, and Pangboche, the Yeti Mountain Home in Namche (my favorite of the bunch), and the Everest View Hotel in Syangboche, in addition to "best available" accomodations at the higher elevations.All those lodges (as well as the amazing Dwarika's Hotel in Kathmandu) turned out to be great, well worth the extra cost to me. We settled on a relaxed schedule of 20 trekking days for the trip to optimize altitude acclimatization.Prem selected Rovin Sapkota as my guide for the trek and Rovin turned out to be just the prefect guide for me (and a really fun team with Santosh, my porter). Everything was taken care of, I never had to worry about a thing.I enjoy my trekking at a moderate pace ("bistari bistari") with a lot of stops to take photos, enjoy the view, read a book, relax - and Rovin was very patient and always in a great mood. He is also a very caring guide, which was particularly important because I caught a bad chest infection after a few days which ultimately prevented me from ascending above 4800m.Rovin took me to the rescue post in Machermo where I received treatment and antibiotics. This allowed me to reach the amazing Gokyo Lakes, and Rovin provided the advice I needed when the tough time came to decide to either tackle the high pass or descent. In coordination with the Ace office he was very flexible in rebooking my reservations on the way back to Lukla, making the trek a success in spite of having to cut the trip short by five days due to the bronchitis.After my return to Kathmandu Ace's Prakash Aryal provided an excellent day of temple visits and sightseeing in Kathmandu and Bhaktapur.All in all I fully recommend Ace the Himalaya for your Nepal trekking.

Kathmandu, Nagarkot, Pokhara, Poon Hill, Chitwan. We were very happy with the choice of our travel agent ACE the Himalaya. The team was always on time and very friendly. Our guide showed as us much from Nepal and his culture as it was possible in two weeks.We had an unforgettable trip in Nepal. The sunrise in Nagarkot and Poon Hill were impressive.

Namaste! Our first visit in Nepal. First of all, we want to say thank you to our guide Prakash, to the driver and to „ Mr. Life“ our porter, all of them did a great job.It was the first time for us in Nepal and we looked for some adventure, fun and sightseeing. We were very happy with the choice of our travel agent ACE the Himalaya. Thank you Melanie for planning and organising our trip.The team was always punctual and very friendly. Our guide showed as us much from Nepal and his culture as it was possible in two weeks. Our highlights were the 4-day trek up to Poon Hill (3200m) and the sunrise and sunset in Nagarkot.Our tip: Trekkers have to be prepared for a lot of nature-stairs...;-)

Great first Trip to Nepal. My brother and I had been interested in the Everest Base camp hike for a couple of years, and after careful research chose "Ace the Himalaya" as our guide company. Everything went off just as advertised-- airport pickup, hotel, domestic (Nepal) flights, accomodations, etc. Our guide was very interested and knowledgable, and easily got us to where we needed to be each night. And our porter was hard-working to say the least-- I think our gear weighed as much as he did! The city tour after the trek (Kathmandu) was also a good value.  The only thing I'll add (nothing to do with Ace the Himalaya)-- it's a tough trail. We had climbed Mt. Kilimanjaro previously, and in our opinion, the trail to Everest Base camp was a LOT harder. Also, "Globe Trekker" has an excellent DVD on Nepal that covers the hike quite well. We're from the USA and our trip was in May, 2011.

The most incredible and inspiring experience. I can't speak highly enough of Ace the Himalaya, Prem, and all the Ace guides. I went with a group of university students from Australia to volunteer at a school in Arupokhari. We were welcomed at the airport on arrival, and everything went so smoothly from there. In fact, it continued to get better. The guides were so enthusiastic and knowledgable - they kept our spirits up through long treks and were eager to answer our multitude of questions.I've come back with the best memories of my time in Nepal, all thanks to the team at Ace the Himalaya. If you're thinking about spending time here, I would definitely recommend travelling with them.

Unforgettable Summer Trekking. I'd wanted to visit Nepal's hillside since I was very young, but only after relocating to the middle east, was I in a position to go. Since I would be going alone, I decided to use a trekking company to organize the trip. I wanted to use a local company and environmental awareness was important to me, so I began with those things in mind and wound up finding Ace the Himalaya. From my very first inquiry about the trip, Prem was extremely professional and attentive to answering my questions. I sent him several messages before arriving in Kathmandu and he responded to each one thoroughly and quickly. A driver from Ace and one of the guides, Rovin met me at the airport at my arrival and brought me to my hotel. Rovin was friendly on the drive; we talked about the trip (I had questions about trekking during monsoon) and right away I knew we would get along and he would take good care of me while on the trail. I spent the next day with a different guide, Kedar traveling around Kathmandu Valley. Kedar was very nice and taught me a few words in Nepalese. For every place we visited, Kedar had lots to tell me about our surroundings. His stories were informative and entertaining and he went out of his way to teach me about Nepalese culture, while also making sure I was comfortable. We didn't have the best driver (there's some question about his name, but I understood it as Raz). Unfortunately, he left us waiting around for about 45 minutes. Kedar was very apologetic about the wait and said he would report it to keep it from happening again. We had no problems after that and got around just fine.The next morning, Rovin picked me up at the hotel and we caught our flight to Lukla, where we met our porter, Santos. Both Rovin and Santos were great hiking companions and since they each spoke a lot more English than I did Nepalese, we were able to easily communicate. They frequently checked in with me to make sure I felt good and had what I needed and I felt extremely safe and at ease while trekking with them. By day three, we were playing cards and board games and they felt more like friends than anything else. It was a lot of fun and I'm thankful I was with them especially because I was traveling alone and would have been bored on acclimatization days and evenings without their company. They both taught me a lot about the landscape and people of Nepal. Rovin especially, taught me a good amount of language. I was in very good hands and felt extremely well looked after. The trekking was incredible and I had a really good experience, mainly because of these two guys. They took care of everything; all I had to do was walk. Because it was monsoon season, we had clouds and rain and ended up stuck in Lukla for 4 days after the trek. I wasn't worried, since I had a few extra days before I had to go back to work. Plus, Rovin and I passed time playing cards and talking. I spent my last three days in Kathmandu, mostly in the company of Rovin. I did some things I wasn't expecting and went to a few beautiful places. Rovin became a friend and I hope we stay in touch. My trip wouldn't have been the same without him- he was an essential part of the experience for me, being both an excellent guide in the mountains and a great teacher elsewhere.Overall, Ace was a great company and I would definitely use them again. They have quality people working for them and can take care of customers' needs efficiently and economically.

memorable and inspiring trip ~ everest base camp trek. did the annapurna base camp trek two years ago with ace. Because of the great experience then, ace was obviously the choice when we wanted to do the everest base camp trek this spring. Again, ace did not disappoint and we were well taken care of during the trek.special thanks to out guide raj, who made sure we ate and drank well during the trip, and who went up the steep slope of kalapattar twice when one of our members decided to summit again during descending.

I couldn't have asked for anything better. Never would I have thought that coming to Nepal and volunteering would have been such a great experience, something that has definitely left me with a lasting impression and wanting to go back. This has been mainly due to the work and great service that Ace the Himalayas gave to me and my friends. Whether it was the tea in the morning to the hiking and treking to the volunteering efforts we conducted, Ace was always there to help and I never felt a moment where I was unsafe or unguided. The friendliness of the guides and all those involved was something that definitely impacted me. The constant song and dance, as well as the true concern they had for our well-being meant a great deal to me as it ensured we were properly cared for. The catering was excellent, with a hiking chef accompanying us, the food I recieved in such a remote area was truely outside my expectations. Overall I could not have asked for more from Ace, they were brilliant in their services and the friendliness and approachability of all members of the team was fantastic. It is hence that with no hesitation I give them a 5 star rating.

A rewarding, fun filled experience. Traveling in Nepal has definitely been one of the most enlightening, eye-opening experiences thanks greatly to ACE the Himalaya and the excellent service they provide. During our volunteer work in Nepal, Ace the Himalaya made sure that we were taken very good care of. We were never without the bare necessities. The cooking staff, porters and guides were exceptional in making us feel comfortable and providing us more than just the bare necessities. They went out of their way to provide us the best! I can't speak highly enough of the guides that showed us around. They made the experience very memorable through their vibrant personalities and good English. Furthermore, the guides always gave us a helping hand when we needed help as well as ensuring that we were safe at all times. You could always count on them to look out for you. I highly recommend Ace the Himalaya and the service they provide. They always go the extra mile for you.

Great passionate guides. I went to visit the villages Ace the Himalaya is supporting through Sambhav Nepal ( http://www.sambhavnepal.org/). The guides were helpful and very passionate about their community. I had a great local village experience to see what their life looks like. I am very impressed how much support they have done and they are going to do to the villages and everybody in the community is working together. If you want to see and experience a real Nepal, Ace the Himalaya will make this happen for sure, not only they are good at trekking but also unforgettable cultural experience trip.

Awesome time!. My group was volunteering at Arupokhara, guided by Ace. Ace was great in prodiving experienced and helpful guides for my volunteer group. They were were attentive to my groups needs, especially when some of us got sick. The food was excellent and the camping was great!The trip was successful thanks to Ace the Himalayas!

Fantastic Experience. I had an amazing time in Nepal, and the ACE team really helped make the experience what it was. All the staff were helpful, friendly and really good fun, and our guides Rajendra and Gyanu were fantastic in every way! Thanks for a great trip.

Safest and Most Amazing Experience ever. Ace the Himalaya guided myself and five friends to and from a volunteering project in Arupokhara. The staff from Ace were exceptional and although their English fluency was not perfect, it was sufficient for effective communication and many fun and interesting conversations. The guides from Ace were exceptional in their knowledge of the terrain and tracks that led us to and from Gorkha, there was never a moment when we felt lost or unsafe. As well as this, they were well-prepared for any sickness or exhaustion from the participants during the trek and did well to look after all our needs and ensure our safety.The trip, as a whole, was professionally conducted and the staff from Ace only added to the experience of a lifetime in Nepal. I have no hesitation in recommending this company to any fellow travellers!

Very Pleasant. The trek itself to EBC and Kala Patthar was of course beautiful. The guide and porter were exceptionally kind, responsible, and generous. I literally didn't have to do anything for myself except for the whole walking bit. They were attentive and went out of their way to make sure that I was comfortable and well-looked after. I would definitely recommend this tour company to everyone!

The folks at Ace the Himalaya could not have been more helpful. Trekked the Everest Base Camp trail and explored a bit of Khatmandu with Ace the Himalaya. My many pre-trip e-mail questions were promptly, courteously and thoroughly answered. Our guides and drivers were so helpful and accommodating.The trek itself is fairly arduous and requires coordinating many details. Our guides, Borat and Raj could not have been more helpful or more capable. They handled every challenge calmly and graciously. I would absolutely use this agency again.

Amazing trip of a lifetime!. I recently travelled to Nepal and did Mt Everest Basecamp with Ace the Himalayas.  Ace was highly recommended by a friend of mine who had also used them to do the same trek.  My friends and I had such an amazing time trekking the Himalayas and seeing the wonders of Nepal.  Our experience was no doubt enriched by the exceptional services provided by the Ace team.  We were well taken care of at every point of our journey.  I was very apprehensive about reaching basecamp due to my fitness level but the team was extremely patient and encouraging.  I am especially grateful to our guides Raj and Bharat as they helped me to accomplish something that I never dreamed of being able to do.  The strength and spirite of the porters was such an inspiriation.  Ace also helped us organise our trip to Chitwan on very sort notice.  There, we were able to go on jungle safaris, bath with the elephants and chill out after our successful climb to Basecamp.The friendliness and hospitality of the Nepalese were exceptional.  The scenery of the mountains were simply breathtaking!! My friends and I met some amazing people along our journey.  We can not thank Ace enough for helping us create some fond memories for which we will cherish forever.  This was truely a trip of a lifetime!

Our trek to Everest Base Camp surpassed all expectations. My fiance (after a proposal at Everest Base Camp :) ) and I have just returned from an amazing trip to see Everest with Ace the Himalaya. From the first moment we touched down in Kathmandu we were made to feel so welcome. We met Chris, our trekking guide, on our first evening and we given a full briefing on what was to come. From our first meeting Chris was professional, informative and very friendly. We looked set for a great trek! And we were no disappointed. The 12 days were just great fun. Chris was fantastic throughout. He looked after every member of our group with such care, always checking that we were feeling OK. Being at the back of the group for 99.9% of the time he also had to follow me for 12 days and despite the odd clash in music tastes (Chris liking the vengaboys, me not so much) he was a great trekking companion with a brilliant mix of banter, jokes and himalayan knowledge! He even managed to take a quick snap of the base camp proposal without us realising which is something that we will treasure for ever!Overall the trip was 10 out of 10. We could not have asked foranything more from Chris, Yim & our three porters. If anyone is looking to make the trek to Everest Base Camp in the future I can 100% recommend making the journey Ace the Himalaya and Chris. You would be mad not too!

Everest Base camp. Fantastic trip!. The guides take really good care of you when you are sick. I was sick for 7 out of the 11 days , so was the slowest on the trip but Raj also known as Dr Raj, took really good care of me (had allot of patience) making sure I had medicine and ate food (even when I didnt want to as didnt feel well) to ensure i had enough energy to make it up the mountain. Definetly recommend this trip.

Everest Base Camp Trek. I picked this group mostly because of all the positive feedback from different web sites and I can say I was more than impressed. Ace helped me through a difficult visa problem in India and restructured my trip to account for a lost day as a result. They carried out a well planned comfortable itinerary with good lodgings and food for this style of trek. My guide Raj was very impressive, and paid great attention to my condition throughout the entire trip, coaching me when I needed that extra energy and resting when I didn't have it. He was well versed in recognizing signs of altitude sickeness, what foods to avoid, local customs, and attentive to my hydration status, yet was laid back enough for me to experience the Himalayas in my own style if I needed. I would strongly recommend this group to other trekkers. People I had encountered on the trip paid much more money and received treatment that appeared inferior to mine. Ask for Raj if you can as his style of guiding is probably the best you can ask for. Thanks guys for a great trip. Hope to see you again in the future. Definately one of the best experiences of my life.

Everest Base Camp Trek with Ace - HIGHLY recommended. I just completed the Everest Base Camp Trek (16 day tour) with Ace the Himalayas and have nothing but praise for the company and it's guides. From the very beginning, the Director of Ace (Prem K. Khatry) was wonderful to work with. Every time we emailed him a question or concern, he responded immediately. In fact, I don't think I've ever gotten such personalized service from a tour company before.I was with a group of six (from the US, Australia, New Zealand and Malaysia) and we all arrived at different times. Ace picked all of us up at the airport and we were taken to the Hotel Tibet in Kathmandu, which is very nice and comfortable and a 15 minute walk to the tourist center of Thamel.On Day 2 of the tour, we had a city tour of Kathmandu with stops at the Bodhnath Stupa, Pashupatinath and Bhaktapur, which were all on my list of 'things to see' while in Nepal. Luckily, I could cross them all off my list without having to arrange my own transportation and guides. How convenient! Our guide that day, Prakash, was fantastic. He is clearly a wealth of information on Nepal!There were 14 people on our EBC Trek, we had 4 Ace guides and 7 porters. I cannot say enough about the level of service they provided. We were all at different fitness levels and there was always a guide at the front and back of the group to assist as needed. Several people had issues with altitude sickness, stomach upset, etc. and the guides were right on top of it. In fact, one morning I took an asprin because my knees were a bit sore, and one of our guides, Bharat, immediately asked if I was feeling ok and if I needed anything. It was nice to know that someone was looking out for us and making sure no one came down with any serious altitude issues. Our other guide, Raj (commonly known in our group as 'Dr. Raj') kept a close watch on my friends who were sick in bed (one with tonsilitis and the other with altitude issues). He checked in on them regularly and it is such a relief to know that you'll be taken care of even though you're far from home in a country you're not familiar with. You can't put a price tag on that kind of service.In addition, the guides were fun and very easy to get along with. At night, we stayed in basic teahouses and since it was cold outside and not a lot of things to do in these small villages, the guides played cards with us at night, taught us how to play Bagh Chal (a popular board game in Nepal) and chatted with us about our day.We were all thrilled to reach Everest Base Camp and after a celebration with tea and cookies, I was still wanting to go in further to walk around the tents. I have to give a big 'thank you' to Bharat for offering to take six of us on an additional 1 hour trek into base camp (on top of the 9 hours of trekking we'd already be doing that day). It was an experience I will remember forever. Bharat's work day was lengthened an additional hour, but it provided us with a once in a lifetime experience. Incredible.To me, one of the best things about about booking a trek with Ace is that you're supporting a local Nepali company. I was highly impressed with the level of service they offered and the amount of personal attention we received thoughout our experience. I don't think a company based in an outside country would be able to provide the same level of service. If I have the opportunity to return to Nepal (and I hope I do!) there's no doubt that I'll be booking another tour with Ace.
Awesome experience!. Ace the Himalaya is a great company. We loved our trek to Mt Everest Base Camp! Gyanu was the best guide on the trail!

This trip is fantastic. Our group of 6 went to Everest Base camp and had a great time. Ace is a great company but their guide Gyanu was just the best I have seen. He was caring,attentive,entertaining, and compassionate. Anyone going with Ace should absolutely ask for him to be their guide--you will not regret it. He was a consummate professional in every way .

A tough, but rewarding holiday, made better by the staff of Ace the Himalaya.. 2 friends and I recently returned from the Everest Base Camp Trek with Ace. It was an amazing experience, made better by the friendly, energetic, and knowledgable guides and assistants from Ace. They were always available to provide assistance to anybody who needed it, were so organised that you barely had to worry about anything but the altitude and the walking.The accomodation was always the best in the town we were staying, and was reliably comfortable, especially by Himalayan standards.

Annapurna Base Camp trek-Thank you for making my dream come true. Trekking the Himalaya was my dream for years, I finally did it while leaving 3 kids at home and having a break from everything."Ace The Himalaya" helped me to enjoy NEPAL - the wonderful country with the best views by providing the best guide & porter for the Annapurna Base Camp trek & the Nagarkot area trip. Krish (Kishor Neupane) my guide was the best companionship, he took care of all my needs , anchorage me when it was hard and answered my endless list of questions about nature, culture, customs and believes. He is the kindest and funniest man I meat in my journey. Khilanath (Kancha) my porter is a young man, shay and humble with the sweetest smile and the three of us had a lot of fun and laughter.Thank you for making my dream come true.Dorit Sasson, Israel.

A fanatastic trip that showed everything that Nepal has to offer!. We spent almost 5 weeks trekking and touring around Nepal - all organized by Prem of Ace the Nimalaya. Every detail was looked after and handled with care. We spent about three weeks trekking around the Annapurna and the Everest region. We had the pleasure of having Raj (Rajendra K.C.) guide us on both treks as well as going out of his way to help us extend our visa in Kathmandu. Raj was very considerate and always advised us how to stay healthly and safe. He also packed fruit for us to enjoy every night of our trekking trip - definelty the highlight of our evening! Resham was our porter for the Annapurna area and Shiva was our porter for the Everest region and both were very strong young men with great personalities and welcoming smiles. Between Raj, Resham and Shiva - we were introduced to a couple of new card games and a board game - they were great! We were treated to a couple of city tours in Kathmandu and Pokhara - both extremely interesting! To finish off our holiday - we travelled down to Chitwan National Park and spent a couple of days exploring the jungle and viewing rhinos, monkeys, deer, tigers, wild boars, and many birds - all while on the backs of elephants! Incredible! Thanks so much!

life changing experience. I had an amazing experience in Nepal, such an adventure!! I was very sad to be leaving. I found the service was excellent, it was great not to have to worry about getting from place to place, from the moment we arrived in Nepal we were very well looked after, you could say even spoiled!! Our guides and porters were excellent, and had so much knowledge on the culture and history of Nepal which they were more than eggar to share with us. We had great fun also with our guides, singing, dancing and laughing all the way to Poonhill and back!! It was fantastic to learn and see so much of Nepal, I feel we were very lucky to have experienced so much of this beautiful country in such a short space of time. This trip has had a huge impact on my life, and i would very much like to return soon to this wonderful country and get the opportunity to spend some more time with the beautiful Nepalese people.Thank you for a wonderful service and i wish you all the best with your business, and i hope our paths will cross one day in the near future.

Wonderful experience. This tour was the first part of a trek up the Langtang Valley to Kyanjin Gompa.The tour was given by a well informed guide who spoke excellent English and made us feel at ease as we visited various,mostly cultural sites. He was happy to reply to any questions. We were driven by private car and were well looked after. It was a very interesting 5-6 hour tour.The trek was very well organised and any emails prior to booking and before we left Perth were always answered within 24 hours, always a good sign.We chose to go as our own group,so we had a guide and a porter and we would recommend this choice. It meant that we travelled at a pace to suit us,and also the lower number allows much more interaction with the guide and porter. They looked after us extremely well and we were able to enjoy the whole trip.We would recommend that paying a bit extra and using private transport is a much better option than local buses,as our transfers were relativly relaxed compared to the comments of others we met who used local transport..All in all we were very pleased with our choice of this company and would have no hesitation in using them again. Pick ups, transfers, meetings etc were all on time and the people were friendly and helpful.

A Memorable Experience with Ace the Himalaya. I used Ace the Himalaya for my Everest Base Camp Trek in March 2011. From the time they picked me up at the Airport to when they dropped me off 16 days later everything on the trip was professionally dealt with and delivered as stated on their website. The accomodation in Kathamandu was a 4 star hotel and the guest houses on the trek (from speaking to other guided trekkers) always seemed to be in the upper tier with respect to cleanliness and comfort. I even had my own shower in my room in some of the guesthouses. Robyn, my guide on the trek, was great and a pleasure to be with. He was very attentive, knowledgeable and always concerned with my well being. The porter, Santos, always stayed with us which was very convienent in case there was an unexpected change in the weather and I needed some other article of clothing. This was unlike many other porters who I observed that were several kilometers ahead of the guide and client. The tour of Kathmandu and surrounding area with Prakash on Day 2 was very imformative and an excellent introduction for a first time visitor (i.e. myself) to Nepalese culture. I had a minor issue with my visitor's visa for Nepal and Ace was more than helpful. Without hesitation Prakash took me on his motorbike to the Visitor Immigration Center in Kathamandu and straightened out the issue for me and insisted on no renumeration for his efforts. I hope to return to Nepal some time in the near future and Ace Himalaya would definitely be my first choice.

Perfect trip with a great guide!. We did the Everest Panorama Trek as we had little time but wanted a maximum experience and Ace the Himalaya delivered. Our guide, Suman Thapa, is friendly and fun loving while taking care of every detail with professionalism and experience. He knew the area well and provided a wonderful experience. The trek is remarkable in beauty and in the people of the Khumu. Ace the Himalaya operates by taking care of the little details and doing those things that make it a great time- from organizing the flights, to lodging and meals and keeping an appropriate pace for their clients- it was top quality. As the trek went on I noticed the other trekkers and their guides and I understood that Suman was in a league of his own, other trekkers were envious of the experience he was providing us. I was also impressed with the cultural and environmental sensitivity that Suman displayed and the manner in which he educated us in these areas for the Khumu.This trek is spectacular- ideal if you have little time but want to experience the big mountains and have time in this part of Nepal. I strongly encourage trekkers to hire Ace the Himalaya for a good trek. This is particularly if you are a woman alone or a small group of women- Suman and Ace the Himalaya provided a respectful and safe experience that I recommend highly.

So unbelievably great, can't wait to go again!. This was such an amaizing trip on so many levels. First, I must say we had the best guide ever. He (Suman Thapa) spoke english so well. He was incredibly knowledgable about the area we were in (Lukla to Tengboche), the local history and culture, the wildlife, every peak and elevation, the list goes on. He also told us about other treks in Nepal as I expressed great interest. He was patient and kind. could go faster or slower depending on the hikers that day. was knowledgeable in the dangers of elevation & hypothermia, as well as sincere concern when one of us was sick. Was very flexible with the trip when sickness altered the plan without any hesitation or any indication of complications with same. He was a really great guide, oh and.... so incredibly invaluable in getting us to and from Lukla as airport announcements were completely unintelligeable in english and knowledge of the maneuverings in these airports was crucial! Having done this once, I would never go without a guide and preferrably this guide (Suman Thapa). Nepal was amaizing and yet we only tasted a drop in the bucket. Such amaizing views and such wounderful people! I can't wait to go back and hike several other trails. Nepal has SOOOO MANY giant mountains it's crazy! With all the glaciers, that means endless waterfalls, rivers and creeks! soooo much to see and do, and amaizing people everywhere you go! such industrious people!

Amazing Trip. My girlfriend and I did both the Annapurna Circuit and Annapurna Sanctuary with Ace the Himalya. We planned our trip from the United States and corresponded regulary with Prem Khatry (owner) in Nepal via phone and email. He was very helpful and worked with us to create a custom itinerary. The guides spoke great English! We enjoyed our trip and would book with them again!

"The Trip of a Lifetime". Walking in the Himalayas, through the beautiful valleys, crossing the bridges over the rivers, climbing the peaks, and simply immersing myself in the Sherpa culture, seeing their villages, their homes, and how they live, was truly the experience of a lifetime. Everything I saw and experienced resonated at a deep level in me. I will be thinking about this trip for a long time to come. And my guide, Rabin, although he could walk circles around me in the thin air, was always patient and waited for me to catch up. And he always took good care of me.In Kathmandu, I was treated to a wonderful tour of the city and the temples by Prakesh, another excellent guide who shared with me his extensive knowledge of the area and it's many points of interest.All in all, I can highly recommend Ace the Himalaya.Charlie WatkinsFountain HillsArizonaUSA

My first visit to nepal. We visited Kathmandu , remote villages, Ghorka and Pokhara all organised by Ace. Our guide Kisnor ( who answered to Chris) met us at the airport with a very new spotlessly clean vehicle and this set the scene. Chris and the other guides we met all spoke perfect English. They took us sightseeing in Kathmandu and helped us with local shopping.We camped in remote villages and met some of the beautiful gentle Nepali people and children who liked to practice their English . We also stayed in three different hotels and everything was well organised. The hotels were all located off the main street, quiet for sleeping and each one even had a garden. I doubt we could have found these on our own. The hotels were very clean, probably rated three star.The company specialises in treks but in the off season they can organise for small groups. we suggested the places we wanted to visit and they did everything else.Pokhara has two very good museums, one on the Himalaya including the tribes and expiditions and the other museum is on the Gurkha soldiers.Nepal is not a wealthy country and services such as garbage collection do not operate as in a country such as Australia. If you go there please consider what you carry in ( such as plastic containers) and try to carry the emplies out.My husband who travelled with me had been to Nepal in 1971, we don't plan to wait another 40 years to visit this spectacular country again.

Great adventure, awesome service. Expedition Hiunchuli.What a great adventure. Prem from Ace the Himalaya prepared the entire expedition and our meeting upon arrival in Kathmandu was as if we would know each other for many years.After moving to the Annapurna area, we met our staff and started hiking all the way to Annapurna base camp. The service during the hike was excellent. Food was delicious and the accommodations were of good standard. At the base camp we camped and started climbing towards the peak of Hiunchuli. Even if we couldn't reach the peak due to the weather conditions and to many avalanches, we had a fantastic time with great experiences, lot's of fun and insights into the Nepali culture.I highly recommend Ace the Himalaya as organisation for treks, climbs or other adventures. There are so many in Kathmandu and I'm glad I was looking for something special and found it!

Great company providing efficient and friendly service. We visited Nepal with a Rotary team to present a week long teacher training program in a remote part of Gorkha. All our travel and accommodation arrangements were organised by Ace the Himalaya and they also organised a few sightseeing excursions for us in Kathmandu afterwards. They were very efficient and looked after us extremely well. All the staff were very friendly and knowledgable. We could not have asked for better service.

Everest Base Camp. I did the EBC tour with Ace in Jan 2011. Raj was my guide and because it was the middle of winter we didn't have any other participants but still had a ball. From the moment I contacted ACE they were great at organising the trip and answering any questions. Thre day trip in Kathmandu was very informative with Prakash. The tea houses were great even though we were often the only people there as most trekkers are smart enough to avoid winter but it was unbearable (minus 20 celsius). I wouldnt hesitate is recommending Ace

Beauty, nature, action & adventure - ACE made it real.... It's now almost a year ago - but never I could forget any of these countless outstanding moments during my trip in the Annapurna-Valley!Starting in Besisahar, like all the people who are doing the Annapurna-circuit, and walking through this ineffable beauty of nature, with all its shining colors... Meeting so many people from around the world and having interesting talks and funny evenings! Being teached by Suman and Pemba, my great guides, gave me a wonderful insight into the culture, land and people, how they live and so much more!In Pisang Village, Pemba, me and our team left the others - heading towards Pisang Peak! The days on the mountain were full of unforgetable moments! Just everything was fantastic... The steep hike up the slopes; the evenings and nights in the great VE25 tent; the food - that is soooo delicious, as no guesthouse could ever keep up with and I almost always ate ways too much - I just couln't stop with all these healthy & tasty veggies and the huge varieties of meals our cook prepared!And then, of course, the summit-day! Starting in the middle of the night, with headlamp and warm clothes, we headed up towards the top - and many hours later, the sun just has risen, we arrived at a surprisingly wind-calm summit!What a moment.... no words could ever describe!!!Pemba always let me feel very safe. He is a highly skillful climbing guide, handling every situation on the mountain!The tour never stopped with revealing new stunning views, moments of happiness and laughter.... adventures... and so much more!I thank Pemba, Suman, Prem and all the ACE-members for this unforgettable, unique experience...Your way of spoiling your clients is really outstanding!See you all very soon...Namaste!

Awesome. From our first phone call to Kathy - the Australian Rep, the entire team were so helpful and orgainised. The trip itself was absolutely incredible and even though it didn't quite go to plan, Prem and our guide, Bharat, were always there including reorganising our entire trek. Bharat and the porters were always helpful as well as knowledgeable making our trip fantastic. I would defiantly recommend Ace the Himalaya if thinking of trekking through the wonderful country of Nepal.

Everest Base Camp adventure!. Regardless of the circumstances or situation, my guide from Ace was always professional and went to great efforts to ensure I was well taken care of. My guide and porter could not have been more patient, encouraging and supportive. I can't describe only one memorable part of my trek, as the entire trek itself was a wonderful experience! The views were spectacular and the chance to meet and chat with other trekkers in the evenings at the guest houses was always provided great conversation and learning experiences! Even though I did not reach Base Camp (due to my own physical limitations) I still had a fantastic experience that changed my life! Thank you Ace for making it a safe and wondertful experience!

A dream come true. my daughter and I had the most fantastic time trekking to base camp with Ace. From day 1 our enquiries and booking was straightforward and prem in the office answered our emails by return. On arriving in Kathmandu we were whisked through the mayhem of traffic to our hotel and given good advice on where to eat if we wanted to go outwith the hotel.The following day we were taken round kathmandu to all the sights and the guide was excellent and very enthusiastic.We were met by our trekking guide Raj and taken to the airport for our flight to lukla which was amazing. From then on Raj looked after us, he knew everything about the area, knew the names and heights of every mountain we could spot! Yem our porter did a great job carrying our gear and was an all round really nice guy. We could not have asked for better service on the mountain and by the end of the trip we treated each other as friends. Our favourite part was climbing Gokyo Ri starting in the early hours, the view from the top was breathtaking. The few tips i would give are climb kalapathar in the afternoon when the sun is on everest and be meticulous in your hygeine especially your drinking water, we found the trip quite easy because we stayed healthy, people who didn't fell by the wayside. The reason we chose Ace was becuse they were a nepalese based company with good enviromental policys and we feel we made a great choice.Thanks Ace and your team.

Trekking in the Himalayas. A great trekking company. The price was very reasonable and easy to pay. The website tells one exactly what is on offer and whatever was offered was fulfilled. The trek to Everest Base Camp was well organised from day 1. The accomodation was as good as is available in the Himalayas which is not saying a lot; all food and accomodation was included in the price. I had an excellent guide who was fully commited to the trip and often offered side trips which others might not have bothered with. I made Base Camp and we climbed Kala Pattar at 5500m and had brilliant views of Everest and the sorrounding mountains as the sun rose. A view never to be forgotten and all in all a once in a lifetime trip.

Experience of a lifetime. Hi Prem, Namaste !!Everest Base Camp Trek was amazing, I can't praise ACE highly enough for making it so special. The service provided by Prem, Porters and Guides was fantastic and allowed me to make the most of my Himalaya experience, it will stay with me forever. I would like to think I have made a friend in Raj who was our Head Guide and I hope to return some day and complete a different trek.Itinerary, Travel & Accommodation were all of a much higher standard than I had anticipated and great credit must go to Prem and his team, ACE were the first company I looked at and that is exactly where I would rank them. I genuinely would like to thank you and the team for making my trip the experience of a lifetime and I do hope to return someday and take part in a different trek, I'll be asking for Raj as a guide. Tony Grant Maersk Oil Maersk HouseCrawpeel RoadAltensAberdeenAB12 3LG DD

One of the best trips of my life!. I hiked to the Annapurna Base Camp with Ace and had an amazing time. Prem was great to work with and patiently answered my hundreds of pre-trip questions. Our Guide and porter were very nice and made sure we were comfortable. Nepal is a wonderful country and the hiking was spectacular. Be prepared to work for your meals, but it was a great break from mundane office life.

What a Great Experience!. I work in the adventure travel industry so I am often very critical of guided trips, I have to say that Ace exceeded each and every one of my expectations. The guides and porters were lovely and knowledgeable and our experience in Nepal was amazing. I highly recommend Ace to any operators looking for in country partners or any travelers looking to explore the wonder that is Nepal

Everest Base Camp Trek with Ace The Himalaya. For the second consecutative year Ace The Himalaya has provided me with a wonderful vacation giving me memories which will surely last a lifetime. Last year was the Tibet-EBC land tour and this year the Nepal-EBC trek. The Nepal-EBC trek took 11 days to complete, starting at Lukla at 2800 metres we trekked 9 days to reach our high point, the top of the Kala Pattar ridge at 5600 metres. The first 2 days of the trek were very pleasant walking along the Dudh Kosh river through pine and rhododendron forests passing many farms, villages and guesthouses. along the way. The climb to Namche Bazaar on the 2nd day was the first test of the trek being a grueling 2 hr climb gaining 600 metres in altitude but the view from the town when arriving is spectacular.Namche Bazaar lies in natural amphitheatre like bowl in the side of the mountain at 3440 metres looking across at 6000 metres peaks. Climbing to the top of the hill behind Namche Bazaar you're rewarded with the first view of Everest, Nuptse, Lhotse and Ama Dablam to the north. Following an acclimatization day at Namche the trek resumed walking north to spend the night at Tenboche with it's wonderful monastery and views of Everest and Ama Dablam. As the trail heads north from Tenboche slowly gaining altitude the pine forests give way to shrubs and rocks and the thinning air becomes apparent as the pace gets a little slower. Two nights were spent at Dingboche at 4350 metres with a day trip up the Chhukung Valley for acclimatization. One of the highlights of the trek for me the mountain vistas walking up the Chhukung Valley in clear blue skies were truly remarkable with Lhotse and Nuptse looming like a giant wall to the north and Ama Dablam spiking the skies to the south.Leaving Dingboche the trail heads north to the mouth of the Khumbu Glacier and the landscape becomes desolate at the high altitude with huge boulders and snow and ice. The hike up the Khumbu Glacier to Everest Base Camp was an obvious highlight of the trek. Though Everest can't be seen being hidden behind the Nuptse ridge the views of Nuptse and Pumori and all the lesser peaks are breathtaking along with the rugged desolation of the area. After lunch at Gorak Shep we walked the last few kilometres to Base Camp at 5365 metres. After decades of reading and dreaming about the area it was truly an exhilarating feeling to finally make it.Early the next morning after staying the night at Gorak Shep we made the 2 hour climb up to the top of the Kala Pattar ridge. Truly the definitive highlight of the trek for me the climb seemed long and grueling with the pace being very slow at the high altitude but the view from the top made one forget the effort to get up there. Everest down to the South Col is in clear view and so close now. The Khumbu Glacier and Base Camp now seems far below and looking out and across at all the peaks and valleys of the area it seemed we were higher than the 5635 metre elevation on my GPS.The trek out back to Lukla seemed anticlimatic but it was sure nice to get back into thicker and warmer air and grab a hot shower at Namche Bazaar.Overall I would highly recommend the trek to anyone with an adventurous spirit. The scenery is spectacular, the Sherpa people always friendly and hospitable. The trail itself was exceptionally well maintained at the lower elevations and the guesthouses we stayed at though often fairly crude and basic in accomadation were always clean and comfortable. It's hard work to make it through compounded by the thin air of the high altitude and one must be in moderately good shape with good endurance. For those of us whose age is advancing (I'm 53 yrs now) it's certainly do-able. There appeared many of us in their 50's and 60's along the trail.I can't thank Prem Khatri and his staff at Ace The Himalya enough for the organization, execution, courtesy and professionalism on all aspects of the trip. Ace always make you feel that they truly care and takes pride in providing the customer with all his needs to make his vacation a truly wonderful and unforgetable experience. Special thanks to trekking guides Bharat Adhikavi and Dhurba for their knowledge, patience, good humour and stamina. Both wonderful companions to have on such a trek making the entire adventure such a carefree and enjoyable experience. A special thanks to the three porters whose stamina and strength were truly remarkable and without whom the trek wouldn't of been possible. And finally a special thanks to city guide Prakash Aryal whose knowledge of local history and customs were truly impressive, which combined with his good humour and friendliness made the Kathmandu tour a perfect start to the vacation. Without the slightest doubt I would strongly recommend Ace The Himalayas for anyone considering traveling through the Nepal, Tibet, Bhutan region.

The best vacation ever!. Should you ever consider doing a trip to Nepal, do it with Google Treks. This company and especially its owner Prakash are amazing. He is the most friendly and service minded person I ever met. And the people he works with - from hotel owners, to guides and drivers - are all very friendly and reliable as well. We did a two week trip and had the time of our lives. Everything was perfectly organized, from sightseeing in Kathmandu and a breathtaking Everest flight, to a five day trekking at Poon Hill, a rafting tour plus an overnight stay on the river bank and finally a visit to the national park in Chitwan, where we saw wild living monkeys, crocodiles and even one of the famous one horned Indian rhinos. We are totally in love with Nepal and will for sure come back.

Wow! Amazing customer service! . My husband and I have been traveling the world the past 4 years. We've been to 46 countries and counting! We've done countless tours and the service we experienced from Prakash and Ram and their driver were hands down the best we've ever experienced! Prakash is a kind soul and is hospitality is second to none and he makes sure your tour exceeds your expectations! Thank you Google Trek!!

Every company should be run like this! . From the moment I first contacted Prakash about a tour of Kathmandu till the very end, he has been nothing but professional, knowledgeable and friendly! This is how every tour company should be run! Thank you Prakash!

Amazing Introduction to Nepal. I initially booked the trip via groupon. I then e-mailed Prakash to see whether I could make some changes to the itinerary as I wanted to make the best of my short trip. Prakash could not have been more helpful. He e-mailed me back straight away, changed hotels as per my wish and also added extra excursions.I was greeted personally by Prakash at the airport on arrival, taken to the hotel and also invited out for a traditional Nepali dinner. The hospitality was amazing.I am looking forward to booking again with Prakash and Google Trek when I attempt base camp next year. Thanks again Prakash.Book the mountain flight, you will not be disappointed...

Best tour guide. We had planned our trip to Nepal at the last minute. We checked for tour companies on trip advisor and the first tour guide company that came up on the list was Google trek due to their ratings. We didn't bother calling any other company. We just went for it. We were in Nepal for three days in total. We went on the Everest flight, the temples and the stupas. Nepal is a beautiful country, if you plan on visiting during the season time. It could get quite hot and humid if you went off season. By the second day we didn't want to do the trips in the valley, we told our guide Pranav (pronounced as Pranob) - let's do something else where it's cooler. So he took us to Nagharkhot and it was just amazing! Pranav is really good at what he does. He is very knowledgable (I meant literally- he has a Master degree in Tourism), friendly and has the right attitude for his job. We were lucky we got the best tour guide, for the trip! He took us to all the right places, he was very understanding when we changed our trip at the last minute. At the end of the trip he became a buddy to us. I would recommend this tour company just for Pranav if not for anything else! You might find it a little pricey if you book last minute but if you air your concerns to Mr.Simkhada, he would be willing to reduce the price. It was a wonderful trip, and we thank Pranav and Google trek for making it an amazing one! Attaching some photos from our trip and our guide!

Best Travel Company in Nepal. I had Nepal and Bhutan holiday in August 2016. Google Treks Nepal organized my both trips very professionally. Prakash and his en tired team was every time available to meet my needs. His tour guide Pranav seems very professional and he knows the history of monuments of Kathmandu very well. Prakash seems very helpful to make my holiday memorable for both Bhutan and Nepal.I came to know he is well educated and he knows travellers need very well. So far, I would like to strongly recommend this company for Nepal and Bhutan holiday.

Warm and friendly service, flexible to meet our wants. . Being our first time visiting Nepal, we were clueless on what we should plan. Luckily, we came across Google treks. Prakash planned our whole trip for us and he came out to welcomed us into Nepal from day 1. Because of him and his team, we were able to experience many aspects of Nepal. We went for 13 days and we were able to visit 3 cities (Kathmandu, Pokhara and Chitwan) and make life long memories. The tour was flexible and Prakash and his team made sure we were enjoying ourselves.I highly recommend Google treks. Prakash and his team were really great.

Excellent private day tours - not just for trekking but also for local sightseeing!. My husband and I were in Kathmandu, Nepal for a work conference in May. We decided at the last minute to try to squeeze in a day or two of sightseeing. We contacted 6 of the top rated sightseeing companies on tripadvisor including Google Treks. Google Treks was the ONLY company to call us back and have a full day tour arranged for us ASAP. We still haven't heard back from the other 5 companies that we contacted! We ended up doing 2 full days of sightseeing plus the Mt. Everest flight all arranged by Prakash at Google Treks. We highly recommend the Mt. Everest flight...it was amazing and is a 'must do'! We also loved Durbar Square - Patan and the Patan Museum, Bhaktapur, Bodhnath, Swayambhunath, and Pashupatinath. Also save some time to explore the shopping and restaurant area of Thamel. You can just tell Prakash how much time you have and he will put together an itinerary for you to see the top sights. If we ever make it back to Nepal, we will definitely contact Google Treks to arrange our sightseeing tours. His tour guides are extremely knowledgeable and also very friendly. His drivers have nice modern vehicles with seat belts (not always easy to find in standard taxis in Nepal) and drive safely. Thank you to Prakash for helping us out last minute and arranging awesome tours!!

I can warmly recommend. We were very well taken care of-from the moment we arrived in Nepal to the moment we left. Prakash and especially our guides and porters made us feel very welcome, safe and catered to our every need.

Best trekking company of thamel. Book your trek through Nepal with google treks, you will enjoy the best service you can find in KathmanduPrakash and his team are more then 100% dedicated to make your time in Nepal the best possible experience, can go into mountain, Annapurna range, or everest region.Chitwan national park, or cultural trip around ktm valley.Prakash and his team make tailor made treks, or if on budget go in the group, all is possible, but most important you will always feel the personal care for you by Prakash.I can higly recommend google treks.

Kathmandu sightseeing and Pokhara trek. Our recent trip to Nepal was organised excellently by Prakash. We had a great time - there is so much to see and experience. Visiting this area of the world is highly recommended!
Everest flight. Prakash kindly arranged out early morning himalaya flight and it was excellent. He took care of everything including the car to the airport. Thanks Prakash!

Kathmandu guided tour and trekking in and around Pokhara. Prakash at Google Treks organised an amazing guided tour of Kathmandu's most famous temples and palace complexes. We also opted for a short and easy trek in and around Pokhara. We trekked from Phedi back down to Pokhara, the views of the surrounding landscape and mountains were breath taking particularly at Sarangkot. Prakash did an amazing job of organising the trek and has extensive links with local professional trekking guides and drivers. We had a very magical and culturally enriching experience in Nepal thanks to Google Treks.

Organised Nepal. Prakash at Google Treks organised a very efficient 5 day tour through Nepal that was exactly tailored to what I wanted. On arrival make sure you have US $25 for the visa, fill a new immigration form (not the one they give you on the flight), and make sure you have a passport sized photo.Prakash made sure everything happened as it should and his drivers are all courteous and safe. He selected a very nice hotel for me, which was also exactly what I wanted.I did a one day tour of Kathmandu and the city suffers from bad traffic so allow for a considerable time to be sat in a dusty vehicle on noisy roads wherever you go. The 1 day tour in Kathmandu was great-ask for Pranav Thapa, who is an entertaining and informative guide. Prakash organised a transfer to Green Park at Chitin by air. The domestic airport is a little old fashioned (there is wifi) and listen out for the flight announcements, they won't let you miss your flight however. A 45l back pack is OK for cabin baggage even though you will have to sit with it between your knees.Green Park at Chitwin is a new lodge with rooms for around 50-60 people with pool and bar. The apartments are very nice with wifi and a/c, the food is good (if you are ok with Nepalese/Indian food - there is some western as well) The tours were all good, the best was the canoe ride - don't miss it. The elephant ride in the jungle is a must, however be aware you will be very lucky to see a tiger (the elephants have a habit of snorting on themselves, and the passengers, trying to stay cool - what can you do, just have a shower when you get back to the lodge). I also had a bird watching walk with Binod Chaudhary, who was the lodge guide for all the tours and was entertaining, courteous and knew his stuff.For International departures there is very little after security and the seating is basic.

Everest Base Camp trekking with Google Trek. If you're going to EBC, then this is the outfit I would recommend. I was for the most part a solo traveller but Google treks guide bigger groups as well. Every question you have is answered ahead of your arrival and Prakash will help you with any visa, currency exchange, or accommodation question on the ground. I also was able to borrow a sleeping bag from Google Treks which was useful as I didn't own one that was warm enough for the frigid mountain nights up there.My guide was Dipendra, who was incredibly dedicated to get me to Base Camp safe and sound, often encouraging, and full of information about the Himalayas. Whenever I felt unwell from Altitude, I was knew I was in good hands with Dipen's professionalism, reassurance and experience.
