They showed us thebest place to buy trekkinge quipment, and how to get transportation out of Kathmandu. The guide, Ram, was very helpful, and toldt us a lot about the history as well as what food to eat. We are very happy with our trek, and we believe that we have created a friendship with the guide and owner.

Tours in Kathmandu, Nepal. I visited Kathmandu, Nepal in February 2015 and I just want to say that my experience was amazing. We hired Ammar who is an outstanding tour guide. He communicated well and I've learned a lot from the tour. I highly recommended his tour company and he also give back to the community which is a plus.

Excellent Guide and Attentive Service. I knew Ammar from a friend who was a happy client. He was a very good guide and organized and recommended a good itinerary. Unlike most guides i know who's interested to make money and commission, his goal is that all travelers are happy :). On the last day of our trip when Kathmandu airport was closed, he was giving us information about the updates of the airport although technically he's not my day guide already. He gave a great insight of Kathmandu and recommended good food. Thanks Ammar. all the best for Gokyo Treks

Excellent guide. We visited Kathmandu last December and booked the guided tour by email, the service is excellent, Ammar the tour guide would go the extra miles to meet your needs. Would recommend their service to all friends and family.. Thanks Ammar

Excellent service and attention to detail.. We went on a tour of pokhara through Gokyo. Amar ji took care of everything transport was first class and the hotel was simply outstanding. He has depth knowledge of the industry and many good contacts I think that's why he is able to deliver the exceptional service. He even provided us with his personal mobile number in case we had any issues gladly we didn't have any. we had a wonderful time and will definitely recommend Gokyo and Amar to everyone intending to travel Nepal.

EBC with Kala Pattar. Ammar the owner of the company gave me a feeIing of being in good hands responding so fast and accurate to the my many mails prior to the trek. Arrived in Kathmandu I contacted him. He sent me one of his colleagues to escort me to the new place of the office. Which was to be honest not so easy to find. But with Ammars collegue of cause no problem. There were still a lot of constructions at the house so Ammar was quite busy when I met him for the first time. Nevertheless he made time for me and answered my last questions.The trek itself was an unforgetable journey through the heart of Solukhumbu.Actually the plan was to cross Chola Pass and go for Gokyo Ri too but unfortunately the pass was closed due to the snow. But even without Chola and Gokyo it was my most memeroable holiday so far.So I will not hesitate to highly recommend Gokyo Treks & Expeditions.Thank you for this adventure.

Everest Base Camp & Gokyo Ri Trek - fantastic. For:• Fantastic trek for mountains, villages, culture, adventure• Gokyo Valley has less crowds & is different in a number of ways from the main Khumbu valley • Gokyo Ri experience and views were fantastic• EBC is a thrill although it is basically only a sign surrounded by tourists during the non-climbing season• views from Gorek Shep are excellent• The Cho La pass from Gokyo valley to Khumbu Valley is spectacular, but very hard work at high altitude & a bit dangerous if icy• Tea Houses or Lodges are very basic but the common rooms are generally friendly & warm• The flight and landing/take-off from Lukla are a thrill, and Lukla is a good place to start-return• Namche Bazaar has a wide range of shops, views, food & musea and things to see so interesting for a day or 2.Against:• Main Khumbu valley is very busy, on our return leg down the valley, we were probably passing ~500 people /day• Gokyo valley is quieter & has a different feel to the Khumbu valley, but you do climb quicker so be very careful of Altitude Sickness• Many of the porters on the trail carry incredibly heavy loads and they are generally just lowland farmers working for extra money, so they have no genetic advantage to normal people to altitude, so please monitor & help them as much as possibleTrekking Mart provides very good service, an excellent range of itineraries and at reasonable costs, so we would definitely use them again.

Priceless experience. I went on my greatest adventure with more than 10 others in Sept 2014. Our tour guide was not only friendly but helpful and understanding. It was not easy handling such a big group but the tour guide made it look easy. I will carry the fond memories with me for the rest of my life. The many mountain ranges, Khumbu Glacier, the beautiful local faces and many others.If I ever return to Nepal for another hiking trip, it will be with Gokyo Treks and Expedition and nobody else.

Very good experience. Last winter I have done the Everest trek with Ammars company and it was a pleasure. Everything was managed very well. Communication was perfect, the service very professionell. I really recommend this company. Thanks a lot, Ammar!

Amazing view and great company. Last September, me and my group managed to hike up Everest Base Camp with the help of our guide, Som. The trip was well organized and everybody made it to the base camp. I'm impressed that we managed to fly in and out of Lukla on time considering the bad weather (they booked the earliest flight out, only morning flights made it).Ammar was very professional and reply to emails promptly. Gokyo treks is definitely one of the best tour providers in Nepal.Som is a very experienced guide, I strongly recommend him for anyone who wants to go on a hike in Nepal.

Good company - recommended. My wife used the services of Ammar Guni and his Gokyo Treks company for a trek to Annapurna base camp in Oct/Nov 2014. We are happy that we did.Ammar the owner/manager keeps communication regular and quick - this is important when you are making all your plans from overseas and via email. I found his dealings transparent and honest, also important when dealing from overseas.Our guide was Kamal, who was very experienced, knowledgeable and polite. He went out of his way to make sure our needs were catered for, was patient when our walking pace slowed and was very flexible to change things if unplanned circumstances arose.All in all, Kamal and the Gokyo Treks team help make our first trip to Nepal a very pleasant and unforgettable one, allowing us the enjoy the sights and sounds of the Himalayas fully whilst taking care of all the logistics during a very busy peak season.If you're shopping around for a transparent, good-value Nepalese trekking agency, add these guys to your list.

awesome Manaslu. Last October we went to the trek around Manaslu and in the beginning we were not quite sure about hiring the services of a guide,but learning some time later that it was compulsory for this trek we started to look up on the internet and sent several e-mails asking for budgets and conditions.Happily we chose Gokyo Trekkings among all the offers we got.Not only for a reasonable price but also for a clear setting out of the trip details.The truth is we hit the nail on the head.So,thanks to Ammar,who struggled to get the necessary permits even though it was Dasain festival in Kathmandu.On departing day to the trailhead we met Kamal,our guide,and Raju and Kesi,our porters,and from the very beginning we got on really well and with the passing of the days we could appreciate Kamal´s natural gift for guiding and fine temper.He soon figured out our preferences and needs,surprising us at every step on the way.So thanks to Kamal,Raju and Kesi for making our trek even better than it would have been otherwise

Wonderful trip to ABC Basecamp Nepal. Thank you for your arrangement for our trekking to Annapurna Basecamp. We got 4 great helpful porters. They are so kind and friendly. But foe a guide, he was good ,he helped us so much even he could be get more experience to contact with the tea house up there which was a really big problem to us. We understand this is the high season for trekking here and it's really difficult to find the nice one to stay cause it always full when we arrived. But we "ve never know if we need a cherpa to find one for us.By the way, we have plan to trekking there again and we will give u a chance to give us an experience guide to trekking to Manang in next 2 years.Thanks for helping us all along the trip. It's really great. Paree pentora.see u again.

One week. I was recommended to Tokyo Treks and Expedition by a friend who I came to visit in Nepal. She, unfortunately, could not join me for the trek so I embarked on this adventure to the Annapurna Base Camp (ABC) alone with my guide, Kamal.Let me start this review with my guide: Kamal. I was expecting someone to simply show me the way to the ABC. Kamal ended up being a trekking guide, a cultural guide, a culinary guide... You name it, he did it! He pointed out bee-hives in the Himalayas, always took the time to explain in full details any cultural questions that I had, negotiated on my behalf and was attentive to my every need. In a nutshell, I could not have asked for a more respectful, thoughtful, kind and knowledgeable guide (whose English happened to be amazing)! If I make it back to Nepal for another trek, Kamal is the guide I will be asking for.The journey to and from the ABC was spectacular. It was physically challenging but, thanks to Kamal's patience and encouragement, I never felt pressured. I did this trek during the rain season (July 2014), which means that I did not get the full bright and sunny views. However, I had the privilege of seeing the Himalayas with mystical and magical lenses as the light and the clouds would reveal the mountains in the most spectacular way (see pictures below).Lastly, I want to thank Ammar, the owner and director of Tokyo Treks and Expedition, for providing and excellent price to quality ratio for this adventure. He accommodated my budget with the time I had and made sure my expectations were met.Margaux Yost

Great Gosaikund week !. Dear Ammar and Som,Thanks very much for the week spent in Hymalaya with you. Our trip was well organised but also easy going which we could arrange our planning depending on our mood, that was great.Gokyo, gives good deal and try to arrange best option for your group.Thanks Som to show us your country. Som is a great guide, easy to joke with. Really great time in Nepal.Jim

“Great People, Great Service!!”. If you want to experience the adventure and get to know Nepal you choose Go For Nepal And Expendition.I had a wonderful time in Nepal thanks to this agency! The guides on our were very experienced, helpful, and friendly, and there was never a time when I felt unsafe on the trail. They always went out of their way to make it easier for us, and they were excellent organized everything perfectly....

Wonderful Annapurna Circuit with Gokyo in Dec 2013. I would highly recommend Gokyo Treks if you consider a trek in Nepal. This was my first time in Nepal and Gokyo took me to Annapurna Circuit along with the challenging Tilcho Lake detour. I have been very impressed with their help and services throughout the entire trek duration as well as with the planning. Ammar was very prompt with his responses and helped me to finalize the trek in a very short time, offering useful pointers regarding information difficult and time-consuming to find. Once i reached Kathmundu, he also helped me immensely with outfitting myself for the trek. As for my guide, i can't say enough nice words about him. He lent me a hand where needed, and he egged me on where appropriate. He saw how i fared and he took that into account when planning the next day. He was lively, kind, considerate and thanks to him and Gokyo i came back home stronger, wiser, more confident in my abilities and with a rich treasure-trove of memories that will sustain me for a very long time to come.It should be obvious by now that i'll recommend Gokyo quite fervently to anyone asking for my recommendations :-)

Gokyo Treks & Expedition Awesome!. If you ever come across Nepal or Himalaya, I would highly recommend that you plan your trip with Gokyo Treks & Expedition. This was my second hiking trip to Everest Base Camp which was arranged by Ammar Raj Guni from Gokyo. I had tremendous fun during both of my trip to Himalaya many thanks to the superb services and treatment from Gokyo. Good place, good people, good food thus.. good mood! I must say it was one of my special trip ever. I WILL SURELY COME BACK :)

Hiking in Upper Mustang in July 2014. I went hiking in Upper Mustang in Nepal with Gokyo Treks and Expedition with a friend. It is the most memorable trip I've ever had. Upper Mustang is a hidden jem in Nepal and is so different from anything else I've ever seen. The staff at Gokyo Treks are kind and professional. I felt like family at the end of the trip and made some friends for life. Ammar Guni, the owner of Gokyo is a true professional, honest and provides great service. Our guide, Som Shrestha, is also very professional and knowledgeable about Upper Mustang. We had a great porter, too, named Pratik, who is hard working, kind, and knows Upper Mustang well. I would recommend that I you're traveling to Nepal, you check out Gokyo Treks. Also, if you're looking for a great adventure, you have to check out Upper Mustang. You won't be disappointed.

Sightseeing around Kathmandu in August 2014. I had arranged only one day for a visit to some of the noteworthy cultural sites in Kathmandu and was fortunate to have Ammar Raj Guni as a personal guide. My expectations were exceeded thanks to Ammar's wonderful personal and professional character. His manner of speaking and his attentiveness to what I was or wasn't interested in were perfect. It was especially interesting and intriguing to get exposed to the richness of Kathmandu's relics and culture through his expert narration. I know he's going to read this review, so I also want to give a big Public Thumb's Up to you, Ammar--Thank you!

My awesomeness honeymoon trip to Nepal!. My husband (was my boyfriend at that time) went to Nepal in October 2012 for his EBC-Kalapathar trip with few of his friends under Gokyo Treks & Expeditions (properly arranged by Ammar Raj Guni). When he successfully came back from the trip, I was quite jealous when I saw great pictures of him and heard his stories about how good Nepal and Gokyo Treks is (he always mentioned that he misses his guide, Som very much). So, when we got married early April this year, I've decided that I wanted the same trip to Nepal for our honeymoon. I never thought that I would enjoy my trip to Nepal very much. Thank you Gokyo Treks & Expiditions for making my honeymoon by far the best vacation I have ever been. Thank you Ammar Raj Guni for arranging this trip.. Thank you Som for picking us up at the airport and walks us to the hiking stores.. And million thanks to our guide, Kamal Bahadur for all his services and guidance throughout the trip. One thing that I will always remember is that, they treat all of us like family. Its a sad goodbye because I love Nepal and Nepali people. But, this will not be my last trip to Nepal. So be prepared Gokyo Treks & Expiditions, I will come back with more people from Malaysia :)

Amazing Nepal. Thank you to Ammar, our guide for his kind hospitality during our trip to Nepal. We really like Ammar's guiding style, the way he explained to us about Nepal is very excellent and complete.We enjoyed the tour so much and all the tourism places are unique ones. Must to visit...Thanks also to our driver, if I am not wrong his name is Arun for his good stamina, good driving skill and patience. We really fell comfortable and safe while he drove us during our tour.We really recommend Ammar for the future visitors to Nepal. Regards, Cathy - Indonesia.

Annapurna Circuit in April 2014. Completed Annapurna Circuit with 4 friends. It was organized by Gokyo Treks and Expedition.It was a trip of a lifetime for me. Our guide Ram Guni is a young man with whom we had a great conversations. He is a very social and provided a wealth of information about the area and Nepali culture. He was also very patient, understanding, respectful and very helpful. Also our safety was his top priority. Our porters were also very helpful and great guys.Mr Ammar Raj Guni - the owner is also very friendly and honest.Thank you to all of you guys.
Awesome. Thank you Ammar Som and Kemal for a wonderful trek in the Everest area. Great to trek with you again and looking forward to the next time.Highly recommend. Rob from Australia

Annapurna. My trip was last minute and Ammar made it happen. They listened to what I want and planned an incredible trip for me. Amma's guide was very thorough in helping me prepared when I arrived. They also surprised me with small details along the trip. They trek was not easy, but with the helps and attention from them, the trip was really incredibly smooth. It is the unforgettable experience... the view, the people, the food, the long walk..An amazing 2 weeks. I definitely come back again and will definitely come back to Gokyo.

Manaslu Circuit Trek. We had an incredible experience ! Ammar was very helpful by giving us a lot of information beforehand and answering all our questions. Our guide Som was extremely knowledgeable, optimistic and flexible throughout the trek, leaving us with a strong ambition to continue and explore further Nepal. We have only warm words of recommendation - we hope to see the Gokyo crew soon !

Cant wait to go back. What an incredible adventure. My trip to Nepal was a spontaneous, one day to another, I'm going, sort of thing. Traveling there for the first time and by myself I did a bit of research and decided to go with Gokyo treks. Totally recommend them. They really listen to what I wanted to get out of the trip and suggested "to do's" accordingly. Once I made my decisions on treks they took care of everything else and I just had to enjoy it. Pasang, my guide, was incredibly knowledgeable, went beyond extra-ordinary service and everyday we had amazing local food, accommodation and views. The experience was genuine, breath taking and amazingly organised by Amar and the Gokyo team. Thanks guys. Seriously can't wait to go back.
Langtang Trek. These guys were a great company whole really do offer safe , well guided treks. I have no hesitation in recommending them.

Another great private tour. Gokyo Treks organised a great second visit to Nepal! Trekking through from Naya Pul to Ghorepani and Birethanti was short but sweet and the view from Poon Hill was amazing. We were well looked after from the little things like which side to sit on the small passenger plane for a great Himalayan view, to recommendations for yummy food, accommodating trekking pace while hiking and lots of fun talks and friendship. The itinerary planning was completely left to Ammar and it suited us really well with the time we had. I'd again recommend gokyo treks to anyone wishing a personalised Nepalese visit whether trekking, hiking or touring looking for flexibility, honesty and expertise.

Manaslu circuit with great Nepalese team. We did Manaslu circuit in November as a group of seven people. We picked Gokyo Treks & Expedition P. Ltd as we wanted to go with a purely Nepalese agency and the owner of the trekking agency, Ammar, provided a lot of information beforehand via email. Manaslu circuit trek is simply beautiful and I can highly recommend going there but what really stood out was our Nepalese team from Gokyo Treks. We had a great guide (Som) whose English was excellent and who was very knowledgeable about Nepalese nature and culture. He was also very flexible in adapting to our schedule when one of us did not feel well and did a great job in helping one of us over Larke Pass when she was really struggling. Our cook Kamal surprised us every day with delicious and varied food (from traditional Nepalese food to apple fritters) and even gave us two cooking classes (momos and Dal Bhat) on days were we stopped trekking a little earlier. Mundre, our lead porter, took really good care of us and was always very entertaining when we arrived tired from trekking, the three of them did a wonderful job in making us feel comfortable and safe throughout the trip and after two weeks they felt like a guarding family to us. Of course, I should not forget all our porters who were very friendly and did a very good job, especially on our long days.Thanks again to the whole team for all their effort, kindness and making the trekking such a wonderful experience!

Trekking - Langtang and Gosaikunda. We decided to do a trekking in the himalya and after several reviews we have chosen the Gosikunda Trek. Some months before our trip we found the agency Gokyo Treks in the internet and contacted them. They were very helpful from the beginning and everything was great. The guide and the porter they booked for us were very friendly and better than all other guides we met during our trek. Also the guy from the agency, Ammar was absolutely professional. At least also the price was fair. All in all we had a very well organized trek and enjoyed it a lot. Thanks to Ammar and the whole team!

Flexible and Personal service. Ammar was able to patiently work with us through all of our planning questions and trip organizing. We were able to personalize our trip even up to the last few days before arrival and while on our beautiful trek. Ammar has the experience and knowledge to provide personal and flexible plans. Once on the trail I was assured that Ammar, our guide, and our porter definitely had our backs, which made our adventure hassle free. Thanks to Ammar and Goyoko Treks for a life changing trip. Looking forward to returning to beautiful Nepal.

mansalu trek. Ammar was very helpfull in advance per e-mail with finding out how we wanted to do our trek. He was very well organized in having papers and permits ready so we could leave the day after our arrival. The costs were exactly as he had offered them.

Professional precious help and super friendly!. Ammar from Gokyo Treks and Expedition did an amazing job organizing our stay in Nepal and fulfilling all our wishes. Although sticking to the plan can happen to be difficult in Nepal, Ammar was available for us 24/7 and gave his utmost energy or plan B. In fact, I wonder if Ammar even sleeps: Before our holiday we wrote many many e-mails since we had some special questions and requests. We always got quick and professional replies. Also during our stay he was immediately there when needed or quickly organized what was needed.Our experience at the beautiful Everest Trek was great as well. Professional and friendly porter and guide helped us to have an amazing and always safe outdoor adventure.I have never felt better taken care of in a holiday than by Ammar Guni and his team. We totally enjoyed the unforgettable trip and truely recommend Gokyo Treks to everyone!Thanks for everything!Birgit & Pascal

Upper Mustang. Great trek, run by competent people, a special guide called SOM and a nice carrier. Fantastic landscapes and unforgettable encounters. Gokyo Treks is the right agency to make a trek in Nepal!!! Thanks at all!

Excellent service at a low price. I have used Ammar a few times for treks and a safari and he has proven to be one of the cheapest, fast and most reliable trekking companies I have worked with.. I live in Nepal and have used a few different companies and so many of them try to cheat you or lie about the level of service to get your business.. Ammar has always us what we agreed at the price agreed. his guides so far have been friendly and professional plus he has a porter-cum-guide service where the guide will carry up to 15kgs so you reduce the need for a porter and cut the cost of your trek. If you can afford it Upper Mustang and Upper Dolpa are amazing and well worth the time & money but you have to get a special permit to which costs about $500..

Great trip. This is my first time to trekking.I really in love with it.Thanks for you give my best guide and potter.I happy all time in my trekking trip; althoug i never tired like that before.So bad that i have holiday only 5day; i want to spend more time in Nepal.

Best experience ever. My travel companion and I did the Annapurna circuit trek in early June 2013, and chanced upon the reviews for Gokyo Treks on tripadvisor while planning for our trip. Due to the great reviews here, we decided to contact Ammar to plan for our short stay in Nepal.The first thing that struck me was not only how quick Ammar was to answer our queries, but the level of detail and transparency he provided in every single email exchange we had. Because of the very reasonable prices his agency was able to provide us, as well as the honest suggestions and tips that we felt he provided in our interest, we were very comfortable in signing up with Ammar and his team before arriving in Nepal. Before our trip, Ammar provided us with a detailed itinerary, as well as a full break down of what we were exactly paying for. The highlight of the trip really was our fantastic guide and porter, Umesh and Mundri. We always felt like they truly had our interests at heart - making sure we had enough to eat, that we were happy with our rooms, that we weren't feeling too cold etc. Mundri would always lookout for ways to help us have an easier trekking experience, and the best thing he did for us was to get us some sturdy branches that he skilfully turned into hiking poles after a few shaves with a rock. Umesh, being the experienced guide that he was, got us safely through a newly formed landslide and avalanche (scariest moment of our trip). At the end of our trip, he even invited us to his place and cooked us an amazing dinner, a gesture and experience we will remember for life.Although this is a really long review, all I'm trying to say is this: Gokyo Treks made my virgin Nepal experience an unforgettable and fantastic one, and I will not hesitate to recommend them to anyone thinking of having a memorable, once-in-a-lifetime experience in Nepal.

The best of Nepal. Last year, we did our second trek organised by Ammar and his team at Gokyo Treks. The first one was a modified Annapurna circuit and this time it was the classic Manaslu circuit. in both cases, the trips were fantastic, well-organised and flexible. Without hesitation, we recommend Ammar and his crew to any novice or experienced Himalayan trekker.Rob and Sue HAustralia

Exzellent!. Die Betreuung von Ammar war exzellent - schon im Vorfeld erhielt ich prompt Antwort auf meine vielen Fragen per Mail. In Kathmandu angekommen, traf man sich in seinem Büro um alle Einzelheiten zu besprechen. Meine Tour wurde etwas indiviuell und flexibel gehalten. Der engagierte Führer (Niru) und der Träger (Umesh) waren der Hit! Wir hatten jede Menge Spaß und sie kümmerten sich immer sehr um mich. Ich würde jederzeit wieder eine Tour bei Ammar buchen und kann ihn nur wärmstens empfehlen. Der Everest Base Camp Trek (inkl. Kala Pathar) war eines der schönesten Erlebnisse, die ich bislang hatte. My tour to the Everest Base Camp was excellent. I wrote many emails to Ammar before I flew to Kathmandu and got very quick and friendly response. When I arrived in Kathmandu, we met in his office to clarify the details for the tour. My tour was an invidual and flexible tour. The guide (Niru) and porter (Umesh) were great and we much fun! I enjoyed my time with them a lot and they were taking care of me very well. I would book a tour with Ammar (Gokyo Treks) again and can warmly recommed him. The trek to EBC (including Kala Pathar) was one of the most amazing experiences in my life so far!

Langtang and Annapurna Circuit. Gokyo Treks and Expedition is an excellent smaller guide company that created a custom made tour for me as an independent traveller. I had a relatively small window of time (10 days), and I wanted to see as much as possible - after emailing extensively with the hardworking, responsive, and responsible Ammar, the manager at Gokyo, we decided upon the Langtang and Annapurna regions. To be as efficient as possible, my guide and I flew between the 2 regions.The strengths of Gokyo are that they are able to custom build an itinerary that suits your needs. Also, although Ammar is slightly unusual looking (I kid, he is a very handsome man), he was very patient and responsive to my inquiries. The trip itself was really stunning, and I had a memorable time with a very friendly and knowledgable guide. As additional support to use this company, Ammar and Gokyo give back approximately 10% of their yearly earnings back to the community. In the past few years, they were able to help build waterpipes and toilets to a regional school, and have additional plans to provide health resources to their local community. These people care about nurturing their community, and it speaks volumes about their character. The services provided were professional and very reasonable priced. I would highly recommend Ammar and his trekking company. Rob C

21 Day Manaslu Trek. I had previously done a 7 day langtang trek as a warm up to this. I hadn't had a lot of experience of trekking so Ammar wisely suggested i do the lang tang then move up to the more grueling Manasalu. From Ammar organising the itinerary to our guide (KC) and our porter (Mundray) everything went perfectly. We did a circuit of Mt Manaslu with a trip up and down the Tsum Valley. At all times KC & Mundray were friendly, helpful and always on hand. They showed me local customs, taught me Nepali and became genuine friends on this trek. Mundray was especially adept at finding a bottle of Raksi (Rice Wine) in an emergency. I am have never felt so welcome in a country as when i had KC and Mundray along to show us the Himalayas. They were also very sure that we ate properly, had enough blamkets at night and also that we were feeling ok. As we went up to over 5000metres it was fairly dangerous but we were never rushed by KC. It was always we were able to do i never felt under pressure. As some hygiene standards were a little lax inthe kitchens of the home stays we rested in KC always supervised cooking to make sure we didnt fall ill.I had a few days in Kathmandu before the trek so I checked with other agencies to see if i could get a better deal. I saw 5 in the Thamel area and it was impossible. None came close even without a porter!! I am already thinking about my next trek in the mustang area and i will insist i trek with KC and Mundray and whenever i meet other travellers who are thinking about going to Nepal i recommend Gokyo straight away. They treat their guides and porters properly which cannot be said about a lot of Trekking agencies in Kathmandu and also promote sustainable tourism. Thank you Ammar, KC & Mundray.

PROFESSIONAL AND REASONABLY-PRICED. I cannot speak too highly of Ammar and his company. His professionalism, his affability, and his knowledge is beyond superior. Simply put, if you are looking for any sort of guidance while in Nepal, Ammar and Som will give you personalized, tailored service to fit your desires at a most reasonable price. Always on time, friendly, and yearning to please, they helped make my last trip to Nepal a memory I will cherish forever. I greatly thank them and highly recommend them.John

Gokyo trek is the Best trekking in Everest region. Personally, I love Gokyo trek than Everest base camp because of spectacular mountains view from Gokyo Ri 5357m including Mt Everest 8848 meter above sea level {world highest peak}, Mt Lhotse 8501m {4th highest in the world}, Mt Makalu 8463m {5th highest in the world} & Mt Cho Oyu 8153m {8th highest in the world}, {approximately Elevation} and numerous snow copped peaks surrounding you. Actually, you ca not see the Mount Everest from Everest base camp. If you have flexible or more time then would like to suggest to visit to fifth lake of Gokyo valley which lies nearby Mount Cho Oyu and can see Mt Everest as well, so fine shape. You can see and visit the Ngozungpa glacier, it is largest glacier in Nepal. You can enjoy with flora and fauna as well in this trek in Nepal. There are good lodges and hygienic foods available.

Couldn't be organized any better!. My husband and I were planning to go trekking around Manaslu and Annapurna in November-December and came across this company. We chose them from about 30 options because the price was very reasonable and they would organize things the way WE wanted, not how it would be convenient for THEM. It sounded too good to be true so we were quite suspicious.However, everything turned out better than we could ever imagine. Amar chose a guide for us that we first though was too young to be experienced but Pasang proved to be the best guide ever. He went way beyond the call of duty to make our journey as fantastic as it could be. I have asthma and expected problems but Pasang and our porter Lakpa were always on the alert and followed me like shadows prepared to help any minute. We were so impressed with Pasang's knowledge and kind and joyful character that offered him to join us on the Annapurna trek and we never regretted this.Amar on his side could solve almost any problem, hard even to think what he couldn't help with. Ram helped us to choose equipment we wanted to hire and everything was of very good quality and survived the trip. In other words, if I ever go travelling in Nepal again, there is only one touring company I will go to - Gokyo Treks. Thank you very much, guys! You are the best!

Gokyo Treks are excellent !!!. In 2010 I went with my son and my friend to Nepal for the Annapurna Circuit. It was my first time in Asia and I was a bit apprehensive about the whole trip. We hired a guide, Krishna, from Gokyo Treks to guide us through the trip. It was the best thing we did. Krishna smoothed our bus and jeep journeys to and from the trailhead, guided us through the maze of hostels and hotels on the trail; in few places because of the washed trail, we would be lost without him. The most memorable event was negotiating with the guard armed with the saw off shotgun and a Ghurkha knife at the entrance to the bank. Apart for smoothing the way at all corners we visited with him the Buddhist temple, the local artisans, we were invited by local villagers for tea, and visited the ayurvedic Natural Hospital at Mukhtina. Without the guide from Gokyo Treks out trip would have been so much less memorable. Yes, if you ask, I would hire the guide from Gokyo Treks again.

Gokyo treks exceeds expectations. Visiting Nepal for the first time can be a daunting experience. Especially from so far away.. Australia. However this tour/trek company has completely exceeded any expectations I had on just about every level. I didn't have to worry about anything!I spent a short time trekking/hiking from Pokhara to namely, Sarangkot and Dhampus as well as a couple of days on cultural touring.The pricing is very appropriate.The itinerary is specific and well done, tailored to client needs/desires.The staff are amazingly helpful, professional and friendly.My time in Nepal has truly been one of the best things I've ever done and I am confident to write this is definitely due to the conduct of this company. Ammar and my guide Ram have been integral in my experience and I would emphatically refer this tour/trek provider to everyone and anyone without hesitation.If anyone has questions or just wants more reassurance from an experienced client I am more than happy to be contactable.

Exceptional. Due to unexpected change of plans when recently in Nepal I had to organise a quick trip to the Annapurnas. A friend suggested using Gokyo Treks and Expedition. The route that Ammar planned and organised at short notice, was sensational. He is also very likable, friendly, honest & gives back to his community by way of funding & building toilets!!Lack of sanitation is a big problem in Nepal & Ammar is doing something which will enormously benefit a village. Such a person has a good heart. Highly recommended.

Once is never enough.. Namaste!I had the amazing trekking experience yet challenging as well and all thanks to Gokyo Treks and Expedition! The trek was well planned by Ammar. Nepal is a beautiful country and it is such a waste to not visit. I went there with a group of friends for two weeks trek to Everest Base Camp. We even successfully reach to the top of Mt Kala Patthar. Som, our trusted guide is very friendly. He find good accommodation for us with beautiful view and really nice place to stay. He even help me carrying my bag when im was tired. Som is very experienced and knowledgeable about the Himalayas. I believe that Gokyo treks are well organized and provide excellence services which i highly recommended.

Home away from home. I went for the EBC trip with 6 other friends in October 2012. Gokyo Treks team has been supportive from day 1 to the final day we were in Nepal. Ammar Guni has provided us with the utmost Nepali hospitality and given us nothing but the best. He is honest and straighforward in his dealing with us, therefore it was easy for us to prepare ourselves in any situations. He entrusted Som to guide us in the trekking and Som is the best guide I've ever met. He is friendly, warm and knowledgeable about all the mountains and its surroundings. Som will go beyond his way to ensure that our trip interesting, educational and memorable. He gives nothing but the best! I doubt my trip would be fantastic without Som. I highly recommend Gokyo Treks to anyone going to Nepal. They are honest, reliable and friendly. You will feel home away from home with them.
EBC and Kala Patthar. I used Gokyo treks for the trek to EBC . It was one of the best experiences of my life and I would definitely use them again .

EBC & Gokyo with Gokyo Treks and Expeditions. Together with my wife, we spend a great time trekking combined EBC and Gokyo routes this spring organized with the help of Gokyo Treks and Expeditions. From the first formalities with permissions in Kathmandu, through helpful recommendations on buying/renting some trekking equipment up providing us with our great, knowledgeable and fun guide Bahkta, everything was excellent. Ammar was always very helpful and available on short notice whenever we had any questions or requests and we could recommend this agency to everyone. He tailor a great vacation for us, meeting all our individual needs so we enjoyed he Himalayas greatly and can't wait to come back again.Namaste!Peter and Tana

EBC Trek. I went to the EBC in October last year and it was an excellent one even though I didn't manage to reach the base camp. Ammar is very flexible, very helpful and trust worthy. He helps me a lot during the trek and even lend me some money during the trek! I highly recommend Ammar and his team for you guys who wants to do a trekking within Nepal and I already booked my other trek with Ammar this coming October! -Firdaus Hashim--Malaysia-

Highly recommended agency. We have done 2 treks with Ammar and his crew. Our guide, Som, was fantastic and the porters happy and reliable. Ammar is great to deal with. We are coming again next year and will use Gokyo Treks. Dr Rob HAustralia

With Gokyo Trek you'll discover an hidden paradise!. Nepal is quite magical and so different from many other countries in a very spiritual way. You can be a child there, without regards for the rest of the world. I've been there for 20 days and Ammar accompanied me in the Annapurna trekking.I am absolutely sure it doesn't exist a safer and better way to discover this paradise from every side and learn what the real Nepal is than travel around with a person who not only is one of the most smart and well prepared guides I've ever know (who also manages project to help local population with the Agency's and personal incomes) but also a wonderful person who takes care of you, becoming as close as your family. I absolutely suggest Gokyo trek to everyone who wants to have a real experience of this incredible country.

Nepal with a pro. We booked our trip through Nepal with Gokyo Treks and had a fabulous adventure. We didn't go on a Trek in the Himalayas, but toured Katmandu, Bhaktapur, and the Chitwan National Park. My sister was a little under the weather following the India portion of our trip and Ammar was flexible with plans and always tended to our needs. While in Bhaktapur, which is known for aggressive local guides harrassing tourists and their guides, we saw many guides walk away from their clientelle, leaving them stranded with these aggressive guides. Ammar stuck with us. I highly recommend this tour group, our holiday would not have been the same without Gokyo Treks and Expedition Day Tours!

Excellent trek. Reliable and honest agency. We booked our Upper Mustang Trek with Ammar and we are very happy we did it. Gokyo Treks is an agency you can rely on. They are honest, take care of their groups and guests. Ammar called every day more than one time a day to check how we were doing. We felt protected and safe. All the trek has been organized perfectly, faultless. Som (the master guide) is a perfect companion. He is there when you need him but he does not bother you with unnecessary attentions.What else to say: we will do more treks with them hopefully very soon. We have found THE agency and we recommend it to all of you.

Gokyo Treks would be your right choice. As a leader from Innsbruck I have been in Nepal several times. Every single trip I made to Nepal (either myself or with a group of clients) I used the services of Gokyo Treks & Expedition Pvt ltd. and have never been disappointed. Nepal is a bit different World on its own, in some way rushy, in other slow, but definitely different. But that is why the people travel - to discover and to learn these differences. However, sometimes cultural misunderstanding in combination with language barriers may culminate into a stressful experience which hides the merits of travelling. At the first place, I talk about problems in hotels, booking confusions, wrong understanding between driver and the group, slow processing of some services etc. These are the experiences you don't need to take with from Nepal. As far as now I have to say that Gokyo Treks & Expedition team is the very best choice. They are helpful, they understand well the needs and wishes of foreigners, have good, safe and careful partners and at any time during providing their services to you they are listening and are very flexible to accommodate to you (e.g. if you want to have a change in your itinerary or change the driver because he/she's too rushy to you)... If you want pleasant and financially budget trip in Nepal, the Gokyo Treks & Expedition would be your right choice.

Fantastic trek with fantastic support from a great company. Nepal Social treks organised our trip around Annapurna circuit for 18 days. They were very flexible, and tailored an experience for us that was simply wonderful. I fell ill on the first day in Kathmandu and Nepal Social Treks could not have been more helpful, rearranging start date and accommodation, getting a doctor to me and essentially getting me on my feet and ready to go. Simply put this was top customer service, guides and porter were well equipped and knowledgable - I cannot find any fault in what they provided. This was the best holiday I have ever had. Thank you Sajana for your hard work.

Everest Base Caml Trek with Aideep. Following a 12 day adventure I safely made it to EBC and back thanks to the fantastic guide Aideep! The trek itself was beautiful, majestic and a true adventure for the explorer in us all. The trek was well organised, Aideep was very supportive and helpful throughout, ensuring any needs were met and using his experience and wisdom to safely get you to EBC and manage the altitude and base camp and back.I spoke to Nepal social via emails prior to my trip to Nepal, the staff were very helpful, it was all straight forward and easy once I arrived. The price is more than fair for what your getting, the Teahouses and food along the way we're good considering the remote part of the world your in. I'd recommended this to anyone and am already thinking about another trip!

Great trekking agency, awesome guide Aideep!. Nepal Social Treks organized our whole time in Nepal. From arriving in Kathmandu, staying in Kathmandu in a very nice hotel, flying to Lukla and trekking in the Everest region for 17 day with a very funny and experienced guide (Aideep) and more than friendly porter (Durga). This agency has many years of experience and we have no complaints. We already miss Nepal and we would definitely travel again with Nepal Social Trek.

Annapurna Circuit Trek October 2016. We used Nepal Social Treks and Expedition for a three-week trip to Nepal that included Kathmandu, Annapurna Circuit Trek, whitewater rafting and Pokhara. Ram and Sajana were very helpful with all aspects of the trip. I would definitely use Nepal Social Treks again for a trip to Nepal. Sajana was very responsive and personable when we were organizing the trip. KB was an excellent guide for the Annapurna Circuit Trek and I would enjoy going on another trip with him. Although there were complications with their hotel reservations at the end of the trip, they tried to resolve them as best they could and upgraded our hotel.

Wonderful Annapurna Circuit Trek including Tilicho Lake and Poon Hills. We would like to thank Ram, Basu and Sajana of Nepal Social Treks and their team who took very good care of us while in Nepal (in Kathmandu, Pokhara or on the Annapurna Circuit trek). We had wonderful time and completed the whole Circuit as planned with visit to Tilicho Lake and also managed the Poon Hills.Our guide Lakhapa and his team of Pemba and Ram was an ever smiling trio who were always ready to help us. With all of them with us all the time trek seemed like an easy endeavour. Please convey our special thanks to them.All the hotels chosen by you in Kathmandu or Pokahara or by Lakhapa on the trail were very decent and barring one or two incidences they were very much up to our expectations. Even during those rare incidences where we couldn’t manage separate rooms Lakhapa and his team had put in enough efforts to find the right ones. All our travel plans and where abouts were always tracked and good attention given to pick and drop facility.Overall we had a wonderful experience and we would be happy to recommend Nepal Social Treks to anybody and will specially do so in Pune, India within our friends circle.Hemant, Vinaya and Ninad

Kathmandu, Annapurna Circuit, Pokhara and Whitewater Rafting. Nepal Social Treks and Expeditions organised and managed a 21-day visit itinerary for me and 3 friends that included sightseeing visits in Kathmandu and Pokhara, 12-days trekking around the Annapurna Circuit and 2-days whitewater rafting. From my initial enquiry through to final departure I was extremely impressed with their responsiveness and attention to detail. Our guide and porters where excellent and helped make the whole trek a fantastic and memorable experience. The whitewater rafting was a great experience and a great way to relax after trekking. Overall I thoroughly enjoyed the entire trip and would definitely use Nepal Social Treks and Expeditions again.

Hiking to Annapurna Base Camp trip from 1.10.2016 to 14.10.16. Four of us went on this hiking trip organized by Nepal Sosial. It was very well organised, all transportation from airport to hotels, all hotels or tea houses stay along the hiking trail and food arrangements were all taken care of and we only had to focus on our own hiking. It was truly an excellent trip with a very, very good guide Mr Achut Pandey who really go all out to take care of us while on this trip and we truly appreciate his dedication to his work. Thank You Nepal Sosial !

A wonderful trekking ABC experience with a superb company. We searched the web and chose Nepal Social. We asked questions and received satisfactory answers. We signed up and when the time came we went. We were overwhelmed by their excellent services organised by Ram and Sajana beginning from the moment you stepped out of Kathmandu airport. Next the trekking team lead by Acut Pandey who is a very knowledgeable and experienced guide, provided us the most interesting trekking journey. He had taken very good care of us, four hikers in our very early sixties especially our food and accommodation. He made sure we ate and slept well. He also made sure we did not leave things behind by having his last check. Most impressively, he had guided us to an enduring but safe and enjoyable ABC trekking. Thank you to this team of dedicated staff of Nepal Social.

Great trip with a very good trekking Company. We are a group of four 60year old hikers who did the Annapurna Base Camp trek with Nepal Social in Oct 2016.Before signing up, we had a lot of questions and uncertainties which required answers and clarifications as non of us have ever been to Nepal. Ram and Sajana from Nepal Social were very patient and professional in answering our queries. From start to finish, our trip was very well organised. The trekking support team of Achut Pandey (the guide) and Nabin and Sanjit were very professional, helpful and knowledgeable and they provided our group with exceptional service through our journey.A tick off our bucket list and Nepal Social ensured that it was a memorable one for all of us.Thanks very much Nepal Social. I hope that we can meet up again soon.

Simply fantastic!. Did the complete Edmund Hillary trek from Jiri to Everest basecamp with an extension to Gokyo and Cho la Pass Pro's: One of the most challenging but also most beautiful treks ever! Fast response from the agencyMoney refund for the days that i didnt useBest guide and support ever! Can totally recommend Budhhi Lama and Sang Yam Rumba.Flexibility during the trek in all aspectsAll questions were anwseredChoice in guides

Annapurna Circuit Experience - safe and excellent guided. Basu from Nepal Social Treks and Expedition advised us what would be best to do with our 3 weeks in Nepal what is safe and at the same time exciting at this time of the year.As he works himself as a guide and doing this since many years he knows the himalayas inside out.Our guide Raju was extraordinary. We especially recognised that when we saw and met other single travellers or groups. Some of them were experienced and hiked mountains all over the world like the cotopaxi etc. We always felt safe and fair treated. His English was good, much better than from some of the other guides and he did not play games.The stories we heard from other or the ones we witnessed were something you do not want to deal with when you are relying on a guide in 5400 Meters altitude.A very round up happy experience. Excellent and reliable.JK

Well organised company with great service. I cannot speak highly enough of Sajana from Nepal Social Treks. Right from the beginning she responded to my emails quickly, answering all my questions, helping me organise my trip through Nepal and Tibet. I didn't have to worry about a thing. The Tibet trip was such an incredible experience made even better in that everything was taken care of for me including date changes and visa.In Nepal I changed my plans suddenly and was on the verge of a melt down when Sajana came to the rescue and made suggestions, organising accommodation, travel, guides etc. Everything! She has this amazing ability to understand exactly what you are looking for in your holiday and how to accommodate that. I really cannot speak highly enough of the effort that she put in to make my visit memorable and smooth. Nothing was too much trouble for her.Last year Nepal Social Treks organised a short trek for me in Nepal which went so smoothly I thought I would try them again this year. I am so glad I did! I would highly recommend them to anyone thinking of going to Nepal or Tibet.

Many thanks to Nepal Social. What a great organisation.. I cannot begin to describe how wonderful Nepal Social were in making our trip to Nepal the most exciting and stress free holiday ever.We met with the owners Ram and Sajana on numerous occasions and nothing was too much trouble for them. They are totally professional and so friendly to deal with.I was a first timer to Katmandu and believe me, without their help and guidance I think I would have been on the first flight back to Sydney.Many thanks again for a fabulous holiday and I will be back again with your help of course.

First Class. I booked onto a trip to hike to EBC many months in advance. The team at Nepal Social were more than helpful from the very start! After many emails from myself, which were all answered quickly, I was reassured to know I was dealing with a professional team. My trip was perfect, I got to see everything I wanted. My plans changed slightly as I had a little more time than I thought, and Ram and Sajana helped my book side trips to Pokhara and Chitwan, taking care of all the necessary arrangements. By the time I left I felt like part of the family! I'm so grateful for all the work they did to make my trip unforgettable.My guide for the EBC trek was Indra (we shared a birthday on the trek!). He was knowledgeable, friendly and helpful, and seemed to know everyone in the villages! He made my trip easy with his guidance and I feel that I learned so much more about the region than I would have elsewhere. His English was excellent, when listening to other groups I noticed there was sometimes a language barrier, so this was a massive bonus.Thank you all so much for everything, I cannot recommend your company enough to anyone thinking of visiting Nepal.

Gokyo – Chola Pass - EBC Trek / Bhutan Tour with Nepal Social Trek. After some research we followed the TripAdvisor recommendations and contacted Nepal Social Trek via the contact details on their website. Ram and his wife Sajana made sure that we would feel welcome in Nepal, even before we arrived. The communication and arrangements beforehand went smooth prior to our arrival. Even our many questions and change requests to the itinerary were always dealt with immediately. From the pick-up at the airport to the drop-off a month later, everything was taken good care off by the people in Nepal Social Trek.We chose the more challenging and longer route to EBC via Gokyo and Chola-Pass, our guide Achut was the perfect companion, he made sure we stayed safe throughout the trek and that we get proper rest in the well-chosen hotels/tea houses. The trek via Gokyo is very beautiful and it’s worth adding a few days more to the regular EBC trek. When we had to cross Chola Pass we were very unlucky with the weather, it started to snow heavily when we started to hike up the pass. The hike was very steep on ice and fresh snow, we were glad that Achut with his experience was not afraid and helped us to reach the top safely (he pulled us more or less up the pass). Going down over the glacier was not less scary, especially since we could not see a path, since we already trekked with Achut for many days we fully trusted in his abilities to get us safe through the ice field and the most dangerous portion of our trek.Achut knows the Khumbu region very well and has a lot of stories to share, which was very entertaining during the many hours on the trails. When our porter became sick (AMS) and we couldn’t find a porter for hire in the mountains, Achut was willingly carrying our baggage for three days (luckily we packed light and only had 16kg together as a couple, and we loaded a few heavier items in our day-packs for that period). All in all we felt very well look after by Achut. I would recommend all trekker to hire a guide and a porter for the trek to EBC (no matter which route), as this ensures you don’t have to worry about accommodation, heavy load on your back (we have seen many people suffering carrying all their luggage) and the days planning, but you can just enjoy the beauty of Khumbu.If we would do this trek again we would again book the tour package with Nepal Social Trek (which included all meals, the tea with the meal, accommodation, permits, flights KTM-Lukla-KTM, porter, guide) as it makes the trek less troublesome and we only needed to carry cash for any luxury we wanted in the mountains (for example cookies from an amazing bakery on Gokyo).After our return to Kathmandu from the lengthy and exhausting trek we stayed 3 nights in the city to relax and get used to civilization again :)Our Bhutan trip was also fully organized by Ram and Sajana, who briefed us with the details for the trip the day prior to the departure. Again we booked a package which included flights (KTM-Paro-KTM), accommodation, meals, guide, driver, permits and visas. Everything went very smooth in Bhutan, our guide (Mr. Namgay) and driver (Mr. Tobden) [as a foreigner it is required to be accompanied by a guide and a driver in Bhutan] picked us up from the airport and our cultural tour through beautiful Bhutan started immediately. Mr. Namgay and Mr. Tobden were dressed in the Bhutanese traditional dress Gho and welcomed us with the traditional Khata (Buddhist scarf, representing well-wished). Throughout our 4 days in Bhutan we were able to learn a lot about wonderful Bhutan and the Bhutanese people. This country is full of culture, Bhutan is certainly worth a visit. Although after 2 days of visiting fortresses, monasteries and temples it is very difficult to follow all the explanations of the statues and paintings throughout, but the beauty is still amazing. Ram and Sajana organized everything very well.Many thanks to all friends from Nepal Social Trek, we had a great time under your care :)

EBC Trek and Chitwan National Park. We spent great time in Nepal, thanks to this travel agency. They organized our 2 and a half weeks just perfect. Flights, guides, porters, private cars, hotels, lodges, airport pick-up's, elephant safari, canoe ride on a river full of crocodiles, everything. It was important that we did not waste time...

EBC, Gokyo Lakes, Chola Pass Trek. I felt at ease with Nepal Social Treks. My whole trip was well-organized and flowed smoothly. My guide was knowledgeable and the trekking was spectacular. Such a beautiful country!

4 Days in Kathmandu and Tibet Tour. I had a great time in Kathmandu!!! Didn't have much time to search a lot but I was recommended the Nepal Social Treks and they, actually Ram, took care of everything from the time I arrived in the airport, hotel, my days around the city where I visited many sites and even helped me with my trip to Tibet. Didn't have to worry about anything. Thank you Ram so much! Cannot wait to come back to Nepal and see the Mt. Everest from this side of the world...

The Best Way to Experience Nepal. Whether you're trekking or just seeing the sights, Nepal Social has an incredibly competent and attentive team of professionals to help you every step of the way. I recently traveled with them, and as it was my first trip to Nepal, I was eternally grateful for their expertise. Not only do they have extensive knowledge of the landscape and historical sights, but they have connections with high quality Western-style hotels that make the stay comfortable. Their guides are all fluent in English, and extremely kind and helpful. Would definitely recommend them to anyone traveling to Nepal for the first or fiftieth time.

Excellent EBC-Trek - Trustful and nice people. I booked a budget-14 days-trek to Everest Base Camp. Ram and his wife Sajana from Nepal Social Treks organised things well and chose a very very nice Guide (Lakpa Sherpa) who is from Khumbu-area and knows the area well. His english was good and he was caring very much for me. Also the porter Gomba who is a friend of Lakpa was nice. The lodges were basic but rooms were clean and absolutely ok. The food on the trek and in the chosen lodges was good. I would book again with them !

3 high passes and EBC trek. My daughter and I used Nepal Social Treks for our Nepal Himalayan trek in March 2016. We were completely satisfied with every aspect of their service. We choose to do the 3 high passes (and Everest Base Camp) 20 day trek. It was physically challenging but well worth the effort. Our Guide (Narish) and porter (Tek) we friendly, encouraging and knowledgable. We could not have asked for better people to be with us on our journey. The booking process (which I did from Australia), our airport transfers, accommodation and departure arrangements were all well attended to. The down jackets and sleeping bags supplied by Nepal Social Treks were of excellent quality and all we needed to stay warm. We thank Ram, his lovely wife S, and the team at Nepal Social Treks for delivering on the promise of a most wonderful experience trekking in the Himalayas. I am happy and confident in recommending Nepal Social Treks. Anthony J.

Trek to Everest base camp . Our family just finished the Everest base camp trek with the Nepal social treks and expedition organization and could not have been more pleased with our experience. My husband, 13 year old daughter and myself completed the trek with the excellent support and service of our guide (Achut) and porter (Kalu). Combined these gentlemen had 36 years of experience trekking in the Himalayas and it really was evident. Everything from logistics, food, accommodation, etc. were executed perfectly. Given their advice and support, we completed the trek and Kala Pattar summit without any illness, injury and most importantly no altitude sickness. This far exceeded our expectation particularly for a developing country and the intense, difficult terrain. Our wonderful experience would not have been possible without their incredible support. The extra touches ( including several kilos of fresh fruit carried by our guide ) and customizations for the strength and skill of our individual family members really made for a great experience .I also want to mention the office staff. In particular Ram and Sakarya who made us feel welcome before, during and at the completion of our trip. They did a great job matching our family with the appropriate guide. In addition, The river rafting trip and visit to a local school are cherished memories also made possible by the office. We also appreciated both the welcome and departure dinners with other travelers. I would highly recommend this organization and look forward to the day we can return to this wonderful country.

Fantastic Adventure in Nepal. The trek was beautiful and fulfilling. The best part was our guide. He was friendly and helpful, even to those in our group who had never trekked before. After one small payment, we had meals, boarding, and three days of adventure covered. After the trekking, we were given a tour of Kathmandu! Would rate 10/10!

3 days of trekking in Kathmandu Valley. We were a group of 5 girls and it was our first time in Nepal. We were very concerned about the situation and safety in the country, especially after earthquake. We found this company and did trekking for three days. First of all, they answer all emails&questions very quickly. Our trekking guide Ram was amazing and he waited for us patiently every time we wanted to have a break (one break in every 5 minutes -first time trekking as well-). On our last day in Nepal, we stayed in Kathmandu city center, Nepal Social Treks showed us around (they even helped by bargaining while we were shopping). All I can say that they are amazing, I did every single minute I spend in Nepal. Thank you Sajana&Ram. We love you.

Wonderful experience. At the last minute my friend and I put together a trek to Nepal social treks to Annapurna base camp. We had an amazing trek, many thanks to our guide, Achuw and our porter Kassob. We also had s great excursion to Bhaktapuri with a very helpful guide.

Great cultural experience!. After the earthquake that shook Nepal in April and May 2015, Nepal Social initiated a package tour "Rebuild Nepal". It didn't take me a minute to decide that it was exactly what I wanted to do to help this amazing country and its people. My mum and sister joined the adventure. The more we are, the more we can do! We then got in touch with Ram and Basu who were very friendly and organised it all for us. Once in Katmandu we met with the team and arranged the last details to make sure all we meet our expectations and the aim of the trip. We had a wonderful experience living in our guide (KB)'s village. We got to meet the community and even if communication could be hard (with us not speaking nepali) it always felt authentic and friendly. We helped rebuild the school where village kids go to and distributed the goods we had collected prior to our trip. We also did a small trek to get a glimpse of the nepali mountain wonders (the annapurnas).Our experience was complete and genuine. We enjoyed every moment of it and would like to thank again the team who made it all possible: Ram, Basu, Sajana and KB (and all of the members of Nepal Social).I would recommand it to anyone who wants to experience Nepal.

Wonderful Experience, Great People. We booked NST to plan our 10 day family holiday. We were 7 people ages 6 to 66. They put together a wonderful itinerary and made sure were were taken care of all along the way. They were exceptionally lovely people down to the very last--and I think we met most of the staff by the time it was all over. Overall I feel it was good value for money and I have exceptionally fond memories of all the guides we had along the way.I VERY MUCH want to give them 5 circles just because they're all so lovely, but I save 5s for perfection, and we had several small issues along the way--all of which were dealt with professionally and quickly. We were unhappy with 2 of the hotels they booked for us. That said, when we voiced our concerns, they booked us in new and BETTER hotels right away. When originally booking our tour, we had some communication issues and ended up 2 nights short on our itinerary. They bent over backward to fix this issue, and the last 2 days ended up our favorite days. At one point in the middle of our tour they changed our schedule without asking us first. It ended up a good change, and we were happy, but as a matter of policy it's better to ask people before changing their itinerary. AND NOW for the GOOD things. I really feel they are a wonderful group of very hard working individuals. They organized a wonderful birthday dinner for my father, and were AMAZING with my 2 kids. Recommendations for restaurants were all spot-on and we loved the guides they set us up with. The hotel they booked for us in Chitwan was amazing (and set the bar higher wrt our expectations elsewhere). They arranged for us to visit an orphanage and donate some items. Every staff member we had conversations with was caring and committed to charity work and social improvement. We were one of only a couple families with young children I saw the whole trip, and admittedly when you have young children your requirements for comfort and happiness are different from the foot-loose and fancy free backpacker crowd they normally cater towards. I'll cut them some slack in that regard. I recommend using NST for your vacation, just be very clear about comfort expectations if you're traveling with kids. Don't be afraid to tell them right away if you're not happy. They will do everything they can to fix it.

Everest Base Camp Jan 2016. Looking for a trekking company for EBC? Look no further. These guys are amazing! My daughter and I (age 49 and 17) reached EBC on the 4th Jan 2016. What an amazing journey - not easy mind you. I chose this company early in 2015 from the hundreds on the internet, based on reviews and a small leap of faith. We were not disappointed. I have no negative feedback from our trip. Before we left, I was in regular contact with them and had all my questions answered. From the time of arrival, the entire trip went smoothly and everything was super organized. Our guide Buddhi was very experienced and was able to help with cultural info, health assistance (we did get sick for a while) and really knew how to get us acclimatized so we could make it all the way. We needed a couple of extra days during our trip and this was no problem. Shawn Deep our porter was a top bloke too!! It was a trip of a lifetime, a dream of mine since I was a boy in fact, and I am so grateful to the entire team at Nepal Social Treks and Expeditions that they facilitated bringing my dream into reality. I sincerely thank you and I will be back.

second time visit to Nepal. This is my second time visit to Nepal with Nepal Social Treks, they really did a good job for my first visit at EBC, hence i direct contact them for my second visit to Poonhill and ABC with 11 friends. As usual, they really make our trip organized, and everything is well prepared, My friend are so happy and enjoy on it.

Charity Everest Base Camp Yoga Trek (October 2015). Nepal Social organised everything before, during and after our EBC trek amazingly! We had a wonderful guide and porters and of everyone was well taken care of. There was NOT even one situation were we would have felt insecure on route, high altitude safety and so on. Even during the fuel shortage we got all our transport organized. We even visited the Orphanage (Nepal Orphans Home) Nepal Social works together with and this Charity Yoga Trek was supporting. I'm coming back to Mountain bike and Yoga with Nepal Social in Annapurna in November 2016 :-)

Upper Mustang - a wonderful trip to treasure. I did Upper Mustang trek during the Christmas break. It was an amazing trail with so much Tibetan Buddhism culture substance filled along the way. I had a very good guide Pashan, who made all those long walking days not only tolerable but enjoyable. Greatly appreciated!
Abc amazing. Everything was sorted so well , the trip was seamless. Shout out to Ram for sorting everything. Absolutely amazing.

ABC Trekking. Its a great experience with great tour guides! KB as our tour guide took care of us during our journey. Ram, operation director of the company also spared his time to take care of us, especially when I was hospitalized and was not really fine after the trekking. Its a nice journey with great people!

Everest View Trek. My 16 year old daughter and I just returned from a trek with Nepal Social Treks and I cannot recommend them highly enough. We had a limited number of days to trek and they managed to arrange a perfect itinerary. Ram and Sanjana handled all the logistics perfectly, from designing our itinerary, to picking us up at the airport, gathering the belongings we had left at our volunteer placement, etc. Our guide was well educated about the region and shared many interesting details along the way. Our porter was also courteous and a pleasure to travel with. We hope to have another trip with them soon, when we have more time to spend in Nepal.

EBC trek. Recommended by a friend, Nepal social is very efficient since the first contact and very patient in designing my itinerary as there were many changes on my side. They made a few mistakes in the calculation of the days and about the exact dates of the festival I wanted to attend but corrected after I highlighted the issues. Overall, I appreciate the fact that everything is well customized. I didn't use much of their service while in Kathmandu as I preferred upgrading to a better hotel and wandering around by myself. On the last day they arranged my airport transfer and they showed good attention by coming to my hotel to say goodbye in person. My guide, Lama was amazing, he is very professional and speaks good English. He took good care of me along the way. He's a very honest, reliable and kind person. Overall I would recommend this agency for their fair pricing and friendly service.

special holidays tours and treking nepal. It was a wonderfully organised tour for 11 days through parts of Nepal and provided the opportunity to experience the beauty of the country and its friendly people.The tour operated at a relaxed pace with plenty of free time available to explore ,shop and soak up the atmosphere..Evidence of the earthquake are negligible and should not deter tourists from coming to this fabulous and interesting country

Ghorepani trek. Had a great 1 week trip to Kathmandu, pokhara and a 4 day trek in poonhill. Ram did a great job and Organising all flights, car transfers and hotels. Thanks KB for being an entertaining guide :) - with plenty of tea breaks.

Annapurna Base Camp Trek. From the first contact , this company were efficient & more than helpful.They Couldn't do enough to help & felt very confident every step of the way. The trek itself was amazing,& the guide Aaiwa, tailored the trip for us to get the most from it ( I was with a NZ guy doing the same trek)The guide spoke very good English , certainly knew his way around & made every part of the trip as enjoyable as possible.The porter was amazing , always smiling & always just a few steps behind us. A great team , great company & great trek ! I'd definitely book with these again& can highly recommend you do

Such a shady business. So disappointing. So unprofessional.. Went on a trek with a guide who didn't know where he was going. The route that Ram, the business owner suggested was definitely not for beginners. Considering the fact that the mid-section of the trail was destroyed, I was lucky to come out of it with only a broken ankle. High altitude sickness, hypothermia, leech infestations, you name it. Not sure if I was in more physical or emotional pain, but I'd say it's an equally high amount of both. Nepal Social did not do their research for the area (post-Earthquake trail and weather conditions). No beginner trekkers should be out in the Gosainkunda-Suryakunda Path unless you're a landslide and torrential rain enthusiast, or if you're into traversing mountain sides with no safety gear and with no way of being medically evacuated.After the trek, we were supposed to go on a volunteering program. Ram made all sorts of promises but no surprise, he flaked on us as we waited for him the day he was supposed to pick us up and we had to look for other ways to hand out donations by ourselves. I remember thinking how ridiculous the whole ordeal was and how unbelievably unprofessional Nepal Social Treks conducted their business that no one back home could possibly believe us when we tell them what happened. I hope this will serve to give others an idea of what our experience was like. There are many other more honest and safe trekking companies in Nepal. I wouldn't in a million years consider NST as one of them. My ankle will eventually heal but the trauma and disappointment will stay in my memory for a very long time.

Everest base camp trek. I went to Nepal for the first time and was overwhelmed by the kindness, care and genorosity of the people I met from Nepal Social Treks. My trip happened to fall during the devastating time of the April earthquakes however despite the tradegy I was continually looked after. I then had the privilege to volunteer side by side with the Nepal Socail Trek team to help the victims of the earthquake. Overall my trip was a life changing experience and the team at Nepal Social Treks are now life long friends. I fully recommend this company and look forward to returning again to trek with these great people and bring with me family and friends to experience this wonderful country, culture and its people.

Wonderful!. I did a 15 day trek to Gokyo Ri/Chola Pass and Everest Base Camp with Nepal Social. Basu was kind and easy to work with through the planning. The prices were fair and service was great. Pasang (our guide) was incredible!
Highly recommended for any Nepal travel needs.

Too easy with 2 kids in tow. In March/April my two sons (aged 9&11)and I traveled to Nepal to visit an Orphanage and get involved in some community projects. We were put in contact with the Orphanages travel & tour affiliates and from that moment on our trip was organised with ease. Nepal Social Treks were friendly and knowledgeable. They organised all of our transfers, accommodation, side trips and activities. They are truly great people they are heavily involved with ethical organisations including the orphanages and are now helping rebuild Nepal since the Earthquakes. We built great friendships with many of the staff and still keep in contact on a regular basis! Can't speak highly enough of this company!! Planning a trip up to Base camp next and will be going with Nepal Social Treks!!!!

10 Days trek of Annapurna Trek over Thorong La Pass from 04 Sept 2015. Nepal Social organised the 10 Days Annapurna Panaromic Trek to cross over Thorong La Pass from 04 Sept 2015. This is 2nd time I engaged Nepal Social as they arranged such a memorable & wonderful 12 Days Gokyo Ri (5,360m) Trek in Sept 2012, that I had no reservation to re-engage them this time for the Annapurna Trek. All itineraries and provisions were as per they promised in the quotation. Nepal Social is flexible to changes of itinerary with short notice e.g. changing from 2 Nites in Muktinah to 1 nite each in Muktinah & Pokhara. They also provided me for this trek the same guide that took me to Gokyo Ri in 2012. The guide is very patient, professional, responsible, jovious chap who speak very good English, and ensure I am happy & comfortable with all the tea-house accommodation at each village. All in all, a professional & responsible Trekking agent you can rely upon.It is a pity that there are so few trekkers, due apparently to negative news reporting of earthquake damages in April. The Annapurna/Pokhara are NOT at all damaged by the April earthquake. I hope more trekkers will visit Nepal to help the local villagers, who depend very much on tourism for their livelihood.

Bad - Not all you read here is true. Right at the start, we got the sense that it was going to be terrible. They forgot to pick us up at the airport, and we actually had to call to remind them. They came eventually, but much later. We were promised a decent hotel at Kathmandu based on the itinerary, but it transpired that that hotel was fully booked on the day we arrived. What puzzled me was why didn't they book the hotel for us in advance, because we certainly booked our trip earlier and paid them in advance. Anyway, they checked us into a terrible hotel at the last minute. No apology was given for that as well, since they were pretty much trying to tell us that both hotels were about the same. It's definitely not, just like a two star hotel is different from a four star one. Let's talk about the tours next. Everyday was like a mystery. You really learn to be patient there. When we asked our guide what was going to happen tomorrow and what time to wait etc, their typical response was I'd let you know. And they wouldn't let us know till it was late into the night, because they changed guides for us everyday and each guide wouldn't know what was on tomorrow. Good way to earn more tips for the guides, I get it. At least one driver didn't know where to take us even (because the guide left earlier), and had to rely on us to tell him. We could only hazard a guess, and thank god we were right! Because it meant that the hotel they were meant to book for us was booked! We actually cheered there and then, which pretty much tells you how low our expectations for them were at that point. Ok, now the good about them.
