We heard him out and came in to his office to hear about all the activities available to us without him ever being pushy. He wants his clients happy! He even helped us get local SIM cards.We opted for a 4 day trek to Poon Hill leaving from Pokhara which was a breathtaking experience in both senses of the word. A challenging but rewarding trek! We found his prices reasonable compared to other agencies, especially online quoted prices (don't ever book online!). The average we heard from other people on the trek was between $200-$300 per person with a guide. It should be known however that you could do it without a guide for near half the cost but if you want to use an agency for peace of mind, Krishna's your man. Word of advice: If you do get a guide, meet them first before trekking with them so you get a feel for each other. Overall, Krishna and his friendly team go above and beyond to make sure you're happy and I would not hesitate to recommend this company to my friends and family and have already done so.

Super. Krishna was the first person I met in KTM after leaving my hotel.for a little walk. I had no plan what to do and where to go so I was lucky cause Ammonite A & T suggested what I can do there and arranged trips for me. I have no reasons to complain, everything was great. I always felt welcomed in their office. Next time when I come to Nepal I wanna go with this company for a trekking and I really can't wait for that! All the best for Ammonite crew and see u soon

Recommendation. It was my first time that I have booked a guided trekking tour in Nepal. I have been in Nepal three times before always as an individial trekker on different long treks. The whole team took care about everything before, during and after trekking. Me and my guide Santosh went to Annapurna Base Camp faster than expected because of my trekking experience we changed the trekking schedule a little bit and decided day by day if we stay or walk further depending of feelings, altitude, distance and weather.So it was a quit good journey. I can just recommend the Ammonite team. Friendly, nice and cool guys. Regards from Germany!

10/10 would recommend Mr Pasang and Krishna . When Krishna approached us on the street we thought he was just going to be another "rip off" but we couldn't have been more wrong, It was an absolute pleasure dealing with Krishna. He was both fair and flexible in what we wanted and everything we asked for was promised. We did the 6 day hike (ghorepani) with Mr Pasang and he went at our pace (which is slow) he also looked out for us above what was expected and on a side note was a great cook. He is very lovely and has years of experience.

Surpassed Expectations: 18 Day Trek EBC and Gokyo. Working in travel and tourism myself in Australia, I wanted to ensure the money I spent on a trek stayed within the local economy, but also that I was getting good value for money.In Thamel, there are a lot of options which we looked at, however the most informative, reasonably priced and the best service we received was from Ammonite and in particular Krishna.After discussing the trip, the guide, the extra costs in great detail my girlfriend and I felt more than comfortable booking the trip with Krishna.The itinerary included flights, insurance and porter/guide...With flights to Lukla often being cancelled he rearranged the flights and communicated with our porter/guide Prakash.Prakash is a legend. Informative, helpful, selfless, funny... and has some amazing stories to tell. Everything you could possibly ask for in a porter guide. If you can try and arrange Krishna to hook you up with him.At the end of our trek when we were more than satisfied customers, they picked us up from the airport to welcome us back.Ammonite, may not look the most stylish agency in Thamel, but it definitely has the substance and offered a great trip.I will be recommending my personal friends to this agency.

Great deal with Krishna and Pasang. Through Ammonite Adventures we went on a 6 day trek through the Anapurna area. Our guide, Mr Pasang , was funny, extremely helpful, and a great cook. We took our time each day, took plenty of photos and never got lost. We were seriously contemplating doing the trek by ourselves but are not disappointed that we booked through Krishna in the end, a very charming person. He also organised a day white water rafting was exhilarating, just be expectant of a fairly decent amount of time spent on the bus.Thank you for the (Ammonite) adventure.

Excellent service. I met Krishna on the streets of Thamel, in the days before i want to start with the Annapurna Circuit Trekking. Friendly and helpful gived he information and an offer with guide, accommodation, food, transport. The guide has guided me perfectly, takes care of all the things on trekking. All i had to do was to enjoy durance the trekking! Without this guide it would be very different to do this trekking. Even tourist, with or without guide, on the track where jealous to mine guide.After the trekking Krishna also arranged a tour to Chitwan. Good location to stay, transportation was organized well and nice trips near Chitwan. With a real jungle walk, not a tourist path. Seen a lot of wild animals durance this trip.At the end I asked them also to organise a little bit sightseeing near Kathmandu. It makes the trip complete.All was for good prices and with excellent service from the guys of the travel agency. I compared the prices with other travellers on the trekking and Chitwan. The prices are fair.Definitely I recommend Ammonite to other tourists!
23 day trek to EBC. Had a guide that spoke good English and took good care of me. Always stayed in nice teahouses and the guide adapted the hike to my fysical strenght.

Good experience . Did the 16 days Annapurna with Krishna and his company. Got a good price for the trekking compared to others and got a really good guide I'm happy to, since I could Compare with others I met on the trekk. The prize was pretty good and he fixed a taxi to the airport for my departure aswell as a free night in their guesthouse which was a nice room with fan and att. Bathroom. Overall a nice experience!

Uncomplicate and friendly . I met Krishna in front of his office and he offered exactly what I was searching for. The guide, the permits and anything else was organized by his staff. It is always possible to just take a break in the office and chill. He also helped me later by shopping some souvenirs. The whole company really wants you to have a perfect vacation. Next time in Nepal, Krishna is the first, I am going to visit.

High price for low value. I cannot share the positive opinion of the other reviews about Ammonite here on tripadvisor. Krishna from the office was very friendly and explained the trek and the alternatives well, showing it all on a decent map where I could see what he was talking about.But the price was totally intransparent. I still have no idea about how much money the guide and the porter got, how much money was planned for lodges / food and how much money stayed at the agency.But the worst part of the trek was the guide himself who spoke very bad English. This made it impossible to have a nice conversation, and plenty of my questions about culture and religion remained unanswered (which was one of my main reasons to take a guide). And whatever I explained to him about me or my homecountry, he didn't understand.He also told me everyday that I was a slow walker, that I had no idea of mountains / hiking and that he was bored by doing this trek.Further on, I had been told at the office that "the food is all included". Yet that only meant one choice per meal without any little extra (eg an additional boiled egg for breakfast or an additional soup for dinner). In addition to that, my guide tried to convince me for some cheaper food all the time, because he could keep the money that was left over at the end. That was really annoying.But not all of it was negative. Despite all the things I didn't like about the guide, his behaviour towards me was usually friendly and he always paid attention that I would not leave anything behind (eg my camera). He also organised some rooms for me with a great view and he regularly asked me if I was fine. And the porter was a very nice guy.After all, I had high expectations in this trek because of the high price and the great promises made by Krishna of the office. But I'm disappointed now for all the reasons mentioned above and if I come back to Nepal, I definitely will not book with Ammonite again.So if you really want to book a trek through an agency, then look around in Kathmandu / Thamel. As I now know there are agencies whose price is 25% lower than Ammonite's price for exactly the same tour!Or instead do a trip all on your own without a guide, which means more fun, more freedom and also a lot of money to save. Especially for the main treks you don't need a guide to show you the way, and then you don't have to bother with an annoying guide (but there surely are nice guides, too!).

Incomparable . I would have been lost without Krishna and Rajesh, and fear thinking what would have happened to me if they hadn't found me.I had been hunting for a trekking company the day I arrived in Kathmandu, comparing prices, crunching numbers, wondering if I could afford a guide. I was travelling alone and wanted to get to Everest Base Camp (solo travelers PLEASE hire a guide, it's dangerous to attempt E. B. C. alone) when Rajesh grabbed me off the street asking if I needed a trekking company. He brought me into their office and I was greeted by Krishna who soon became like my older Nepalese brother. Charming, humorous, and the guy who can make anything happen (weather permitting). I was short on time and wanted to leave for my trek the next day. All other companies said I could leave in two or three days, but Krishna said I could leave the next day, and for the best price I'd seen in any other trekking company I'd found. Guide, food, flight, paperwork, accommodation, guide health insurance, abd transport to and from the airport. It was an easy sale. They even let me store my non-trekking stuff in their office. Sadly my flight was canceled the next day and they rebooked it for me with a promise if it was canceled again he would make sure I made it to the mountain that day. Fast forward ten days later, I made the flight, got to Everest Base Camp and was so sick from altitude sickness they got me a helicopter down from the mountain to Kathmandu, got me into a wonderful hospital, and Krishna personal met me as the ambulance pulled in. I've travelled quite a bit, tried a lot of services, but never have I ever felt so much like family. They were truly wonderful and I'm so grateful to Krishna and Rajesh for looking after me. Thank you so much! I will never forget this.

EBC trek via Gokyo, from jiri. I and two others did the EBC trek (30 days for us) with ammonite and would gladly recommend it to anyone. Our guide Prakash was great and always singing and he even got us off the tourists path to go to his hometown where we got to eat hundreds of potatoes with his relatives. Great experience! Prices were quite good and there were no misunderstandings whatsoever about the price and the arrangements. Go for it!

Little mountain trip. I had a very nice, little, 4 day trip through the mountains around Kathmandu. Beautiful views, cozy gasthouses, nice people and wunderfull mountain villages. The trip was taxing but really worth it. It was my first trip in nepal and thanks to my professional and helpfull guide everything went without a problem.

Annapurna Base camp. Had a great trek to ABC and Poon hill. It was a amazing experience en really worth it! The price i got was very good from ammonite and a big thank you to my guide Sunil who was absolutely great!

Everest Basecamp and City Tour Kathmandu. The owner is very friendly and arranged for us the everest basecamp trek for a very good prize. Everything is well organized. We also got a city tour through Kathmandu City which was really nice. I would recommend this organization for sure!

Everest Base Camp and Gokyo - Excellent trek with experienced guide and for a very reasonable price. We had an amazing 16 days trek through the beautiful landscapes of Himalaya to Everest Base Camp, and from there to Gokyo via Cho La Pas.Our guide, Bikram, spoke good English, and was very experienced and knowledgeable about the areas we trekked through and about trekking in general.Everything was organised through Ammonite, which is a small office in Thamel, Kathmandu, that organises all kind of trips from 1-day sightseeing to trekking to climbing as well as ticketing etc.We got to learn about Ammonite as we were approached by Mr. Rajesh (one of the owners), who promised us that he could arrange a trek to Everest Basecamp for a very good price. We were of course a little sceptical in the beginning, but Ammonite turned out to be run by a dozen or so of some of the nicest people I've met while travelling (they even bought me a birthday cake and celebrated my birthday in the office prior to our trekking!). They organised a 16-days trek to EBC via Gokyo including flight to Lukla, meals, guide, porter, accommodation and pick-up from our guest house for a very, very good price. Mr Krishna (the other owner) even promised us that if we could find a similar trip for the same price, we would get the trip for free.The trip turned out to be perfectly organised, we had absolutely no trouble, and it is worth mentioning that Ammonite is a responsible company that provides their guides and porters with a descent salary as well as rescue and medical insurance (a very important point in my opinion). I will definitely use Ammonite again if (or rather when) I go back to Nepal as well as recommend it to anyone who's looking for an unforgettable experience.

Awesome trek!. Last 2 weeks my girlfriend and I did the Everest Basecamp Trek, this was for me one of the best experience during my 9 months of traveling. We'd a tight schedule to arrange everything for the trek and we asked multiple travel agencies. When we were walking from one agency to an other we met Krishna, he invited us for a cup of tea and offered us a package for the trek. In the beginning we were a bit suspicious because the price was way cheaper, but we decided to book our trek at Ammonite. The next morning the taxi was perfectly on time (this was one of my concerns) and the trek was just amazing. During our trek Krishna even called us to ask if everything was OK. I would definitely recommend to book your trekking at Ammonite.

Great personalised trek. Ja the owner is a great guy. He told us what we could fit into our tight schedule (4 days) and we trusted him. Our guide Suresh for the trip was very accommodating. My travel partner was ill on the first day and he adapted out travel schedule accordingly. I'd recommend our trip summiting poon hill to everyone. It was tough on day 2 and 3 but you don't want to say you've hiked in the Himalayas and it be a walk in the park. Trust ammonite. The owner, staff and guides are great people and great it really is a company. They even bought us a souvenir afterwards when we returned. I'll be returning to Nepal soon for some more trekking and I'll be using ammonite to organise my itinerary for the full Annapurna circuit when I do.Peace out trekkers.

Amazing Trip. I had a really amazing trip to Nepal in last December 2015, it started when we met Rajesh in Thamel, you took us to Ammonite Adenture agency, and we met Krishna who i'd like to call "The Guy who knows a guy that knows another guy", he has numerous connections that helped to arrange our trip and many other trips we saw him arranging when were visiting his office.We just told him three words "Rafting, Chitwan, Trekking".Then next day in the morning, we took the tourist bus out of Kathmandu, then got of beside Tirshuli River to start rafting with Bishal Sunar, a very nice and modest guy. and we had a very good experience in rafting although it was our first time and we stayed in a good hotel for the night.Next day we went to Chitwan National Park, which was a nice experience riding canoe in the mist between crocodiles, walking into the jungle, riding elephant into the jungle again, and watching cultural dances in the town theater.Then we left Chitwan with our good memories to Pokhara to meet our super nice super honest guide Santosh Paryir, whom we loved to Trek with for 4 days.Trekking was a real fun to me were we walked Nayapool-Ulleri-Ghoripani-Tadapani-Ghandruk then back to Nayapool.Weather was so cold, but we enjoyed the Trek so much and we wished to have the full Annapurna base camp trek, but I think it will be in our next visit in Nepal and with Ammonite Adventure.When we arrived back to Kathmandu, we decided to have another trek in Kathmandu valley so we asked Krishna again to arrange something for us and he did.We had 3-days/2-night trek to Sundrijal-Chisopani-Nagarkot-Dhulikhel and Old heritage city Panauti and Newar people neighborhood, this was with Suneel, the calm and energetic guide guide who showed us his own home town Panauti.I'd really recommend this agency for your next trip in Nepal. we had a really good price and the trip really worth it.

Incredible. Myself and 3 other friends just did the Poon Hill trek for 4 nights and 5 days. Not only did we see some amazing mountains and sights but had incredible cuisine and also lovely, warm welcome accommodation each night at different guesthouses. Our guide & Sherpa Pasang was the nicest, most knowledgeable and kind person we could have hoped for on this trek. He was great at letting us go at out own pace and very, very chill. If you travel with this company I highly recommend him! Incredible.
Annapurna tour. I appreciated a lot Ammonite for our amazing Annapurna tour. I recommend this agency for everything you need. I had wide availability and kidness. Thank you Krishna!See you again!!

Nepal Tours. I'd like to recommend my friend and best Nepali bro Mr. Krishna, he's a very honest guy, friendly and knows everybody in Nepal.Krishna got the best tours and will hook you up with the best prices according to your wallet and needs, he's very flexible and he do what he says and promises.What ever you need Krishna will support you and make it happen.I did water rafting in Trishuli with a very capable and amazing rafting guide 'Bishal', where i stayed in a fantastic place called 'River Fun', went to Chitwan and stayed at River side Resort a very beautiful place, they got 'Krishna' also a very good guide who knows his way around Chitwan open Zoo and they got 'Bhounan' the best cook and a very sweet guy.Also, I did Trekking to Uleri, Ghorepani, Tadapani, Poon Hill and Gandruk with my very sweet friend and bro 'SanTos' the best Trekking guide ever.Finally, I did another Trek to Chisipani and Gurapani, then went to the Newari old city and then visited the Old Heritage city and old city of more than 2000 years of history with my friend and good guide 'Sunil'I'd like to recommend Ammonite for those going to Nepal, Nepal is a very beautiful place for those who seek Adventure, new activity and looking to know a different culture and learn about a very old part of history.

9 days activities in Nepal. We had 9 days activities organised by Ammonite and they were the best in Nepal that made our stay , They were really fantastic and always memorableWe have been doing water rafting with Bishal who was super clever and funnyAfter that we went to chitwan for jungle safari and and a guy called krishna there was so respectful then we met our trekking guide Santosh in Pukhara who was very friendly funny helpful and really adorable guy , he is like a brother and after that i would like to thank the boss Krishna for organising everything and asigning all those good men to help us outAlso j eould like go mention Rajesh who took us to Ammonite office as we didnt know the agency before talking to himThanks all , May Allah bless youI strongly recommend this trip to all of who is interested in these kind of thingsAlso the price was well deserved Hope my friends and I can do this trip again in the future

Rafting + Chitwan + Pokhara. Met Krishna before I went off trekking through the Everest Region (I went alone so didn't use their services) but upon returning had an extra week until I flew out of Kathmandu. So I went into their shop in Thamel and spoke to Rajesh as well as Krishna again and they quickly organised a 5 day tour including rafting, safari in Chitwan, and paragliding in Pokhara as well as my accommodation and transport and all to leave the following day. Had a great trip and found Rajesh and Krishna very friendly and helpful.

Poon Hill, Ghorepani Trek - Spectacular. We met Krishna in Thamel whilst deciding which Trekking company to go with and found Krishna to be most honest, helpful and very encouraging and engaging. We decided on the 4/5 day trek to Ghorepani to see the mountains on Poon Hill at Sunrise which was spectacular and a once in a life time experience. It was worth the early morning wake up, sore legs and feet and long walks. Starting in Pokhara the next day meeting with our lovely Guide Passang who was very friendly and informative and worth the trip just to have his company was comforting. Passang made sure we were always comfortable, walking at a good slow pace to keep our energy and he ordered our food for us as well as the occasional special treat like Buffalo chilli yum yum. He also provided fresh cut fruit every night or morning as a treat for us which was lovely. Our accommodation was very comfortable with hot water, wifi and warm beds every night.We also asked Passang if we could head to the hot springs as we really wanted to go and he helped alter there itinerary to accommodate our request which was well worth it!!! We would highly recommend Ammonite Adventure Tours and would definitely use them again when we return in the future.
Tour Pokhara, rafting, paragliding, chitwan safari . All was amazing! Rajesh was incredible, he really take care of us all the time. 100% happy about all!!!

Good trek!!. A six-day trek really beautiful! really well framed. It is accessible to all and once arrived at the top, you will take full eyes!The sunrise over the chain of anapurna leave you speechless so beautiful! The Katmandu ammomite agency headed by Krishna is really safe and competent!Everything is covered in the price and that's a plus. The Bishal carriers and Kamal and our guide San tosh have made us discover the environts and we have a good laugh! The lodges where we slept were clean and warm!An experience we will never forget!Yann

Great trek!. We have spent 3 days in the mountains near Kathmandu. We had a great time in Shivapuri, Nagarkot!Rajesh was very helpful to choose our trek. Birkha was a great guide, ask for him ! A great local experience

Everest Trekking. I made a 15 day hike starting from Lukla going up higher than 5000m organized by Ammonite. The guide was very experienced and I had a lot of fun. The weather was great and I could see few 8000m mountains. I really enjoyed the trip.

10 day trek, ABC. My girlfriend and I met Krishna on the street in Thamel, we went back to his office and decided on a ten day trek to Annapurna base camp. Krishna handled our flights to and from Pokhara and when we arrived at the airport in pokhara our guide, Pasang Sherpa, was waiting to take us to our hotel, which was very nice. On our first day in Pokhara we trekked to the top of Sarangkot, just to get the lead out of our muscles, the view was amazing. Our trek to Abc started from nayapul and then to ulleri, ghorepani, tadapani, shinuwa, duerali, and then to Annapurna base camp, we traveled back down and spent a night in bamboo before reaching the hot springs in jhinu. Along the way our guide stopped to explain many things to us, flowers and plants, local customs and agricultural techniques as well as the certain religious significances each place held. Our guide, Pasang, was extremely friendly and very knowledgeable. The pace was very slow and steady, quite safe. I would urge you to pack as little as possible, basic toiletries, one set of clothes for hiking and one for sleeping, and some warm stuff, you won't need more.

Awesome first trekking experience (Poon Hill). My friend and I (two 23-year old girls) went on the Poon Hill trek with Rajan. It was such a memorable experience!I walked in to Krishna while shopping in Thamel. He guided me to his office and we went over some trekkings. I wasn't sure yet which trekking I wanted and I asked him to call me two weeks later, since I was busy with volunteer work at the time. He did as I asked, and after checking with some other companies, Ammonite looked like the best option, since it was a more personal approach and we got a fair price.We were invited to the office to go over the trek once more, and later that week we could meet our tour guide, Rajan. He would come with us to Pokhara by tourist bus. Everytime we went to the office, everyone there was really friendly, and although we joked around a lot, it stayed very professional.Rajan was a great guide. From the morning in Kathmandu when we took the bus, up untill the moment he helped us find a taxi to go back home, he was both friendly and professional. During the trekking he carried our stuff (we probably took too much, but he didn't complain) and gave us information about the places, the culture, and most importantly, the mountains. He made us feel safe during the trek at all time. He stayed behind us most of the time, so he could always be sure that we were allright, and we didn't feel rushed at all. When we were tired, we could rest if we wanted to. Looking at other trekking parties during the trek, we felt like we had the best guide of them all!You start off with a guide you barely know, and you leave as friends! And a great trekking experience of course!

Amazing Experience. I met Krishna Bahadur 2 days prior to leaving on a trek to Everest Base Camp. Unfortunately i fell ill on EBC trek and had to return to Kathmandu on the 5th day. I seen Krishna in Thamel again and being impressed by our initial conversation he provided information on some shorter treks that would align with my partner returning from EBC. Krishna suggested I trek the Annapurna circuit with the high point being Poon Hill at 3200m and being able to view 2 peaks over 8000m, Annapurna 1 and Dhaulagiri. The trek was 4 days starting in Pokhara bussing to Nayapul then walking to Ulleri. Ulleri to Ghorepani. At Ghorepani we woke early and watched the sunrise at Poon Hill. The weather was spectacular. Perfect views of Annapurna and Dhaulagiri and other beautiful mtns. We than walked Ghorepani to Ghandruk. Ghandruk back to the bus stop and way back to Pokhara.My guide Pasang Sherpa was nothing short of excellent. He made sure I had enough water, plenty of rest breaks, always made sure i was comfortable, extremely knowledgeable of the mountains, culture and of course, trekking. He even cut up fruit every night to have after my evening meal! The accommodation was very comfortable with hot water, wifi and warm beds every night. I enjoyed the food greatly. I couldnt help but choose the chicken pizza 3 times! Over all Ammonite is a professional well priced company and I highly recommend their services.

EBC Trek - Ask for Pemba (Guide) and Kumar (Porter). I went on the EBC trek with Ammonite. I had a great experience. I cannot speak for all the guides and porters as this is where an experience can go from bust to greatness, but I can speak on Pemba and Kumar. They made our trip amazing. Here are the reasons why you should ask for Pemba and Kumar:1. I have never seen both of them without a smile.2. Pemba would always walk on the unsafe side protecting his clients from anything bad from happening. He always had safety on his mind. He also knows where there can be rock and land slides and would always stop us before, explain, and then we would cruise through the dangerous areas.3. The service was top notch. Anything we wanted, he would not hesitate to get. 4. Kumar, the porter, was never out drinking or misbehaving. I saw some porters who were not reliable and thus your bags and belonging may not be traveling right with you.5. He actually cared, yes it was a job for him, but you an see he really loves it and is excited for you to have a good time. He saw him on the cliff ledge waiting to make sure our plane came and we boarded safely. It as nice to give him one last final wave before boarding the plane.Thus, in conclusion. If you hike with Ammonite, ask for Pemba and Kumar. You will not be disappointed.

Great Trekking Experience!. I have no complaints. I walked into the office after checking prices at a few places for the Poon Hill trek (4 days) and the guys in the office were friendly and fairly priced. They helped me book a guide, transportation, and get the required licenses. I was a bit nervous being a not super athletic solo female, but my guide Santosh was great! He helped me through the whole process and was a joy to be around for four days (even made the steep climb day two a little more bare able!) He really went out of his way to make sure I had what I needed and was comfortable at the tea houses and even played flute sometimes during the trek! : ) I had a fantastic time trekking, meeting fellow travelers and guides along the way, and spending time in Nepal. Hoping to come back soon!

Incredible trip - the best!. Me and two of my friends went and did a 19 day annapurna circuit trek with ammonite tours. It was one of the most amazing things I have ever done. Our guides Rai and Jerry were the absolute best!! They both went out of their way to make us feel comfortable, safe and we always felt like we were in the very best of hands. Rai was so wise and Jerry was such a laugh and made the trip extremely fun. The scenery on this trek was so spectacular and all the guest houses were very comfortable that we stayed in with the most delicious food.I would most DEFINITELY recommend this tour company (Ammonite Adventure) to anyone who ever came to Nepal - don't use anyone else!!

Great Trekking all round!. This was a fantastic trek from the start. Our trip was well co-ordinated from the beginning. Crishna gave us a great experience and the lodges we stayed in were homely and clean. The day by day trek was safe and we acclimatized well during our off days.  I would highly recommend 'Ammonite adventures' as our group of three had a brilliant time.*****

Excellent trekking to Everest Base Camp. Very reasonable prices for all inclusive Himalayan trekking to Everst base camp. Very professional and the owner was always at the end of the phone when we needed him to be. They sorted out all the paperwork and the logistics including transport to airport. Extremely helpful and friendly staff.

nice trek!. Had a great trek arranged by Krishna at Ammonite, who I met on the street in Thamel. Although wary of course about just randomly choosing a trek company, Krishna's arrangements were comparable to other groups I had spoken with in both price and expectation. He was very low pressure and accommodating, which led me to feel at ease.I ended up trekking from Lukla to Namche Bazaar with a guy I met in Lukla, Laxman. The trek went well and I couldn't have been happier. Thanks for the good experience!

4 days trekking around Annapurna (Amazing experience). I did a trekking for 4 days from Nayapul to Ghandruk. It was really a great trip in so many ways. The nature and all the people I met was so wonderful. My guide was very kind and helpful. I felt so safe with him. Most times we walked in silence and just listened to the nature, birds singing, sound of the rivers and the monkeys in the trees e.t.c. I will never forget these days. I can definetly recommend my guide (Krishna) and Ammonite. So nice people working here! Thank you so much for this opportunity!!!

Lantang Trekk - Friendly people. Yet another amazing experience! This is my second trek with the same agency and i'm once again very satisfied. Thanks to my guide's knowledge of the trail, i could get deeply in touch with the very welcoming and friendly Tamang people. A heartwarming experience.That is why i once again would like to recommend this agency above all others: Krishna and his team are always professional and, even more important, very friendly. If you get the chance to be in Kathmandu and planning to go for some adventure in Nepal, well, you should definitely pay them a visit in Thamel. :)

Very nice people, helped us and informed us really well!. First of all, they are cheap but that doesnt bring down the service. When we told them my girlfriend left her jacket at the hotel, they made sure it was back the next day! Very good price/quality, we had a great time!

Katmundu to Pokhra amazing tour. This is first time Nepal trip for us.there have a lots of good people and travel agency.i got this type agency which name is ammonite travel.they have chance to visit Kathmandu to Pokhara with all sight seen that was very low price and good service.if anyone we love visit Nepal i will re commend this company.

Fun times funny guide. My friend josie and I had a really lovely time with our energetic, funny guide Santos. We spent our days trekking the beautiful Gorepani/Poon hill trek. Got a lot of exercise. Stayed in lovely guest houses. There was even some Nepali dancing involved! Santos was very helpful and had a great sense of humor. He also was more than happy to help teach me the Nepali Language. Would definitely recommend. Cheers!

Friendly and professional service. My boyfriend and I booked a 16 day trek to Gokyo Lakes, Chola Pass and Everest Base Camp with Ammonite. We had originally planned to trek on our own as my boyfriend had done the trip 10 years ago. However, when we weighed our backpacks in our hotel room in Kathmandu, we made a last-minute decision to get a porter. The choice of tour companies in Thamel was overwhelming but we were won over by Krishna's friendliness, professionalism and expertise. We had already planned our itinerary and he was not at all pushy about changing it, unlike some other companies. He made us a cup of masala tea in his office then simply made a phonecall and organised for a porter to meet us at Lukla airport the next day! Our porter (Kancha Lama) was outstanding. He was a very generous man with a good sense of humour. He told us the names of all the mountains and taught us about Nepali culture and a few words (the most useful phrase was "please go slowly" - "bistali bistali"!). He chose some excellent teahouses and always checked that we were happy with our rooms. He was a very experienced porter and knew the routes well, which was reassuring as even though we had our own maps, there were a couple of tricky sections, such as crossing the morraine from Gokyo to Thangnag. I did one section of the trip on my own (Lobuche to Everest Base Camp) with Kancha Lama and felt perfectly comfortable doing this as a single female. Overall, we had an amazing time in the mountains and based on our experience, we would recommend Ammonite.

Very negative experience. My boyfriend and I visited Shivapuri National Park from Kathmandu with this travel company and we could not have made a worse choice. Our "guide" was an 18 year old kid who had never been to the park before and knew absolutely nothing about the trek, including the way (i.e. one hour into the trek he told us the trek was over and it was not until asking around that we figured out that there were still 2 hours left in the trek)! At the end of our trek, our private cab that we paid for was not waiting for us and 45 minutes later we ended up having to take a private cab back to our hotel. Upon arriving back at our hotel we tried to explain the situation to Mr. Krishna Bahadur, who, despite the extremely poor service still demanded full payment. The guide who was with us at the hotel even had the nerve to demand a tip after basically not doing his job for the entire day. I would never recommend this company to anyone. Also FYI for those interested in this trek, a guide and travel company which charges around 100 USD is not necessary for this trip and can easily be done alone for about 30 USD.

good for when on a budget. A friend and I did a trek to langtang national park with Ammonite on a rather tight schedule.Our guide 'ram' was very flexible and let us make the calls on where we wanted to go that day. He took care of us really well, making sure we were ok regularly.All in all good value for money.

Gandruk trekking. I was supposed to go ABC, But there were too many snow there, so my guide and me changed the plan. Guide 'Pasang' was very friendly and nice person and taught me lots of Nepali language, culture, information about mountain and food as well. He took care of me a lot especially when I felt tired or had fast breathe. Even night time he checked my room is ok, safe, not cold and enough blanket. I got a cold during my trip because I was not used to winter weather in Nepal, So he recommend me many folk remedy such as gargling with warm salt water, drinking hot lemon ginger tea with honey. Also he helped to find good price accommodation for my economic condition. Besides, I was a female traveler, I was worrying about the safety problem, I had no problem at all thanks to 'Pasang' Guide. Thanks a lot Ammonite Adventure & Treks! If anyone looking cheep and good service, I'd like to recommend this company.

Lantang trek and ice lakes. I had a very unplanned trip to Nepal and my first day in Nepal I met Anuj Raj who introduced me to Ammonite Adventure and treks. They were all very friendly and knowledgeable about the mountains and different sites around Kathmandu. My guide made me feel completely safe on my trek to keyenging gumpa. My guide helped motivate me to complete the 15 day trek in only 8 days as i was only in Nepal for short amount of time. All in all Ammonite gave me a good trip for a good price. Already planning my next trip to Nepal to complete the Everest base camp trek with Ammonite adventure and treks.

Good value service. Our guide was really good, all the time taking care of everything and making our life easier. The price is one of the cheapest in Kathmandu and I think if you decide to do a trekking trough a company here you can fine a good service for a good price.

Everest Base camp & Gogyo. Did the 16 days Everest Base Camp & Gokyo Lakes trek.The guys at Ammonite were nice and friendly and gave us a very good price. Everything was well organised. Our guide DB and porters: Bir and Santi were great. With these guys I would do the trek again.They also organise our trip to Pakhora inkluding paragliding. Good bus and the paragliding was awsome.I highly recommend Ammonite.

A wonderful experience!. I recently completed the 6 day poonhill trek together with a friend, with ammonite treks. We paid a very fair price for the trip. The company was very friendly and accomodating to all our wants in terms of the intinery. During the trek everything was very well organised and our guide went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable and also having a great time. Overall I couldn't really fault a thing with this company, great value for money, great expriences and great people! I defiantly recommend them!

Friendly & Honest. I booked a 16 day trek to Everest Base Camp and the Gokyo Lakes. Ammonite could not have been easier to work with; what stood out was their friendliness, professionalism, and fair no haggle prices. Our guide DB and porters: Bir and Santi were great. I could not have had a more enjoyable experience with a better group of people. I highly recommend Ammonite and will definitely come back and trek in Nepal soon.

Amazing experience!! . I did the poonhill trek with one other friend and we had an amazing time! The people from ammonite adventure & trecks are really nice and it's a really good price. Everything was well organised! We were glad we did it! If you want to do a trek, this is a really good organisation.

Everest base camp/gokyo lakes. We reviewed 3 companies before deciding to go with ammonite. Ammonite was straightforward and honest with their business. They gave us the best price and were beyond friendly, offering us tea on several occasions. The guide we had, (DB was his name) was exceptional and kind. Our porters worked their butts off and did it with a smile. I enjoyed dealing with ammonite so much that after trekking, I also booked paragliding in pokhara with them. I highly recommend this company!

Amazing!. I couldn't recommend this company enough! We did a 16 day trek to EBC, Chola Pass and Gokyo Lakes with Ammonite and it was incredible!Our guide DB was the best; the perfect level of fun and professionalism, and our porters Bir and Santi were equally as great.We travelled in a group of 6 and Ammonite definitely provided us the best value for money and level of personal service, before, during and after the trip. Attention was paid to our health, safety and comfort at all times, and we were still given autonomy to be flexible with our schedule! Ammonite was amazing, if I were to do any other activities I wouldn't think twice about going through these guys!

Easy, friendly service and competitive price. Everyone at Ammonite was so nice and accommodating. The trek they offered us beat any other one we came across as we shopped around in Thamel. BUY A MILE. and our guide "DB" was a total legend. They're endless contacts around Nepal make anything and everything you want easy and affordable. we did a 16 day trek through Everest Base Camp and Gokyo lakes with a group of 6 friends and managed to leave the next day. best time in Nepal.

Amazing time with Ammonite Adventure and Trecks!. We went on the Annapurna Circuit trek with Ammonite treks and had the best time. The guide and the porters were all very qualified and did an excellent job. My friend and I had ALS when we arrived at High Camp but the guide, Rajesh, helped us through and we succeeded in getting to the top the very next day without pushing us or forcing us. Out of three months of travelling these 16 days of trekking were the best. Everyone in the staff at Ammonite was very nice and helpful.

Mediocre and Ambivalent Experience. My friends and I had just completed a 5-day trek to Poon Hill with Ammonite. We knew that Ammonite was a young company of only two years old, but we were very impressed with the reviews on Tripadvisor, and had heard about Ammonite from our friends. Thus, it was highly unfortunate that our experience was a subpar one, mainly led down due to a highly unprofessional guide, Krishna. Our trekking experience was saved by Suresh and his fellow porters, while Sovit had provided stellar services in Kathmandu itself. I will provide a summary of my group's experiences with them, so that you can make a better judgment on Ammonite.AIRPORT TRANSFER:(i) Kathmandu Airport to HotelAmmonite had promised airport transfer to us. Unfortunately, when we had arrived at the airport, we could not find the sign for Ammonite anywhere. The other tour agencies at the airport were not too helpful either - they had not heard of Ammonite. We had also tried contacting them on their contact number, but it was unfortunately met with a "wrong number" response. Alas, we simply decided to take a cab to their office, hoping that they may be legit.Thankfully, Suresh was sitting in the office and had informed us that Sovit was trying to find us at the airport. There was a miscommunication over the timing (though we had made it clear to them our flight timing via e-mail) and it was highly unfortunate that we had to take a cab down. Nonetheless, when Sovit finally arrived, he apologised profusely over the incident.(ii) Pokhara Hotel to Pokhara Bus BayUnfortunately, for this leg of the transfer, Krishna had informed us that we had to walk from the hotel in Pokhara to the bus bay. It was a good 15-20 minutes walk from the hotel (we knew it because we decided to walk to the International Mountaineering Museum in Pokhara), but Krishna insisted it was only a 5-minute leisurely walk. When we had informed him that the package explicitly stated that "all necessary transport will be covered", he was left without any proper explanation, and tried to dismiss it by saying that we simply need to pay 200 rupees each to get to the tourist bus bay.When we arrived back in Kathmandu, his partner Sovit was surprised by this - as he had passed money to him for the transportation for us between the Pokhara Hotel and the Bus Bay. Thus, please ensure that you carry all your e-mail correspondences with you, as you never know whether all details have been properly communicated to the guides and partners in Ammonite.(iii) Kathmandu Hotel back to the AirportThankfully, the ride from the Kathmandu Hotel back to the Airport was uneventful.ACCOMMODATION:Ammonite had chosen a variety of hotels and guesthouses for us over the trip. Most of them were decent and they do seem to provide value for money. However, it was highly unfortunate that for the hotel that they had chosen for us in Kathmandu, it was mosquito-infested and had no electricity till about 10pm. The only saving grace is that it was located in Thamel - right in the heart of Kathmandu. Thus, if you were to book a trip with Ammonite, please do tell them what are some of the stuffs you would like to avoid in a hotel. Surely a one-star hotel may still be decent enough not to be mosquito-infested.TREKKING + GUIDE EXPERIENCE:On this trip, we were accompanied by Suresh and Krishna to Poon Hill. Poon Hill has often been rated as an easy trek - however, note that we think it may actually be a moderate trek due to the many steep slopes that you may encounter along the way. A good stamina is necessary - so do prepare for it. Your preparation would indeed reward you with an awestruck view of the Annapurna region.On the first day, we found it a rather odd decision by Krishna to rest for the day after two hours of trekking from Naya Pul. He said that it was better to have 7-hour of trekking the next day, and rest for the day instead. While this is our first time trekking, we cannot help but noticed that it was still rather early in the day (mind you, it was 1.30pm), and was horrified at the suggestion that one ought to do 7-hour worth of trekking the next day instead.As a group, we decided to make the decision not to follow Krishna's advice, and carry on trekking instead. This decision proved to be the right one - as it had been a challenging trek up 3000 stairs - and one cannot imagine how painful it would be if the group had to do this flight of 3000 steps, followed by the trek to Ghorepani on Day 2. When we got back to Kathmandu, we had informed Sovit of this rather odd decision - only to be informed that he had also thought it was an odd decision and that Krishna was simply being lazy.On Day 2 of the trek to Ghorepani, Suresh provided excellent commentaries on the various mountains, history of Nepal and current political situations. He demonstrated a high level of trekking competence, as well as knowledge of the trees and jungles. In fact, it was a very enriching cultural exchange that Suresh had provided - and I would always remember this trip for the sincerity and professionalism that Suresh demonstrates. He is a valuable asset to Ammonite.By contrast, Krishna proved to be rather incoherent in the speaking of the English language, and had often interrupted Suresh whenever the latter was speaking. When we had asked Krishna for information about the vegetation in the area, "what type of plant is this?", we were greeted with a shocking response with "this is a plant". We tried to ask him again to ensure that he understood our question well - but again, he greeted us with "this is called a plant". It does not take a first-grader to tell you that a tree is a plant - but unfortunately, Krishna found it fit to provide us with such humiliating response and he had laughed at our question. Instead, he found every opportunity to appear in photographs - so that he can use it for the company's publicity purposes.On Day 3 of the trip, one of my friends had fallen ill and was running a high fever. Krishna and Suresh were alerted to it - and they knew about it as we had decided to take multiple rests along the trip from Poon Hill downwards to Tadapani. Suresh had tried to keep a lookout for my friend as much as possible - and had even accompanied him for most part of this leg of the trip. However, it came to a point when he can no longer carry on walking and needed evacuation.Unfortunately, this is where Ammonite needs to improve on the evacuation plans. We had pleaded with Suresh and Krishna to find the fastest way to evacuate our friend to the next resting place or hospital. Alas a heli-evacuation was not possible as we were in an area that is too low an altitude for helicopters to land. Instead, a pony-evacuation was necessary. Instead of alleviating the situation, however, Krishna decided to shift the blame to everyone else for not informing Suresh or himself about our friend's situation. This was highly unprofessional and disturbing - both guides knew that our friend was already not feeling well, but decided that of all times, when our friend was feeling unwell, finger-pointing was necessary. This made for a very unpleasant trekking experience.When Suresh sensed our rather unmotivated feeling, he encouraged us to carry on with the trek and enjoy the many sights and sounds that Nepal has to offer. This was indeed uplifting - though our hearts and minds were clearly with our friend who was being evacuated at that moment.On Days 4 and 5 of the trek, we experienced the places of Tadapani, Ghandrung and Ghandruk. They were very lovely places to stop and rest, and experience the cultures of the mountain people. Unfortunately, Krishna saw fit to be spending half the time on the trek carrying an umbrella and speaking over his mobile phone. He had chosen to go on a wanderlust of his own - walking far ahead of the group of 8, with Suresh and the back. At some points, our group was lost as to where to head to - as Krishna had walked far too quickly ahead. Certainly this is very unprofessional of a guide - not only to be speaking on the mobile phone for a prolonged period of time, but failing to demonstrate care and concern for his trekking group. Fortunately, Suresh and his porters had provided the directions from the back of the group.Later that night, Krishna (who probably had a drink too much) engaged in a song and dance - and saw it fit to taunt us with some odd songs. We asked Suresh what was he singing about - but Suresh, given his nice nature, refused to translate it for us.Overall, the trekking experience was a very memorable one. To be able to experience the sights and sounds of the mountain people through the perspective of a competent guide was very valuable. Indeed, the Poon Hill trek was itself a stunning beauty - and I would advise anyone to do this trek if they are heading to Nepal. However, Krishna has significantly marred the experience - and it was highly unfortunate that Suresh had to do damage-control for all of the above incidents.POKHARA EXPERIENCEIn Pokhara, we had wanted to arrange for a vehicle to bring us around for the entire day. We had decided to entrust Krishna with this task. He charged us an exorbitant 6000 rupees for the whole day. However, on the actual day itself, the bus driver had informed us that he would only bring us to five selected locations in Pokhara, and it only lasted for three-four hours. We were shocked, as we had paid good money for it.When we had arrived back in Kathmandu, we had informed Sovit about this experience. We were shocked to hear from him that a usual rental costs only 3200 rupees for the entire day - not a sub-par experience of 6000 rupees for a few hours. He had informed us that we may have been fleeced by Krishna.Krishna also saw it fit to be pushy and sell a paragliding package to my friend. While it is perfectly normal for tour guides to push other products, Krishna thought that it would be a good idea to keep pushing the product even though he had already said no.Thus, please do be careful about a possibly dishonest guide - not just with Ammonite, but any travel agency in Nepal.OVERALL:I would think that I would experience the same level of enthusiasm, honesty and professionalism that the many reviews below had suggested. Alas, I am unfortunately ambivalent about it. In some ways, I did experience the magic that the many reviews had suggested - in the form of very competent guides in Suresh and Sovit. The sights and sounds that Nepal offered had also contributed to this memorable experience. However, it was significantly marred by a very unprofessional guide - enough to make me think twice and think seriously the next time I get a cheap tour package from a young travel agent firm. Ammonite has so much going for them - I wish them all the best in trying to indeed, stay honest and trustworthy. Indeed, these virtues had been lost on one particular guide.

Friendly, Supportive, Reponsible. Sovit and Krishna are no ordinary partners for Ammonite. Their previous training as guides in Nepal have provided them with huge amount of knowledge for all the treks and activities in Nepal. While other companies provided me with generic routes to trek EBC and Annapurna Circuit, Sovit and Krishna tailored a specific route with side trails according to my interest. The amount of details and creativity to their plan in addition to offering me a good value convinced me to do two treks in one month with Ammonite. When I was sick after trekking EBC; thereby, delaying the start and end dates for Annapurna Circuit, Sovit and Krishna immediately took care of all the bookings and date changes, making sure I recover first before starting again. For both of my treks, my guide Birkha is extremely knowledgeable and his attention to details, ranging from the weather condition all the way to my meals, are especially appreciated. Overall, an unforgettable experience in Nepal, thanks to Ammonite. Sovit and Krishna have become more than just businessmen, they have become my friends in Nepal! Highly recommended to those who are looking for a company to organize or help plan itinerary in Nepal.

Thumbs up of Ammonite and Co.. I went with a friend and we shopped around Kathmandu for a good deal. Eventually we met Sovit, who presented us with a detailed package that was comprehensive and of good value. Our guide Suresh was cheerful and enthusiastic, and always made sure that we were having a good time.Having been on some outfield trips to the jungle during my time in the Singapore Army, I would say that both the company and the guide have exceeded my expectations and performed their obligations to the best of their ability. Keep it up Sovit, Suresh and Ammonite I will enjoy my memories of trekking in Nepal in the years to come.

Honest.. Trustworthy. My husband and I just came back from a Trek to Namche Bazaar organised by Ammonite.. It was an amazing experience and one we will remember for life.. We will certainly be back to do EBC and when we do.. we will reach out to Krishna for sure.. There are more tour agents in Nepal than you can imagine and it's tough to find people you can trust.. We were struck in Lukla due to bad weather and flights were cancelled for 10-15 days.. Krishna and Sumit did everything in their capacity to help and we truly appreciate that.. Thank you guys.. Stay Honest! :)

Great trip. Helpful team. After going to over 10+ tour companies in Thamel I decided on these guys...I wasn't wrong. They hooked us up with a great guide for EBC trek and took care of all the logistics even when issues popped up. And all at a very competitive price. This company is young but have heaps of potential if they can keep thier enthusiasm up. I would use these guys again and if you are reading this you should go with them.

Highly trustworthy organization. My partner and I have just arrived in mainland China after an awesome trip to Tibet from Kathmandu.We can't fault the guys at Ammonite and hope they remain as enthusiastic and trustworthy as we have found them to be!Tours are never 100% value for money, we've recently taken tours in Mongolia and DPRK and learned to keep our expectations low - this tour was no exception (and to be fair Ammonite will tell you exactly the same - to avoid disapointment keep your expectations of the guide low!): The first night could have been much better in Zhangmu, the breakfasts (included) were very poor, we had to pay extra for heat in the rooms we stayed in (tibet is very cold) and the train fare was twice what it should have been! All of these issues and more were beyond the control of Ammonite and the guide on hand was dismissive of our complaints. Ammonite don't personally arrange the tours and the guide is a cog in the wheel between agencies in Nepal and Tibet so as a customer you have little control.With this in mind and the expense of the tour I don't know if it's possible to get value for money BUT if you really want to travel from Nepal through Tibet these guys will do everything in their power to ensure you get the tour you want and at as reasonable a price as it's possible to find. We had 9 days in Tibet, we saw all that a westerner is allowed to see and the train into China was awesome. I wouldn't do it again but I'm glad I went.The guys at Ammonite really looked after us - even helped us arrange our independent trekking permits without charge, simply the most honest travel agency I have encountered in 12 months travelling Asia!

Too Good to Be True?. My trip was from Thamel to Sundarijal by car, then the trek began there to Chisapani on the first day, then to Nagarkot on the second day, then to Dhulikhel on the third, travelling back by car to Kathmandu. So it was a 3 day 3 night trek, travelling back on the fourth day.I was approached on the street by Krishna and offered a deal and a route that suited my needs but not my budget so after shopping around a bit I found a great deal and bumped into Krishna again on route to pay and he bettered the price and promised the same service.At first, like we all are in Asian countries, I was skeptical but the guys really did come through for me.I was well looked after by my guide Bam who is fun and easy to get along with. We became friends by the end of the trip.Sovit called a few times to check our trip was going well and made sure I was happy with my trip. After explaining I was disappointed by my first accommodation he said I could ask to change rooms or hotels at any point which was comforting.All in all I had a wonderful experience and the guys made sure my needs and budget were met.I would recommend and use them again.

Excellent Everest Experience! . My friends and I came to Nepal for some trekking and adventure and after a quick scout of the Thamel area, opted to go with Souvit, Krishna and the team at Ammonite for the Everest Base Camp Trek. Absolutely everything was organised at an excellent price with very little waiting time before our departure to Lukla. Our guide, Jit, was fantastic and hilarious and our porter Sujan did a great job. There were no hidden agendas and no surprises once we reached the mountains. We got what we asked for and a bit more. Now back in Thamel organising our next trip to Chitwan with the Ammonite boys, all sorted in the space of half an hour. Good luck to a new up and coming company in the area, thanks for a great trek and your continued assistance whilst in Nepal!

Everest Base Camp trekking - Amazing Experience!!. An absolutely incredible trek organised to perfection by the awesome young guys at Ammonite Adventure and Treks - Sovit and Krishna. These young guys have an excellent new business and after doing much thorough research, they are far and away the best-priced and most enthusiastic tour providers in Kathmandu. Their services extended much further than the trek, taking us out for dinner after we returned and helping organise all of our continuing travel plans. This has been one of my greatest experiences and i have Ammonite to thank for it. Highly recommended tour operators and i wish them all the best for the future.

Trekking in Langtang. A great company spearheaded by two young guys who are friendly and keen to organise an experience that will be memorable. We checked around other guiding companies first once we were in Kathmandu to get an idea for value for money. Sovit and Krishna offered both in a non pressured environment with lots of masala teas. They demonstrated practical experience being past guides themselves and can give expert advice on what areas will suit the interests of the client. They also organised a private car to Pokhara for us which was new and they provided an excellent driver who made our trip more exciting by stopping and giving us opportunities to check out local communities. I will use this company again.

Great tour and trek services!. We had the staff organize a day tour with car and guide in Kathmandu and also a 4 day trek around Poon Hill. Staff was very accommodating and even booked out flight from Pokhara to Kathmandu when we decided we did not want to take the bus back. They went above and beyond for us to make sure we were happy and satisfied with our trip. Our guide during the trek was very sweet; he even made us bamboo walking sticks for the trek. At dinner time he made his famous "mustang coffee" a drink made with local apple brandy to replenish us after a long day of hiking. He knew the trails like the back of his hand; he probably could do the whole circuit with his eyes closed! It was really nice having a guide so we did not have to worry about what trail to take or the best places to stay. All the places we stayed at had great views. After 5 hours of hiking uphill you really don’t want to have to worry about anything, you just want to enjoy your surroundings and that’s what Ammonite Adventure Trek did for us. Great sights of Annapurna, local villages, waterfalls, wild life, rice fields, and forests.

Awesome staff!. Was approached on the street by an enthusiastic tour group operator - he was very helpful in arranging a driver for a day tour in Kathmandu for a fantastic price - better than any others I found. I had a great time on the tour - the owner and staff in the Ammonite Adventure office are very welcoming and eager to please. They informed me that they could arrange any type of tour or flights - even treks up the mountains as they are all qualified; had I not already pre-booked with another company, I would have seriously considered this one. They go out of the way helping travellers, and give the best prices.

Very friendly people and honest!. We booked the greenline bus to pokhara and the are very friendly, the will welcome you with a cup of tea. The office is a little bit hard to find but the guys will get you out of the street. And if not it's a narrow street opposite the Marco Polo Guesthouse. The will make sure you have a great trip, trekking or himalaya flight

Extraordinary good job. Ammonite Adventure has done an extraordinary good job. The staff from the company has been extremely friendly. Nothing has been too much trouble for them. In fact I have been really amazed at how much time members of staff have given over to our group. I expected a much low level of contact and support. You have always been there whoever it is amongst the group, who has needed your help and advice. Thank you guys for making our expedition a memorable one.

3 pass trek. i went to kathmandu on sept 27th,2016 where i stayed at the samsara hotel (located a minute walk from the company above the himalaya) for 2 days before flying out october 1st to lukula to start my 16 day trek for the 3 passes/EBC. when the trek was done, we had a couple extra days in kathmandu for assurance to catch our flight back to canada the 20th of october.ok where to start...this will be a long one hahathe trip was my first time in nepal. it was a great time! from flying in to kathmandu, and having a fast get away from the airport by a shuttle driver(provided by the trekking company to the hotel). we drove through the crazy busy driving roads to the hotel located in the heart of thamel (a large tourist road/area). the first two days there you are taking in all the culture changes from back home, lots of polution/dust but great great people and super good foods from the locals. there is lots of the same shops down this road if you choose to buy anything, but make sure you exchange your money into RUPEES when you leave the airport or there is lots of money exchange places down the street of thamel(works out to be 1 USD is 100 rupees or 1CDN is 75 rupees). when you buy something make sure you bargain with the people as most things are always over priced.the company also provided a private tour in kathmandu to 3 of the temples. be aware that if you go on this tour of the temples that you will have to pay to get into the temple area, not like it's much but one was 1000rupees, and the others were cheap at maybe 200 rupees. but the guide for the tour knew so, so much. and it was very interesting. so i'd suggest going on this tour for an experience of the culture and religion. the trekking company was easy to find and easy to get to. peru was great and gave us a good deal on the 3 pass trek. our guide (sitaram) was great. he knew the trails very well.answered any questions that we asked along the trek. knew every mountain to tell us about. was good to take slow or fast paces that we had.the porter we had wasn't through the company, as it was a porter from the lukla area. so i would say my only issues was with him, as my rain cover to my 65l bag was ripped pretty good. but peru was happy to help accommodate this concern.but other then that the whole trekking experience was great with this company. I'm glad we went with them over others.

First time to Nepal, had a great experience. I visited Nepal from 2nd October to 10th October 2016. As it was my first time trekking in 10 years, I booked a trek with Above The Himalaya. The owner of the company, Puru, was very responsive through email, and made the entire process very easy.On the day I arrived, Immigrations took about an hour to clear. Despite the long delay, the driver was still waiting at the airport to pick me up. If you've never been to Kathmandu airport, it's pretty chaotic. It's nice that I didn't have to navigate my way over to my lodging after a 12 hour journey.The second day was a tour around Kathmandu, visiting three famous temples. Note that you have to pay the entry fees for these temples (as stated in the itinerary). Just for your information, the ticket fees were 200 Rs, 250 Rs and 1000 Rs, so bring enough cash and small change. My guide was Kumuda, and he was very knowledgeable about the history of the temples and various landmarks in Kathmandu.I have a back injury from military training a decade ago (annular tear), so decided to go with an easy trek (Annapurna Panorama View Trek; Nayapul to Ghandruk, then to Jhinu Danda, then to Pothana, then back to Pokhara). My guide and porter were Bassu and Sorus, and they were a pleasure to be with. The first day's hike was from Nayapul to Ghandruk. I am reasonably fit, but there were way more stone steps than I expected. Those of you with back injuries will know that this is bad news. At Ghandruk, Bassu came up with a new itinerary to avoid too many steps. We thus changed the remainder of the trek to Pothana, Sarangkot then Pokhara. Bassu was thus able to turn what would have been a miserable experience into something memorable and enjoyable.One regret I had was not bringing enough cash. I've just recently graduated from grad school (which was the reason for the trip) and was trying to spend as little as I could. But seriously, it felt ridiculous that I was privileged enough to travel yet still tried to scrimp on things like tea. I'd advise you to bring more cash, and in small denominations. Many of the villagers can't make change for large notes. You can use your large denominations in the supermarkets in the city before you start your trek. If, however, you're really tight on cash, be sure to check how much things cost before you use them. E.g. Wifi and hot showers cost about 100 Rs at the altitude I was at, and I didn't know until the next day when my guide told me before we left for our next checkpoint.

Back again for second time with Puru and ATH. Back in 2012 I did some trekking with Puru to Tengboche and Pochara and rated ATH excellent then. Puru and team took care of me so well I came back for a second time to climb Mera Peak in Oc 2016, Same excellent service (trekking guide, porter and this time climbing guide). Puru always checks in to see how things are going and I could always count on his people for help along the trek (14 days). Thanks again Puru, your the best!!

Family trek to Annapurna. I was traveling with my family total 5 person, 8 and 11 years old child, my wife and mom 58 years old. We did small trek in Annapurna up to Ghandruk Village loop, It was wonderful experience specially the help of our guide and porters,despite the rein and not very good weather, the trail was quite sleepery, Puru the Owner provide us best guide and porters who are very familar with children and took care every small things. We have traveled by bus between Kathmandu to Pokhara better to take flight or private vehicle when travel with children.Thank you Above the Himalaya and team to make our trip memorable.

Reliable & Flexible tour agency.. Booked a short Phoon Hill trekking & Kathmandu tour with this agency.Everything was very well arranged, from the moment of airport pick-up on the first day to last day. I was really appreciated that the managing director made an extra effort to attend to us directly. Both guide/ porter are experienced & extremely funny/chatty which made my first trip to Nepal very memorable this time.

Annapurna Base Camp. Just returned from a wonderful experience in Nepal. Above the Himalaya Trekking took great care of us from the day we landed in Kathmandu to our departure 9 days later. A one day tour of Kathmandu was very educational. The guide was knowledgeable and spoke excellent English. Our 7 day trek to Annapurna Base Camp was also outstanding. The guide and porters worked extremely hard to make sure we had a most memorable experience. They were so easy going and happy to help in any way. I will definitely be using Above the Himalaya Trekking on my next trip to Nepal!!

Nice trip. We spent few days in Kathmandu and surroundings. The team is really kind, the guide knows perfectly the Hindu and boudist religion. The driver drove very safely even if the traffic is amazing .Puru, the manager of the company is very kind also, efficient and does his best for his customers.Go with this company and let it be, they'll that you in charge for your pleasure.

Perfect Tour! . We travelled in the low season. Which I love because I prefer less crowds. The weather was quite got at times. All the hotels had a/c and wifi. The food was amazing in Nepal. My favourite food was momo! You must try it.I saw the Annapurna range in beautiful pokhara. A climb of the peace pagoda is a must. Perfect views. Puru is a lovely host. Very honest and generous. He took us to a lovely traditional restaurant so we could taste local food. It was the cherry on the cake of our experience! A trip I will never forget!

Amazing Nepal. I booked Everest Panorama Trek with Above the Himalaya Trekking, I also did tour in Kathmandu including Bhaktapur, Patan, Boudhanath Stupa and visited Dhulikhel and Pokhara including sunrise view from Sarangot. All was arrange by Above the Himalaya Trekking (Mr Puru Timalsena). Everything was well organized and all my requests were met and exceeded. If I go to Nepal again (and I will), I will book the trip with Above the Himalaya Trekking. Most people go to Nepal for trekking, the landscape is amazing, and the experience is life changing. However, Nepal offers more than trekking, Kathmandu valley have more UNISCO World Heritage sites than any country in the world. Walking in Kathmandu Durban Square, Bhaktapur, or Patan is like walking into an open museum. Also if you cannot do trekking in the mountains, you can drive to one of the hill station near Kathmandu like Nagarkot, Sarangkot, Dhulikhel and watch sunrise/sunset over the peaks of the Himalayas. In this trip I stayed in a hotel in Dhulikhel (recommended by Mr Puru) where the view is amazing overlooking terrace gardens and the Himalayan peaks in the background; adding to view, the sounds of birds singing, it is so serene. If you like more adventure, you can go on Safari in Chitwan, you can do rafting, Paragliding, and many more activities. Don’t get discourage to visit Nepal by the earthquake of 2015, Nepal is very safe, only old historic buildings seen damage but hotels and new buildings are mostly untouched. Nepal is very cheap, the people of Nepal are very friendly, and honest. Nepal is a wonderful place not only for trekking, but also for vacation.

Trip of a life time. I can happily recommend Above the Himalaya Trekking to anybody organising a trekking holiday in Nepal. The owner Puru couldn't be more helpful and the guides and porters he provided for us were the best on the trail! They took care of every small things and make us feel comfortable. The views on the trek were incredible; We already plan to visit 2018 and will not hesitate to use these guys again.

Very reliable and great guides. We did a two-day tour with them of temples and Kathmandu itself (plus Patan and Bhaktapur) and really enjoyed it. The guides and driver were very nice and did not pressure us to buy things or do things we did not want to do. We saw a lot in the two day in the Kathmandu Valley. Everything was well-organized and we enjoyed the trip a lot.

Trip of life time. We have booked Everest base camp trek with Above The Himalaya trekking, the owner Mr Puru Timalsena is very prompt in replying to our queries, we had fantastic tour guide Mr kumoda in Kathmandu, the trekking guide and Sherpa took special care of us on our 2 weeks trek to Everest base camp. The trip and trek to base camp is our best memory of our life. We highly recommend this company for trekking in Nepal Himalayas.

Amazing Experience. This was the first time I was trekking as a solo woman traveler and I decided to do the Annapurna Basecamp Trek. Puru made sure I had the best team with me, he was very accommodating, flexible and very prompt over emails. I had a guide and a porter with me, Basu and Rajesh and they made the whole trip completely joyful. They were very supportive and took care of every detail to make sure I was comfortable and well. I would highly recommend this company for any solo woman interested in trekking and I would highly recommend Basu and Rajesh as well.

Once in a life time trek to ABC with great company!!. This was an experience of a lifetime! My boyfriend and I did a 7 day trek from Nayapul to Annapurna Base Camp and back via Phedi with a guide and porter from Above the Himalaya Trekking and I would recommend them to anyone planning a trek or adventure Nepal. Prior to our trek, Puru was easy to communicate with via email, accommodating and quick to answer all of my many questions. They helped set up our transportation to/from Pokhara, helped make sure we had the correct equipment, and gave advice prior to the trek. Our guide, Basu, was extremely knowledgable and experienced. He made sure we felt safe and incredibly well taken care of during our trip. Our porter, Pharlad, was a true superman! Together, the two of them made the trek fun and looked out for us the entire time. We truly felt that the Above the Himalaya team had our best interests in mind the entire trek -- keeping us informed of every detail, being flexible to our requests, ensuring that we were taken care of in all guest houses, and teaching us about Nepali culture and language. Definitely consider booking with Above the Himalaya!

Annapurna Base Camp Trek. In April 2016, we did the Annapurna Base Camp trek with Above the Himalaya Company a very reliable and safe company.It was an amazing experience during 18 days. Everything was as expected, since we arrive at airport until we leave Nepal.The staff that was with us during this period was fantastic, helping with all the issues that happened. We stayed in very good places, with great and cordial guest houses, and very good food.During the planning, Mr Puru always answered cordially our questions in a short period of time that increased our confidence in the company.For sure we want to repeat this adventure! Next time into the Everest Region.
An unforgettable experience with Above the Hymalaya Trekking tour.. Well-organized trip with friendly guide name Gyan Magar. Thank you Puru & your team for everything you have done for me.

Annapurna Base camp Trekking,. we have done Annapurna base camp trekking on early march,it was best experience for us from the help of Above the Himalaya Trekking we had an absolutely wonderful trip!i would highly recommend this company!

Professional and friendly trek agency. While I was planning for ABC trek in December, I found Above the Himalaya through trip advisor. It was a pleasant experience from the moment I have contacted Mr Puru. He has answered each and every question I had very patiently. They have arranged A-Z of my trip right from pick up to dropping back at the air port. When we were running short of money he helped us like a friend assuring that it is all okay. He even rearranged our hotels when we opted to extend our stay in Pokhara.With respect to the trek guide(Basu) and support person(Prahlad) they very knowledgeable of the history and terrain. They took us to the best lodges on the trail where we enjoyed the top notch hospitality of Nepaleese cuisine and culture.Overall I can strongly recommend Above the Himalaya to anyone willing to trek in Nepal. Cheers and keep up the good work.

Nepal and Bhutan Holiday. We were looking at doing a Nepal and Bhutan holiday and were about to book when the big earthquake hit last April. We considered changing out plan to go there in a few years and do somewhere else instead for our Christmas/New Year trip. However we decided that it would be better to support the Nepalese community now with our tourist dollars, rather than wait until things started to get back to normal, and I'm glad we did.I looked at lots of different companies to run a tour for my wife and I, and decided that we would prefer a local company rather than one based here in Australia. Not only were they cheaper, but to have true locals organising and running the tour I thought would be the better option, and I'm confident it was. From the get go Puru was excellent at helping me sort out our overall itinerary, advising what we should do each day, where we should go etc. I honestly left it all to Puru, when we arrived I didn't even know the name of the hotel we were staying at the first night - that was the amount of trust I had in his ability - and he deserved it.My wife and I had a total of 15 days traveling, including a 5 day trip in the middle to Bhutan. My advice to everyone is if you're going all the way to Nepal, spend a few days in Bhutan as well.
