Absolutely wonderful, all round!. We went to Nepal in a group of 5, and we had the most wonderful trip! We had the entire trip organized before we got there, and never had to worry about a thing. They do a brilliant job in all aspects of the tour!. this was my first time to nepal and they basically organised the entire trip for myself and some friends. excellent customer service, very friendly and helpful. they can plan to your likes/dislikes and make it very easy for you. if it wernt for them we would have been completly lost and out of element! the guys are very helpful and willing to cater to your needs. i still have Balaram on facebook and talk with him frequently! they were able to organise activities such as bungee jumping, mountain biking, a 2 night white water rafting camp, trekking, paragliding, mt everest flight and i throughly enjoyed all of them. i would deffinately recommend Thamel travels and tours. they provide an splendid mix of fun, relaxation, adrenaline and bliss. all the components which make Nepal such a magnificent place.

Wonderful 8 days Gateway at Khatmandu, Phokara & Dhampush. I had a wonderful trip to Nepal. We travel in a group of 6 people consisting of 2 couples & 2 singles. It was our first time to Nepal and overall, we had a fun and memorable stay. In terms of accommodation, it was good in Khatmandu. Our stay was at Moonlight Hotel which was situated in the town of Thamel. Convenient for bargain shopping & sightseeing of the locals. We found 2 Halal restaurants around Thamel but we only dine at Anatolia most of the time as we only found the other one on our last night in Thamel. The food there was good. Our next stop was Phokara. I really liked our hotel in phokara. I must say that it was the best amongst all our stay. Equivalent to a 4* anytime. New, comfortable and up to international standard. Hotel name is Mt. Khailash Resort. However our stay at Anu Guesthouse (w/o aircond, fan or tv) was the most fun amongst all our stay in Nepal as we really get to enjoy our company together without gadgets interfering our attention to our friends. Our 2D1N trekking around Dhampush valley and hills plus the magnificent view if Anapurna Mt. was the highlight of our journey. Our guides speaks fluent English and was very helpful and descriptive in their explanations. We visited many heritage sites and both Buddhist and Hindu temples and did many unplanned activities such as cycling and ultra flight. We will definitely come to visit Nepal again one day.

They know how to serve their guests!. This month I led a group of 08 college students to my home Nepal; Kathmandu, Pokhara and Chitwan tours. All of them were my friends from my university. It was altogether 10 days in Nepal. The arrangements from Thamel Tours was just perfect. All the activities including mountain flight, white water rafting in Trishuli river, Paragliding in Pokhara was really a life time experiences. He could suggest these activities in just first enquiries with details of my group members. Balaram proved much experienced leader in this respect. Even all his team members including guide, and driver were excellent. Thank you Balaram for your kind support. I definitely will be back with another group next season and expect the same this time too.

upper mustang trek and chitwan nationalpark. This was my fifth time in Nepal and had always wanted to go to Lo-Manthang in upper Mustang. This time I along with my three other friends went on a 20 days trek to Thorong -La and Lo- Manthang. I was always scared of the costs involved but now it is become much easier as there are tea houses available along the trekking trails. We did not have to carry tents or hire cooks, and extra porters. So the budget was similar to other normal trekking routes except permit fees ($500 per person on top of other trekking expenses). Balaram, the owner at Thamel tours, suggested me to go on a tea house trek. He was very helpful with all the information and also provided us company's best crew team (guide and porters) during the trek.

Flexibility and reliability is the best!. My family of 5 people (me, my husband, and 3 children ) did 8nights All Nepal tours wit7 1 days hiking with Thamel Tours november last year. Balaram has done his best to comfort our stay as much as possible. This man is incredible! He is really honest, flexible, and timely. Initially our trip was planned as 2nights in kathmandu, 3nights in Pokhara with one night in Dhampus, 2nights in Chitwan and 1 last night back in Kathmandu. In the mean time we wanted to stay one more night in Pokhara and Balaram managed it in one text message with no extra charges! Very flexible. Subsequently we stayed only one night in Chitwan national park. The hotel in Kathmandu, Pokhara and Chitwan were the best! Everything perfect in its category. We stayed Hotel Shanker in kathmandu, Mt Kailash Resort in Pokhara and Hotel Parkland in Chitwan. Even the tea house in Dhampus was with attached bathroom.We found Balaram and his team to be very professional and flexible. We had asked few agencies in kathmandu for the trip and the rate Balaram quoted us was the best in respect to the services. This is the place to contact if you want to realiability, flexibility, and the best rates!Sarima and family.

3-day hike in Kathmandu Valley. We went on a nice 3-day hike Sankhu-Nagarkot-Dhulikhel-Namo Buddha-Panauti. It was very well organised and good value for money, with reasonable/good accommodation in Nagarkot and Dhulikhel. The guide was very friendly and knowledgeable and the manager Balaram was always very efficient at answering emails.Although the walk itself was relatively easy, it involved some uphill and downhill stretches, so you should be reasonably fit (second and third day about 5-6 hours).The food in the hotels is relatively expensive, but it is possible to eat out in local restaurants for a much cheaper price.If you want nice views of the high mountains, it's probably better to go in autumn (October-November).

excellent service, fair price, beyond expectations!. My husband and I ended up choosing this tour company for our 10-day trip to Nepal through Tripadvisor reviews. And the company is exactly as wonderful as all the other reviewers said and more. From my first email exchange with the owner Balaram to the last day of our 10-day trip to Nepal, Balaram has never stopped to be responsive, patient, flexible, and overall we feel he's a kind guy with a smile on his face and good work ethics and he was never pushy and try to talk us into buying things or doing things so he can earn a bit more money. (that could be very stressful if your guide always wants to do that)Before the trip, I exchanged countless emails with Balaram to pin down our itinerary. He was very patient and thorough when answering my questions. He also has the best price that I found. you might worry, lower price means lower quality? Amazingly, this is definitely not the case, I might even said, other higher price company may not offer as good a service as Thamel Tours.We ended up going to various places in Kathmandu, Pokhara, Nargakot, and did a bit of trekking. The trekking guide Balaram hired for us in Pokhara, Laxman, is just as wonderful and thoughtful. At the end of our trip, we thought, if we came to Nepal, without a good and trustworthy guide like Balaram, our trip could easily turn into a nightmare. We actually felt very lucky that we found this company and Balaram on tripadvisor! we highly recommend this tour company.
